original: kha cig 'jig rten pa'i lam nas 'das nas rjes su dpag pa smra ba gang yin pa de 'gegs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: kha cig 'jig rten pa'i lam nas 'das nas rjes su dpag pa smra ba gang yin pa de 'gegs pa yin no zhes bya ba 'dis dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Some say that this passage refutes the assertion that one can infer the existence of the self from the worldly perspective.

original: sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: sun dbyung ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: In order to refute that, the root text says, â€œThe worldly perspective is not valid cognition,â€ and so on.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs rtogs zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la sogs rtogs zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: â€œ Not differentâ€ is connected to â€œthe understanding of reasons and so on.â€

original: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sgras rang bzhin bzung la /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pa'i sgras rang bzhin bzung la /
translated: The terms â€œeffectâ€ and so on include â€œnature.â€

original: de bzhin du gtan tshigs la sogs pa 'dir yang rang bzhin bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gtan tshigs la sogs pa 'dir yang rang bzhin bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, in the present context, the terms â€œreasonâ€ and so on refer only to â€œnature.â€

original: mang po'i tshig ni gsal ba tha dad pas so //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni gsal ba tha dad pas so //
translated: The plural terms are used because there are different types of reasons.

original: de'i bdag nyid dar de las byung ba'i 'brel ba'i rtags gang kho na las 'jig rten don rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid kho bo cag gis rtags su brjod de /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dar de las byung ba'i 'brel ba'i rtags gang kho na las 'jig rten don rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid kho bo cag gis rtags su brjod de /
translated: We use as reasons only those reasons that are related to the probandum in such a way that the probandum is of the same nature as the reason or is an effect of the reason. It is from these reasons that worldly people understand the probandum.

original: de khas blangs pa na gang zhig rjes su dpag pa nyid 'gegs par 'gyur ba ci zhig dor bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de khas blangs pa na gang zhig rjes su dpag pa nyid 'gegs par 'gyur ba ci zhig dor bar 'gyur /
translated: If you accept that, then what is it that you reject when you say that you reject inference?

original: ci ste yang kho bo cag rjes su dpag pa cung zad cig 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang kho bo cag rjes su dpag pa cung zad cig 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that we do not assert any inference at all,

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyis de tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo'i don med par mi 'gyur ro snyam na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyis de tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa de khas blangs pa'i phyir kho bo'i don med par mi 'gyur ro snyam na 'dir smras pa /
translated: but rather, because others assert that to be a valid cognition, our purpose is not lost, then in response to that, it is said:

original: tshad ma min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma min pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is not a valid cognition, etc.

original: gzhan gyi don tshad mar khas blangs so zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ga las 'byung /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don tshad mar khas blangs so zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ga las 'byung /
translated: Where is the certainty that â€œthe otherâ€™s purpose is asserted to be a valid cognitionâ€?

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: The otherâ€™s assertion is not a direct perception.

original: gang gis nges par 'gyur ba khyed la tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis nges par 'gyur ba khyed la tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And you do not have another valid cognition that would ascertain it.

original: nges pa yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma ma yin pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de ci'i phyir gzhan rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: nges pa yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma ma yin pa gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de ci'i phyir gzhan rtogs par byed de /
translated: Even if it were ascertained, why would the otherâ€™s assertion, which is not a valid cognition, cause the other to understand?

original: 'di zhen pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhen pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not.

original: ci ste yang dgra'i lag pa nas ral gri phrogs te de nyid kyis dgra bo de gsod pa de zhin du gzhan gyis tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyid bzung nas gzhan sel bar byed do snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /ğŸ”½tshad ma min pas byas pa yi //
analyzed: ci ste yang dgra'i lag pa nas ral gri phrogs te de nyid kyis dgra bo de gsod pa de zhin du gzhan gyis tshad ma nyid du khas blangs pa gang yin pa de nyid bzung nas gzhan sel bar byed do snyam du dogs pa bsu nas / tshad ma min pas byas pa yi //
translated: In response to this, the root text states,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: â€œThat which is produced by invalid cognition.â€

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te rmongs pas gzhan gyi tshad ma ma yin pa nyid tshad mar byas na bzung ba'i tshad ma ma yin pa de las ji ltar gzhan gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa skyed par nus te /
analyzed: gal te rmongs pas gzhan gyi tshad ma ma yin pa nyid tshad mar byas na bzung ba'i tshad ma ma yin pa de las ji ltar gzhan gyi yang dag pa'i shes pa skyed par nus te /
translated: If one were to mistakenly take the invalid cognition of others to be valid cognition, then how could one generate a correct cognition in others on the basis of that invalid cognition that one has apprehended?

original: tshad ma ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni yang dag pa'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because valid cognition is the cause of correct cognition.

original: rmongs pa'i ral gri'o snyam nas /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i ral gri'o snyam nas /
translated: One might think that the sword of delusion is like that.

original: @40b bzung ba'i gcod byed gang yang rung bas gzhan gcod par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @40b bzung ba'i gcod byed gang yang rung bas gzhan gcod par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir dpe mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not similar to the example, because one cannot cut others with any sword that one has apprehended.

original: de kho na nyid kyi 'grel bshad las rnam phug pas /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi 'grel bshad las rnam phug pas /

original: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pas ci'i phyir gzhan rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma ma yin pas ci'i phyir gzhan rtogs par byed de /
translated: But why would it cause others to understand through a nonvalid cognition?

original: de gnyi ga la grub pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la grub pa ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mi rigs te /

original: gang gi phyir tshig gi bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas smra ba po dag la tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig gi bdag nyid kyi rjes su dpag pas smra ba po dag la tshad ma yin la /

original: yang smra ba po des gzhan rtogs par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang smra ba po des gzhan rtogs par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And the proponent does not cause others to understand through that,

original: 'bras bu ni gzhan don rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar gnyis la grub par dogs pa med do zhes zer ba'i dogs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gzhan don rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar gnyis la grub par dogs pa med do zhes zer ba'i dogs pa /
translated: because the purpose of the result is to cause others to understand, so there is no doubt that it must be established for both parties.

original: tshig gis bdag nyid rjes su dpag / ces bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu'o //
analyzed: tshig gis bdag nyid rjes su dpag / ces bya ba la sogs pas dogs pa bsu'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is stated beginning with â€œThe verbal nature of the inference.â€

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to the verbal nature.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni smra ba'o //
translated: â€œThisâ€ refers to the proponent.

original: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de tshig ni smra ba po la ltos nas nus pa ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de tshig ni smra ba po la ltos nas nus pa ston pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The refutation of the opponentâ€™s position is stated in the lines beginning â€œIf you say itâ€™s not a means of valid cognition because itâ€™s not a means of knowing the unknown.â€ The words of a statement do not reveal the statementâ€™s capacity, so they are not accepted as a means of valid cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is?

original: mi shes pa'i don bsal bar mi byed pa las so //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i don bsal bar mi byed pa las so //

original: 'di la nus pa ston pa nyid kyang yod de /
analyzed: 'di la nus pa ston pa nyid kyang yod de /

original: khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa ni nus pa ston pa ma yin pas 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis rjes su dpag pa ni nus pa ston pa ma yin pas 'di ni mtshungs pa ma yin te /

original: de lta ma yin na gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, both would be established.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is reasonable that whatever is reasonable is a means of valid cognition in all cases, just like perception.

original: de lta bas na rigs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du tshad ma nyid du rigs te mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad du tshad ma nyid du rigs te mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rjes su dpag pa brtag pa ste nyi shu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las rjes su dpag pa brtag pa ste nyi shu gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-third chapter, on inference, in the Commentary on the Compendium of Principles.

original: // / da ni tshad ma gnyis kyis nges par bsgrub pa'i don du grangs las log par rtog pa bsal ba ni /
analyzed: // / da ni tshad ma gnyis kyis nges par bsgrub pa'i don du grangs las log par rtog pa bsal ba ni /

original: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: If you say that the two authorities are not established, etc.

original: 'dis ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ma khyab pa'i skyon dang / tshad ma gnyis kyis gtan la phab ces bya ba 'di la gnyis su nges par gzung bar 'bras bu med pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ma khyab pa'i skyon dang / tshad ma gnyis kyis gtan la phab ces bya ba 'di la gnyis su nges par gzung bar 'bras bu med pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: This explains that the fault of the non-pervasion of the definition of authority and the statement â€œestablished by the two authoritiesâ€ are both meaningless.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed pa yin te /
translated: He replies with â€œIf you say, etc.

original: 'di yi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di yi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is included in these two authorities.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gnyis po 'di nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma gnyis po 'di nyid kyi'o //
translated: This is the two authorities.

original: ji skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is as has been stated:

analyzed: tshad ma nyid las gzhan la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba nyid med pa yin la /
translated: Apart from the authorities, there is no other definition of authority, namely, non-deceptiveness.

original: yod na yang @41a * //
analyzed: yod na yang @41a * //
translated: And even if there were,

analyzed: 'di nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan zhes logs shig tu mi brjod do //

original: de la ji ltar gzhan dag tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de la ji ltar gzhan dag tshad ma ma yin pa'am /
translated: How do others establish that these are not valid cognitions or,

analyzed: tshad ma yin na'ang 'di dag gi gang du ji ltar 'du ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis sgrub par byed de /
translated: if they are valid cognitions, how and where they are included?

original: de la sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / don gyis go ba dang / rigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / srid pa zhes grags pa dang snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sgra las byung ba dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / don gyis go ba dang / rigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dang / srid pa zhes grags pa dang snyam du sems pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to that, the other valid cognitions that are renowned are those called derived from scripture, comparison, analogy, reasoning, nonapprehension, and what is renowned in the world.

original: tshad ma gzhan dag gis khas blangs pa zhes de la /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan dag gis khas blangs pa zhes de la /
translated: The thought is that these are accepted as other valid cognitions.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, from the perspective of their cause,

original: gzhan gyi klog gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi klog gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, â€œthose that arise from another,â€ and so on.

original: de la ri khrod rje na re sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgra'i shes pa las skabs kyi don shes pa ni sgra las byung ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de la ri khrod rje na re sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgra'i shes pa las skabs kyi don shes pa ni sgra las byung ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: With regard to that, Ri khrod rje says that the definition of that derived from scripture is â€œthat which is derived from the meaning of the words of a statement.â€

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa las dus phyis lkog tu gyur pa'i don la skye ba gang yin pa de ni sgra las 'ongs pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa las dus phyis lkog tu gyur pa'i don la skye ba gang yin pa de ni sgra las 'ongs pa'i phyir sgra las byung ba yin no //
translated: That which arises later, with regard to a meaning that is hidden, from the apprehension of the intrinsic identity of a word, is inference from a statement, because it comes from a statement.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgras bskyed pa dang / yid ches pa'i skyes bus tshig gis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i sgras bskyed pa dang / yid ches pa'i skyes bus tshig gis bskyed pa'o //
translated: that produced by a statement of a word that is not produced by a person, and that produced by a statement of a trustworthy person.

original: 'di yang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di yang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir mngon sum las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: This is also different from perception, because it has a hidden object.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference,

original: tshul gsum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the trimodal mark.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i chos kyi khyad par du byas pa'i chos can lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it has a hidden object, the subject that is qualified by the predicate of the proposition,

original: mngon sum las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: it is different from perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te tshul gsum nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te tshul gsum nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not inference, because it does not have the trimodal mark.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can rjes su dpag par bya bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub bya'i chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can rjes su dpag par bya bar 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus, it is the subject that is qualified by the property to be established that is held to be the object to be inferred,

original: 'ba' zhig pa ma yin la chos tsam yang ma yin te /ğŸ”½ji srid du de'i chos nyid kyi chos can gyi yul can gyi bdag nges par ma bzung ba de srid du rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa ma yin la chos tsam yang ma yin te / ji srid du de'i chos nyid kyi chos can gyi yul can gyi bdag nges par ma bzung ba de srid du rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: not just the subject alone, nor just the property.ğŸ”½As long as the subject, which is the locus of the property to be established, is not ascertained, it is impossible for the inference to engage it.

original: ji srid du phyogs kyi chos ma bzung ba de srid du rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji srid du phyogs kyi chos ma bzung ba de srid du rjes su dpag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that as long as the property of the subject is not apprehended, there is no inference.

original: ci'i phyir phyogs kyi chos de nyid nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyogs kyi chos de nyid nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the property of the subject is not ascertained?

original: 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: gang yang sgra 'di la shing la sogs pa'i chos can btags pa de nyid gzhal bya yin te /
analyzed: gang yang sgra 'di la shing la sogs pa'i chos can btags pa de nyid gzhal bya yin te /
translated: That very thing to which the word â€œtreeâ€ is applied is the object to be evaluated,

original: de nyid rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is that very thing which is to be understood.

original: 'dir chos can nyid gzhal bya yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir chos can nyid gzhal bya yin gyi /
translated: Here, the subject itself is the object to be evaluated,

original: chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can ni ma yin no @41b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos kyis khyad par du byas pa'i chos can ni ma yin no @41b zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not a subject that is distinguished by a property.

original: chos can de nyid ma bzung na ste /
analyzed: chos can de nyid ma bzung na ste /
translated: If the subject itself is not apprehended,

original: ma nges na ji ltar de'i chos nges pa yin /
analyzed: ma nges na ji ltar de'i chos nges pa yin /
translated: how can its property be ascertained?

original: gzhan yang gal te chos can 'di phyogs kyi chos nges pa las sngar shes pa de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa nges pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te chos can 'di phyogs kyi chos nges pa las sngar shes pa de'i tshe phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa nges pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med do //
translated: Moreover, if the subject is known prior to the ascertainment of the property of the subject, then the effort to ascertain the property of the subject and so on is fruitless.

original: 'bad pa thams cad ni chos can rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin na /
analyzed: 'bad pa thams cad ni chos can rtogs par bya ba'i don du yin na /
translated: For all effort is for the sake of understanding the subject.

original: de rtogs nas de phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa nges pa'i 'bad pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de rtogs nas de phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa nges pa'i 'bad pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Having understood that, what is the use of the effort to ascertain the property of the subject and so on?

original: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is also stated by implication.

original: sgra ni shing la sogs pa chos can gyi chos ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni shing la sogs pa chos can gyi chos ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not a property of a subject such as a tree,

original: smra ba po yul du nges par bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba po yul du nges par bzung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the speaker is ascertained as the object.

original: de ltar re zhig phyogs kyi chos nyid med par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phyogs kyi chos nyid med par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first the absence of the property of the subject is shown.

original: da ni rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rjes su 'gro ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there is no concomitance, he says:

original: gzhal byas sgra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhal byas sgra la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThe word is not concomitant with the object of cognitionâ€ and so on.

original: nges par rtogs pa ni gtan la phab pa'o //ğŸ”½bya bas zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pa ni gtan la phab pa'o // bya bas zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste /
translated: â€œAscertainmentâ€ is determination.ğŸ”½â€œBy the actionâ€ means by the existence.

original: yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yod pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: by the presence.

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the sense of the statement.

original: yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin gyi yod pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin gyi yod pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is existence that is concomitant, not non-existence.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir / gang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:ğŸ”½â€œWhere there is smoke, there is fireâ€ and so on.

original: gang gi phyir gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod pa de'i phyir me 'di du ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang na du ba yod pa de na gdon mi za bar me yod pa de'i phyir me 'di du ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Because where there is smoke, there is fire, therefore fire is concomitant with smoke.

original: de bzhin du sgra don dang rjes su 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra don dang rjes su 'gro ba med do //
translated: In the same way, the word is not concomitant with the object of cognition.

original: ji ltar med ces bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar med ces bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how it is not, he says:

original: re zhig ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba smos te /

original: re zhig sgras non pa'i yul der don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sgras non pa'i yul der don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: First of all, the object of cognition is not present in the place that is occupied by the word.

original: 'di ltar shing tog 'bra go la sogs pa'i sgra grong khyer dmar bu can la sogs pa gzhan du thos na yang yul de na shing tog 'bra go la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shing tog 'bra go la sogs pa'i sgra grong khyer dmar bu can la sogs pa gzhan du thos na yang yul de na shing tog 'bra go la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even if the sound of such things as mangoes is heard in other places, such as the city of PÄá¹­aliputra, the mangoes do not exist in that place.

analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i dus na yang gdon mi za bar don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, when there is sound, the object definitely does not exist.

original: 'di ltar rgyal po de li pa dang mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa'i sgra da ltar ba yin la byung zin pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir don gyi sgra rjes su 'gro bar byed pa ga las yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal po de li pa dang mang pos bkur ba la sogs pa'i sgra da ltar ba yin la byung zin pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir don gyi sgra rjes su 'gro bar byed pa ga las yin /

original: ci ste sgra rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir dus thams cad du gnas pas don dang lhan cig dus tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ci ste sgra rnams ni rtag pa'i phyir dus thams cad du gnas pas don dang lhan cig dus tha dad pa ma yin la /

analyzed: yul tha dad pa nyid kyang ma yin te /

original: yul thams cad non par gnas pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thams cad non par gnas pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //

translated: then that is not so.ğŸ”½Because permanence and pervasion

original: nyid ni sgra thams cad las mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid ni sgra thams cad las mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: are the same in all words,

original: so sor nges pa'i sgras so sor nges pa'i don brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i sgras so sor nges pa'i don brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a specific word will not express a specific meaning.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

analyzed: sgra gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gis don thams cad brjod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: des don dang lhan cig yul lam dus thams cad du sgra de mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa de bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed mi 'byung bde ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: des don dang lhan cig yul lam dus thams cad du sgra de mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa de bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed mi 'byung bde ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir zhes bya bas mjug bsdus nas tshad ma ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya bas mjug bsdus nas tshad ma ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, having concluded with the word â€œtherefore,â€ he teaches the valid means of knowledge.

original: sgra las byung ba rjes dpag min //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba rjes dpag min //
translated: Inference does not arise from words.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya ston pa'o //

original: mngon sum bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //

translated: â€œBecause it is devoid of the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.

analyzed: bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof of the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ means â€œbecause it is free from such an object.â€

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /

translated: â€œBecause it is free from the trimodal conditionsâ€ is the reason.ğŸ”½â€œBecause it is devoid of such an objectâ€ is the proof

original: tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a valid cognition, like direct perception.

original: de skad du yang ri khrod rje na re mtho ris 'dod pas mchod bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di las mtho ris 'byung ngam mi 'byung snyam pa'i the tshom gyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad du yang ri khrod rje na re mtho ris 'dod pas mchod bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di las mtho ris 'byung ngam mi 'byung snyam pa'i the tshom gyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The master of the forest says: â€œThe word â€˜worshipâ€™ in the expression â€˜one who desires heaven should worshipâ€™ does not convey the meaning of heaven by virtue of a doubt as to whether or not it conveys the meaning of heaven.

original: nges pa'i shes pa 'di ni log par mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gang zhig skye nas zhig pa des //
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa 'di ni log par mi 'gyur ro // gang zhig skye nas zhig pa des //
translated: This cognition is not erroneous.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de ni log pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba de ni log pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: The cognition that arises from the words â€˜he who was born as Devadatta is now Devadattaâ€™ is not erroneous.

original: 'di ni yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci log ma yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin du yin no //ğŸ”½gang yang 'jig rten pa'i tshig de yid ches pa'i skyes bu las sam /
analyzed: 'di ni yul gzhan dang dus gzhan dang skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci log ma yin pa de'i phyir de bzhin du yin no // gang yang 'jig rten pa'i tshig de yid ches pa'i skyes bu las sam /
translated: This is not erroneous with respect to another object, another time, or another person. Therefore, it is as we have said.ğŸ”½If you say that the word â€˜heavenâ€™ is a word of ordinary usage,

original: dbang po'i yul yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul yin no zhe na ni /
translated: or that it is the object of the senses,

original: de bzhin du yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yin pa nyid do //
translated: then it is as we have said.ğŸ”½If you say that it is not a word of ordinary usage,

original: ci ste yid ches pa ma yin pa las sam /
analyzed: ci ste yid ches pa ma yin pa las sam /
translated: or that it is not the object of the senses,

original: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i skyes bu de'i blo las byung ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i skyes bu de'i blo las byung ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that arises from that person, whose object is not a sense object, is not a valid cognition.

original: skyes bu tsam ni shes par mi nus so zhes zer @42b ro ;
analyzed: skyes bu tsam ni shes par mi nus so zhes zer @42b ro ;
translated: One cannot know a mere person.

original: ; de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de yang byed pa po med pa'i dang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang po de la mtshan nyid mi srid pa'i skyon 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: ; de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas de yang byed pa po med pa'i dang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang po de la mtshan nyid mi srid pa'i skyon 'chad pa yin no //
translated: He explains the error that the first characteristic, which is the meaning of the words â€œwithout an agentâ€ and â€œwithout action,â€ is impossible:

original: byed pa po med pa'i tshig ni srid pa nyid ma yin te /ğŸ”½khyad par byed pa skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i tshig ni srid pa nyid ma yin te / khyad par byed pa skad cig ma 'jig pa bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Words without an agent are not possible.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: Because the momentariness of the thing that is the basis of the distinction has already been established, or because of the reasoning that will be explained.

original: srid pa yin na yang de'i don dang ldan pa nyid mi srid de /
analyzed: srid pa yin na yang de'i don dang ldan pa nyid mi srid de /
translated: Even if they were possible, it would be impossible for them to have that meaning.

original: de'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i tshig las lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang mi srid pa'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir byed pa po med pa'i tshig las lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang mi srid pa'i phyir tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi srid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since both the agent and the object of cognition, which is a hidden object, are impossible, the definition of valid cognition is impossible.

original: yang ji ltar byed pa po med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar byed pa po med ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is the agent impossible?

original: nus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nus dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œIf it has the capacity . . . â€ and so on.

original: de la byed pa po med pa'i dbang du 'gyur na shes pa skyed par byed pa la nus par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de la byed pa po med pa'i dbang du 'gyur na shes pa skyed par byed pa la nus par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it were the case that the agent does not exist, then the object of cognition would have the capacity to produce cognition,

original: res 'ga' mi nus pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: res 'ga' mi nus pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: or it would sometimes be incapable of doing so. These are the two alternatives.

original: phyogs dang po nus pa'i rang bzhin de rjes su 'jug pa nyid rtag tu de las byung ba'i shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po nus pa'i rang bzhin de rjes su 'jug pa nyid rtag tu de las byung ba'i shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first case, that nature which has the capacity would always be engaged, and cognition would arise from it.

original: de la sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang byas pa la nus pa thogs pa med pa de ni de byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang byas pa la nus pa thogs pa med pa de ni de byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever has an unobstructed capacity to perform an action is the agent of that action,

original: rgyu tshogs pa tha ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa tha ma bzhin no //
translated: like the final collection of causes.

original: byed pa po med pa'i tshig kyang shes pa skyed pa la dus thams cad du nus pa thogs pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i tshig kyang shes pa skyed pa la dus thams cad du nus pa thogs pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The argument from the nature of the case is that the word, which has no personal author, is always and everywhere unobstructed in its power to produce an understanding.

original: yang na gang gi rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni 'byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang gi rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni 'byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: Or, the argument from the nature of the case is that whatever has all its causes complete is produced,

original: rgyu ma tshangs ba med pa'i myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshangs ba med pa'i myu gu bzhin no //
translated: like a sprout whose causes are complete.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa las byung ba'i shes pa yang rgyu ma tshangs ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //ğŸ”½phyogs nyis pa la yang nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin de dus thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa las byung ba'i shes pa yang rgyu ma tshangs ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so // phyogs nyis pa la yang nus pa med pa'i rang bzhin de dus thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: And the understanding that arises from what is not made by a personal author has all its causes complete.

original: nam yang de las byung ba'i shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang de las byung ba'i shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In the second case, the argument from the nature of the case is that the word, whose nature is powerless, is never the source of an understanding, because that nature is always and everywhere operative.

original: rgyu ma tshangs ba'i myu gu bzhin no //ğŸ”½ji ltar don dang ldan pa nyid mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshangs ba'i myu gu bzhin no // ji ltar don dang ldan pa nyid mi 'thad ce na /
translated: It is like a sprout whose causes are incomplete.ğŸ”½How is it that it is not tenable that the word has a meaning?

original: ji ltar log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar log pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œHow can there be a false word?â€

original: phyin ci log gi don can nam bden pa'i don can nyid kyis te rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi don dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi don can nam bden pa'i don can nyid kyis te rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi don dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: It has two kinds of objects: objects that are erroneous and objects that are true.

original: phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po gsum pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the meaning of the two causes, because it has the meaning of the opposite or the true, and because there is no third alternative.ğŸ”½The cause of the two kinds of meaningful speech is virtue and vice.

original: don dang ldan pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i rgyu yang yon tan dang skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nges te //ğŸ”½'di ltar de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes @43a * //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa rnam pa gnyis po de'i rgyu yang yon tan dang skyon yin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis nges te // 'di ltar de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i skyes @43a * //
translated: This is ascertained by positive and negative concomitance.

original: bu ni brdzun du smra bar mthong la /ğŸ”½yang dag pa nyid dang log pa gnyis kyi rgyu yon tan dang nyes pa de dag gi rten ni skyes bu yin no //
analyzed: bu ni brdzun du smra bar mthong la / yang dag pa nyid dang log pa gnyis kyi rgyu yon tan dang nyes pa de dag gi rten ni skyes bu yin no //
translated: Thus, a person who has the vice of attachment, etc. is seen to tell lies.ğŸ”½The basis of the two causes, the true and the opposite, is a person.ğŸ”½If that is so, then when a person is opposite, the basis of those virtues and vices is a person.

original: de lta yin dang skyes bu log na yon tan dang nyes pa de dag gi rten ni skyes bu yin no yon tan dang ldan pa log na yang dag pa log pa nyid dag kyang med de /
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyes bu log na yon tan dang nyes pa de dag gi rten ni skyes bu yin no yon tan dang ldan pa log na yang dag pa log pa nyid dag kyang med de /
translated: When a person with virtues is opposite, the true and the opposite are also nonexistent.

original: de med na rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med na rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is not so, then since there is no other alternative, the words of the Buddha would be meaningless,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they would have no cause.

original: rgyu med par ni 'bras bu srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med par ni 'bras bu srid pa ma yin te /
translated: An effect is not possible without a cause,

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would have no cause.

original: de bas na yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yul dang dus dang rdzas la sogs pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be ascertained as to place, time, substance, and so on.

original: 'di ni thal bar sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thal bar sgrub par byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be regarded as a reductio argument.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: rang rgyud kyis sgrub par byed na mthong ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /ğŸ”½'di ltar / mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: rang rgyud kyis sgrub par byed na mthong ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te / 'di ltar / mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg bya //
translated: then it would contradict what is seen, if it were established by an autonomous syllogism.ğŸ”½Thus,ğŸ”½one would understand the meaning from statements such as â€œOne who desires heaven should make burnt offerings,â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag las don rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag las don rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid dmigs pa yin te /
translated: because it is observed that

original: mthong ba ni bskyod par nus pa ma yin la byed pa po med pa nyid ni gnyi ga la grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba ni bskyod par nus pa ma yin la byed pa po med pa nyid ni gnyi ga la grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang yin no //
translated: Seeing is not capable of moving, and the absence of an agent is not established for both parties, so the reason is not established.

original: 'dir gnyi ga yang thal bar sgrub par byed pa blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gnyi ga yang thal bar sgrub par byed pa blta bar bya ste /
translated: Here, both are established by reductio.

original: 'di ltar gal te rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe don med pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du khas len pa de'i tshe don med pa nyid du khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Thus, if one accepts that the Veda is not created by a person, then one must accept that it is meaningless.

original: don dang ldan pa'i rgyu skyes bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i rgyu skyes bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no person as a cause that has a purpose.

original: don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not meaningless.

original: de lta bas na skyes bus byas pa nyid yin no zhes thal bar 'gyur bas bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na skyes bus byas pa nyid yin no zhes thal bar 'gyur bas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the reductio is: â€œIt follows that it is created by a person.â€

original: thal bar sgrub par byed pa 'di nyid sgrub pa po'i don du mthong ba dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa sngon du bsu nas don rtogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thal bar sgrub par byed pa 'di nyid sgrub pa po'i don du mthong ba dang mi 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir dogs pa sngon du bsu nas don rtogs phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show that this reductio is not contradictory to the belief of the defender, anticipating the opponentâ€™s question, he says, â€œIn order to understand the meaning,â€ and so on.

original: gal te min zhes bya ba ni don med pa zhes bya ba dang sgrol lo //
analyzed: gal te min zhes bya ba ni don med pa zhes bya ba dang sgrol lo //
translated: If you say â€œno,â€ then it is meaningless.

original: de lta yin na dam bca' ba mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na dam bca' ba mthong ba dang 'gal ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the thesis contradicts what is seen.

original: gal te rig byed las rig byed kyi don rtogs pa nye bar bstan pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur na mthong ba dang 'gal ba bden par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rig byed las rig byed kyi don rtogs pa nye bar bstan pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur na mthong ba dang 'gal ba bden par 'gyur na /
translated: If the meaning of the Vedas were to arise without teaching, then it would be true that the thesis contradicts what is seen.

original: gang gi phyir 'di don rtogs par bstan pa las brda'i dbang gis 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di don rtogs par bstan pa las brda'i dbang gis 'gyur gyi /
translated: But the meaning of the Vedas is understood through teaching, and it arises through the power of convention.

original: brda la ma ltos pa'i rig byed 'ga' zhig las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brda la ma ltos pa'i rig byed 'ga' zhig las ni ma yin te /
translated: The Vedas do not arise without relying on convention.

original: 'di ltar rig byed kyi don dpyod pa la @43b sogs pa'i rang gi 'dod pas brjod par mthong gi don gyi rang bzhin skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed kyi don dpyod pa la @43b sogs pa'i rang gi 'dod pas brjod par mthong gi don gyi rang bzhin skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid du rig pa ma yin no //
translated: This is because when the meaning of the Vedas is analyzed, it is seen that it is expressed according to the desire of the individual, and it is not known to be the nature of the object that accords with the desire of the individual.

original: de la 'di snyam du skyes bu snga na med pa'i don rang gi 'dod pas brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du skyes bu snga na med pa'i don rang gi 'dod pas brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, you may think that the meaning of the Vedas is not expressed according to the desire of the individual.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: But if that is so,

original: don gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid skyes bus gsal bar byed pas des na mthong ba dan 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid skyes bus gsal bar byed pas des na mthong ba dan 'gal bar 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if the meaning is naturally present, then a person would perceive it, and it would be contradictory to say that it is not perceived.

original: 'o na gal te de lta na rig byed 'di rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa gnas pa de'i tshe brda mi shes pas kyang rig byed kyi tshig de la don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te de lta na rig byed 'di rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa gnas pa de'i tshe brda mi shes pas kyang rig byed kyi tshig de la don rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Vedas have the natural power to reveal the truth, then even a person who does not know the language would understand the meaning of the words.

original: brda la ltos nas rig byed don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brda la ltos nas rig byed don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin gyi 'ba' zhig pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The Vedas are the cause of understanding the meaning in dependence on language, but not by themselves.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang bzhin gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu sgron ma la sogs pa'i brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu sgron ma la sogs pa'i brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause of understanding the meaning is not dependent on the language of the lamp, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na brda nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis don rtogs par nus par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na brda nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis don rtogs par nus par 'gyur gyi rang bzhin 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If it were, then the language itself would be the cause of understanding the meaning through the process of concomitance and reversal, but the relationship would not be natural.

original: gzhan yang brda dang lhan cig pa las don rtogs pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: gzhan yang brda dang lhan cig pa las don rtogs pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Moreover, even if one were to allow that meaning is understood from a sign simultaneously with it,

original: de lta na skyon yod do zhes bstan pa ni brda gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na skyon yod do zhes bstan pa ni brda gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: there would be a fault. To demonstrate this, he says, â€œIf the meaning of a word is different from the meaning of the sentence, then the meaning of the sentence would not be understood from the words.â€

original: dpyod pa bas sbyar ba'i brda las /
analyzed: dpyod pa bas sbyar ba'i brda las /
translated: The grammarians say,

original: nges par sbyor bar byed pas bkod pa'i brda ni brda gzhan yin la /
analyzed: nges par sbyor bar byed pas bkod pa'i brda ni brda gzhan yin la /
translated: â€œThe meaning of a word that is definitely applied is the meaning of a sentence.

original: de yod na rnal ma'i don las don gzhan sgra de las rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yod na rnal ma'i don las don gzhan sgra de las rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that exists, then the meaning of the sentence would not be understood from the words, which have a different meaning from the natural meaning of the words.

original: sgron ma ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i dri dang ro la sogs pas brda'i dbang gis gsal bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma ni gsal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i dri dang ro la sogs pas brda'i dbang gis gsal bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: A lamp cannot illuminate smells, tastes, and so on, which are not to be illuminated.

original: brda'i dbang gis don gzhan la 'jug pa yin du zin pa ste /
analyzed: brda'i dbang gis don gzhan la 'jug pa yin du zin pa ste /
translated: Even if one were to say that the meaning of a sentence is applied by the power of the meaning of the words,

original: de lta na yang tshad ma nyid ni 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes sgrub par byed pa ni nus pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang tshad ma nyid ni 'grub par mi 'gyur zhes sgrub par byed pa ni nus pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: still, valid knowledge would not be established. This is established by the phrase, â€œThat power is not established.â€

original: gal te gang gi tshe skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra don gzhan la yang 'jug pa de'i tshe 'tshol ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa des nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar de las 'dod pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gang gi tshe skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis sgra don gzhan la yang 'jug pa de'i tshe 'tshol ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i don gsal bar byed pa'i nus pa des nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar de las 'dod pa'i don rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: If, due to the power of a personâ€™s desire, a word is applied to another object, then at that time, because of the search for the object, the wordâ€™s power to reveal the real object is definitely not able to do so. Therefore, how could the desired object be understood from that word?

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad par bya ste /
translated: Or, we can explain this in another way:

original: gang 'dir rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa'i don gsal bar nus pa de res 'ga' don gcig la nges par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gang 'dir rang bzhin gyis yang dag pa'i don gsal bar nus pa de res 'ga' don gcig la nges par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is able to reveal the real object by its own nature, then sometimes it would be ascertained in one object,

original: don du ma nges par 'gyur zhes bya ba gnyis so //
analyzed: don du ma nges par 'gyur zhes bya ba gnyis so //
translated: or it would be ascertained in many objects.

original: de la don gcig la nges pa'i phyogs la @44a * //
analyzed: de la don gcig la nges pa'i phyogs la @44a * //
translated: Regarding the position that it is ascertained in one object,

original: skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: the fault is explained:

original: brda gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brda gzhan yod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: â€œIf another convention exists.â€

original: gnyis pa la yang nus pa de ni rnam par shes par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang nus pa de ni rnam par shes par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Regarding the second position, it is said, â€œThat power is also not able to make it known.â€

original: 'chol ba'i phyir snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chol ba'i phyir snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it is confused.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshig rnams don gcig la nges na //
analyzed: tshig rnams don gcig la nges na //
translated: If the words are ascertained as having one meaning,

original: don gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½don du ma dang mngon 'brel na //
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur ro // don du ma dang mngon 'brel na //
translated: then they will not be understood as having another meaning.ğŸ”½If they are related to many meanings,

original: 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid //
analyzed: 'gal ba gsal bar byed pa srid //
translated: then it is possible that they will express a contradiction.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de ltar sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang po mi srid do zhes bstan nas /ğŸ”½mi g-yo'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang po mi srid do zhes bstan nas / mi g-yo'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, having shown that the first characteristic that arises from the words is impossible,

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di mjug bsdu pa'i sgo nas ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di mjug bsdu pa'i sgo nas ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that the reason â€œbecause the cognition of the immutable arisesâ€ is unestablished by way of the conclusion,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says â€œthereforeâ€ and so on.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis don rtogs pa nyid mi srid pa de'i tshe de mi g-yo ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na gang gi tshe ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis don rtogs pa nyid mi srid pa de'i tshe de mi g-yo ba nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it is not produced by a person, then when it is impossible for the meaning to be understood in the way that was explained, how could it be immutable?

original: gang yang rig byed kyi tshig las don rtogs pa 'di'i 'gyur ba de ni brda las byung ba nyid du rigs so zhes 'di ni bstan pa las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du bstan zin to /
analyzed: gang yang rig byed kyi tshig las don rtogs pa 'di'i 'gyur ba de ni brda las byung ba nyid du rigs so zhes 'di ni bstan pa las 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po nyid du bstan zin to /
translated: It is reasonable that the meaning of the Vedic words is derived from convention, because the change in the meaning of the words is derived from convention.

original: 'di yang brda las byung ba nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: 'di yang brda las byung ba nyid du rigs te /
translated: This is also reasonable because

original: gang gi phyir rig byed kyi tshig 'di skyes bu'i tshig las te skyes bus byas pa nyid las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig byed kyi tshig 'di skyes bu'i tshig las te skyes bus byas pa nyid las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: the Vedic words are not different from the words of a person, that is, they are not different from the words created by a person.

original: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of â€œthey are not different from the words created by a person.â€

original: 'di yang ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di yang ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs pa shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, â€œbecause they are known to be reasonable.â€

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rig byed dang skyes bus byas pa dag gis te /
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni rig byed dang skyes bus byas pa dag gis te /
translated: â€œBy themâ€ refers to the Vedas and the words created by a person.

original: rnam pa thams cad du skyes bu dag gis byed par nus pa'i phyir rig byed ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du skyes bu dag gis byed par nus pa'i phyir rig byed ni 'jig rten pa las khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because in every way the Vedas are capable of being created by a person, they are not in any way different from the words of a person.

original: thos pa las zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pa las zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad du byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase from what is heard is meant to be humorous.

original: yang na gnyis pa yang yid ches pas bstan pas zhes bya ba 'di la sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid mi srid pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyon 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: yang na gnyis pa yang yid ches pas bstan pas zhes bya ba 'di la sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid mi srid pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi skyon 'chad pa ni /
translated: Alternatively, the phrase from what is trusted in the second definition is also impossible as a characteristic of verbal testimony. The fault in this definition is stated in the following:

original: yid ches khas mi len zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches khas mi len zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One does not accept what is trusted.

original: dpyod pa pa rnams kyis nyes pa zad pa'i skyes bus khas mi len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpyod pa pa rnams kyis nyes pa zad pa'i skyes bus khas mi len pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the MÄ«mÄá¹ƒsakas do not accept that a person can be one whose faults have been eliminated.

original: yid ches pa khas mi len pas de'i tshig tshad ma nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yid ches pa khas mi len pas de'i tshig tshad ma nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since they do not accept what is trusted, how can their words be valid?

original: mi bzod ces bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bzod ces bya ba ni mi rigs pa ste mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase it is not accepted means it is unreasonable, that is, impossible.

original: yang yid ches pa 'dod de yid @44b ches pa de 'dod pa de'i tshe 'di ni 'di'o zhes zer nas bzung nas yid ches pa 'di ni ma nges pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang yid ches pa 'dod de yid @44b ches pa de 'dod pa de'i tshe 'di ni 'di'o zhes zer nas bzung nas yid ches pa 'di ni ma nges pa'i phyir med pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: If one does accept what is trusted, then when one says, This is so, and one holds to that, this trust is not certain, and so it is as if it does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan nges par bya ba la tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skyon dang yon tan nges par bya ba la tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot ascertain the faults and virtues of others by means of valid cognition,

original: de dag ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are beyond the senses.

original: lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyang blo sngon du btang nas gzhan du byed pa'i phyir mi 'chol bar tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de dag nges par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi tha snyad kyang blo sngon du btang nas gzhan du byed pa'i phyir mi 'chol bar tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis de dag nges par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor can one ascertain them by means of verbal conventions, because they are created by the intellect and because those who see only the surface cannot grasp them.

original: ci ste yang skyes bu gang zhig nyes pa zad pa yin na yang tshig las phal cher mi slu bar mthong ba'i nyes pa ma zad pa de kho bo cag gis yid ches par 'dod do //
analyzed: ci ste yang skyes bu gang zhig nyes pa zad pa yin na yang tshig las phal cher mi slu bar mthong ba'i nyes pa ma zad pa de kho bo cag gis yid ches par 'dod do //
translated: But if one sees that a personâ€™s words are for the most part not deceptive, even though his faults are not exhausted, one may believe him.

original: de lta bas na yid ches pa'i tshig gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na yid ches pa'i tshig gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, one should accept his words.

original: des na sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi srid pa mi srid do snyam na /
analyzed: des na sgra'i mtshan nyid la mi srid pa mi srid do snyam na /
translated: Thus, it is not impossible for a sound to be a definition.

original: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: gcig tu mi slu ba tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad du de lta bu yin par nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mi slu ba tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad du de lta bu yin par nges pa ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is observed that mere nondeception is the same in all cases, it is not reasonable to be certain that it is so in every case.

original: 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because error is possible.

original: de lta ma yin nam 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin nam 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would have the characteristic of error.

original: de ltar re zhig sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyi ga yang khyad par du sun 'byin pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sgra las byung ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gnyi ga yang khyad par du sun 'byin pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the refutation of both aspects of the characteristic of verbal cognition,

original: spyir sun 'byin 'chad pa ni gang gis de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyir sun 'byin 'chad pa ni gang gis de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: he explains the general refutation, beginning with â€œBy what means . . . â€

original: gang gis dngos po de dag la rtogs par byed pa'i tshig 'di dag tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'i tshig rnams brjod par bya ba'i dngos po dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis dngos po de dag la rtogs par byed pa'i tshig 'di dag tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba'i tshig rnams brjod par bya ba'i dngos po dang lhan cig de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The words by which those things are cognized are not related to the things to be expressed by the characteristic of identity or origination.

original: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, first, there is no relation by the characteristic of identity.

original: dbang po tha dad pas 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po tha dad pas 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro //
translated: because of the reason of being apprehended by different faculties, and so on.

original: de la dbang po tha dad pas bzung ba ni dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po tha dad pas bzung ba ni dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba ste /
translated: Among them, being apprehended by different faculties is being apprehended by different faculties.

original: 'di ltar sgra ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra ni rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, sound is to be apprehended by the ear faculty,

original: don ni mig la sogs pas so //
analyzed: don ni mig la sogs pas so //
translated: but form is to be apprehended by the eye and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang yul dang snang ba dang rgyu tha dad pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang yul dang snang ba dang rgyu tha dad pa bzung ngo //
translated: The words â€œand so onâ€ include time, place, appearance, and cause.

original: gzhon nu ma len na re /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len na re /
translated: KanÄda says:

original: dbang po tha da pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po tha da pas gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ma nges pa yin te /

analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni ltag chod yin no // ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin na yang gcig dang du ma'i ngo shes pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi 'jig rten na tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par tha snyad rab tu grub pa ji lta ba de 'dra ba blo tha dad pa
translated: Therefore, this is mere sophistry.ğŸ”½But if, although there is difference in their own characteristics, they are the cause of the cognition of one and many, then just as the world establishes the conventions of difference and nondifference, so too would the different and nondifferent cognitions be accepted as the cause of that.

analyzed: go bar byed pa yang ma yin pas des na yang me bsgrub par bya ba la rtags su mi 'gyur ro // gzhan yang gang gi tshe sgra'i tha snyad 'di thams cad rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis mthong ba bzhin du rang gi snang ba'i ngor ma 'khrul pa nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe ji ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i khyad par la 'khrul pa bstan pa'i phyir

analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa las kyang //

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bstan pa 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bstan pa 'byung //
translated: manifests what is desired.

original: zhes khas blangs pa 'dis 'khrul pa la dogs pa yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes khas blangs pa 'dis 'khrul pa la dogs pa yang mi bya ste /
translated: One should not doubt that there is a mistake here because of this assertion.

original: gang gi phyir de la yang brjod par 'dod pa nyid tshig gi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la yang brjod par 'dod pa nyid tshig gi rgyu yin te /
translated: This is because the cause of the words is the mere object of expression,

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgos pa'i 'du byed kyi stobs nyid kyis der gsung 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyis bsgos pa'i 'du byed kyi stobs nyid kyis der gsung 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the speech engages there by the power of the formative forces imbued with previous aspirations.

original: 'di ltar gzhung goms pa 'don pa'i dus na gzhan rtogs par byed pa na yang tshig dang goms pa 'don pa la sogs pa'i bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhung goms pa 'don pa'i dus na gzhan rtogs par byed pa na yang tshig dang goms pa 'don pa la sogs pa'i bya ba 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, when one recites the text of the treatise, even though one causes another to understand, the activity of reciting the text and so on is engaged.

original: sngar gyi bsam pa ni de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi bsam pa ni de dag gi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The previous intention is not the cause of those.

original: de lta ma yin na gnag rdzi'i bum pa la sogs par yang du ba dmigs pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyang 'khrul pa nyid du brtsad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gnag rdzi'i bum pa la sogs par yang du ba dmigs pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa'i rtags kyang 'khrul pa nyid du brtsad par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because smoke is perceived in the pot of a cowherd and so on, even the reason of smoke and so on would be disputed as being erroneous.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i rtags thams cad la yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos pas 'khrul pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mtha' gcig tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i rtags thams cad la yul dang dus la sogs pa la ltos pas 'khrul pa srid pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mtha' gcig tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, in all cases of inferring an effect, there is no possibility of error because of dependence on place, time, and so on.

original: srog dang ldan pa la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa la sogs pa grub par bya ba'i don du 'jug pa'i phyir 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it is fruitless, because it is engaged for the sake of establishing the existence of life and so on,

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that it has an effect.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rgyu'i skyon la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rgyu'i skyon la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word â€œand so onâ€ includes the faults of the cause and so on.

original: sgra brjod par 'dod pas tshad ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: sgra brjod par 'dod pas tshad ma yin du chug mod /
translated: It may be that the expression of sound is a valid cognition because it is desired to express it.ğŸ”½But how can the expression of sound be a valid cognition?

original: gang gi tshul gsum pa nyid yod pas rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ba tshul gsum pa nyid ji lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshul gsum pa nyid yod pas rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan ma yin par 'gyur ba tshul gsum pa nyid ji lta bu yin te /
translated: Because it is included in inference due to the existence of the three modes.

original: 'di ltar 'di la chos can ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la chos can ni gang yin /
translated: In this way, what is the subject?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni gang /
translated: What is the probandum?

original: 'brel pa ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: 'brel pa ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: How is the relation established?

original: bsam pa rtogs par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsam pa rtogs par bya ba la zhes bya ba smos te /

original: gong du smra ba mthong ba la skyes bu ni chos can no //
analyzed: gong du smra ba mthong ba la skyes bu ni chos can no //
translated: The person is the subject in seeing the speaker above.

original: brjod par 'dod pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: That which is desired to be expressed is the probandum.

original: 'brel pa ni sngar rang gi rgyu las grub po //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni sngar rang gi rgyu las grub po //
