original: gang du smra ba po mthong ba de ni sa phyogs chos can no //
analyzed: gang du smra ba po mthong ba de ni sa phyogs chos can no //
translated: The place where the speaker is seen is the subject.

original: skyes bu'i khyad par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i khyad par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The particular person is the probandum.

original: 'di ltar phyogs kyang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs kyang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: In this way, the place is also the cause of the sound.

original: ri sul la sogs par gzhan 'dra ba'i sgra thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri sul la sogs par gzhan 'dra ba'i sgra thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one hears sounds like those of others in mountain valleys, etc.

original: de'i phyir @47a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @47a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la tshul gsum pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyis 'bras bu med pağŸ”½nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyi rol gyi don la ltos nas rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la tshul gsum pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyis 'bras bu med pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: he explains that this reason, â€œbecause of the absence of the trimodal condition,â€ is unestablished in the proof of the non-inferability in reliance upon external objects, and that it is useless in the proof of that.

original: brjod par 'dod pa la ltos nas ni ma grub pa nyid du gang du 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa la ltos nas ni ma grub pa nyid du gang du 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa bshad do //
translated: In reliance upon the intended meaning, he explains that it is unestablished in the statement, â€œwherever these are . . . â€

original: de ste sgra tshul gsum pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ste sgra tshul gsum pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he teaches the trimodal condition of the sound.

original: sgra las byung ba rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: The analysis of the origin of sound.

original: nye bar 'jal ba'i dbang du byas nas grong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba'i dbang du byas nas grong bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: With regard to the measurement of distance, he says, â€œThe villager, etc.,â€

original: ba med ci 'dra zhes ji skad du dris pa ni ba lang ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ba med ci 'dra zhes ji skad du dris pa ni ba lang ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba ni ba men no zhes bya ba'i tshig gang yin pa de /
translated: The question What is a cow like? is the same as the statement A gayal is like a cow.

original: tshig 'di nyid nye bar 'jal ba nyid du dpyod pa rgan po rnams la grags pa las /
analyzed: tshig 'di nyid nye bar 'jal ba nyid du dpyod pa rgan po rnams la grags pa las /
translated: This statement is an example of a type of inference called similarity that is well known to the elders.

original: ri khrod rjes ri khrod pas byas par bshad pa la /
analyzed: ri khrod rjes ri khrod pas byas par bshad pa la /
translated: The elders explain that the word gayal is derived from the word forest and the word cow.

original: 'di 'dra'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba 'di 'dra ba ni logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'thad do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba 'di 'dra ba ni logs shig tu tshad ma nyid du mi 'thad do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Since it is included in this category, it is not tenable that this type of similarity is a separate type of valid knowledge.

original: rnam pa gzhan du nye bar 'jal ba dper na men mthong ba na ba lang dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhug 'dis nye bar 'jal ba yang bskal pa'i don la 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa la brjod do //ğŸ”½'di nyid bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du nye bar 'jal ba dper na men mthong ba na ba lang dran pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhug 'dis nye bar 'jal ba yang bskal pa'i don la 'dra ba'i blo skyed par byed pa la brjod do // 'di nyid bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: Thinking this, the author of the Nyayabindu explains that similarity is a type of inference, such as when one sees a gayal and remembers a cow, by means of the statement When one sees a gayal, one remembers a cow.

original: ba lang mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba lang mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He explains this by saying, When one sees a gayal, etc.

original: gang gi tshe ba lang mthong nas phyis 'brog na yod pa'i ba men mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang mthong nas phyis 'brog na yod pa'i ba men mthong ste /
translated: When one sees an ox and later sees a gayal in the forest,

original: khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /ğŸ”½yan lag phal cher mtshungs pa ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu zhe na / yan lag phal cher mtshungs pa ston pa'i phyir //
translated: what is the difference?ğŸ”½In order to show that the majority of the parts are similar,

original: yan lag phal cher mtshungs pa ston pa ste //
analyzed: yan lag phal cher mtshungs pa ston pa ste //
translated: the majority of the parts are shown to be similar.

original: mgrin pa ldum pa ni /
analyzed: mgrin pa ldum pa ni /
translated: The neck is short

original: lkog shal la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: lkog shal la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: because it is free from a dewlap and so on.

original: de'i tshe dang po ba men gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa'i lta ba'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni re zhig mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe dang po ba men gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa'i lta ba'i shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni re zhig mngon sum yin la /
translated: At that time, first, the cognition of seeing that arises without conceptualizing the mere intrinsic reality of the gayal is perception.

original: gang yang phyugs 'di ni ba lang dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par rtog par byed pa de yang mngon sum nyid yin te /ğŸ”½dbang po'i byed pas sam skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang phyugs 'di ni ba lang dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa'i khyad par gyis rnam par rtog par byed pa de yang mngon sum nyid yin te / dbang po'i byed pas sam skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the conceptualization that thinks, â€œThis animal is similar to an ox,â€ is perception because it is generated by the power of the sense faculties.

original: 'di snyam du dran pa'i stobs kyis 'dra ba med par rtog par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dran pa'i stobs kyis 'dra ba med par rtog par byed kyi /
translated: One might think that the conceptualization of similarity is not generated by the power of the sense faculties, but by the power of memory.

original: dbang po'i byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: But it is not the function of the sense faculty.

original: de la gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this doubt, he says,

original: de la gal te yang de dag gi 'dra ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa @47b dran pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de lta na yang ba men la gnas pa nyid kyi nye ba'i phyir 'dra ba dbang po'i spyod yul yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te yang de dag gi 'dra ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa @47b dran pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de lta na yang ba men la gnas pa nyid kyi nye ba'i phyir 'dra ba dbang po'i spyod yul yin te /
translated: Even though the memory of the cow is the antecedent of the cognition that apprehends its similarity, the similarity is the object of the sense faculty because it is near.

original: nye ba ni nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba ni nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Nearness is the reason for nearness.

original: ba men gnas pas zhes bya ba ni nye ba nyid la gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: ba men gnas pas zhes bya ba ni nye ba nyid la gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The cowâ€™s location is the reason for nearness.

original: gang gi phyir 'dra ba ba men la gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di nye ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dra ba ba men la gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di nye ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because the similarity is located in the cow, it is near.

original: 'on te 'dra ba nyid ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar ba men gcig la 'di 'dzin par rigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba nyid ni gnyis la gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar ba men gcig la 'di 'dzin par rigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if similarity is located in two things, how is it proper to apprehend it in one cow?ğŸ”½He says,

original: 'dra ba yi ni spyi bzhin du //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dra ba yi ni spyi bzhin du //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Like the universal of similarity,

original: spyi dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir spyi bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi dang mtshungs par 'jug pa'i phyir spyi bzhin no //
translated: Like a universal, because it is engaged in common.

original: gal te yang 'dra ba gnyis las gnas pa de lta na yang spyi bzhin du re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'gran zla'i ba lang la sogs pa ma mthong na yang nye ba nyid kyi phyir gcig la yang dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang 'dra ba gnyis las gnas pa de lta na yang spyi bzhin du re re la yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir 'gran zla'i ba lang la sogs pa ma mthong na yang nye ba nyid kyi phyir gcig la yang dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Even if the similarity is in two things, still, like a universal, it is completely present in each, so that even when non-rival cows, etc. are not seen, it is still perceived in one, because of its proximity.

original: 'di snyam du gal te 'dra ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te 'dra ba dngos po nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that if similarity were an entity, then it would be perceived,

original: gang gi phyir dngos po nyid de nyid mi 'grub po snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po nyid de nyid mi 'grub po snyam du sems na /
translated: but that very entity is not established,

original: 'dra ba dngos po yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dra ba dngos po yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œSimilarity is an entity, etc.â€

original: ba lang la sogs pa'i rva la sogs pa'i yan lag phal cher mtshungs pa'i ba men la sogs pa'i rigs gzhan gyis gsal ba gcig la 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa ni 'dra ba yin no //

translated: In a single individual of a different class, such as a gayal, etc., which has a majority of similar parts, such as horns, etc., of a cow, etc., similarity is the connection by the character of inherence.

original: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can dag las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can dag las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: And the relation is not completely different from the relata,

original: 'brel pa la sogs pa mi shes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs pa mi shes par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that relation, etc. would be unknown.

original: rigs mthun pa'i yan lag thams cad mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba med do zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rigs gzhan smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i yan lag thams cad mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba med do zhes shes par bya ba'i don du rigs gzhan smos pa yin no //
translated: The term â€œanother typeâ€ is mentioned in order to show that there is no similarity because all the limbs of the same type are the same.

original: da ni nye bar 'jal ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nye bar 'jal ba'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of analogy,

original: gnas skabs de na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas skabs de na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, â€œat that time.â€

original: mthong ba'i phyugs 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyugs 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: That cognition which arises in the form â€œlike this seen cow, so is that cow,â€ with respect to an object that is hidden, is the valid knowledge of analogy.

original: 'di'i gzhal bya bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i gzhal bya bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the object of comprehension of that, he says,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œtherefore,â€ etc.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar 'jal ba ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de'i phyir gang zhig ba men la sogs pa 'dra ba'i khyad par can ba lang la sogs pa dran pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya yin pa'am /ğŸ”½yang na ba @48a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar 'jal ba ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de'i phyir gang zhig ba men la sogs pa 'dra ba'i khyad par can ba lang la sogs pa dran pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya yin pa'am / yang na ba @48a * //
translated: Because of the existence of the similarity of the cow, etc., which is the object of the analogical cognition, and because of the existence of the analogical cognition which has that as its object, therefore, the object of analogical cognition is established.

original: lang la sogs pa la brten pa'i 'dra ba tsam yin no //
analyzed: lang la sogs pa la brten pa'i 'dra ba tsam yin no //
translated: Or else, the similarity that is based on the cow, etc. is the object of analogical cognition.

original: 'on te mngon sum 'dra ba dmigs shing ba lang yang dran pas yul du byas pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum 'dra ba dmigs shing ba lang yang dran pas yul du byas pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isnâ€™t the similarity of the direct perception observed and the cow also made the object of memory?

original: de'i phyir gang zhig rtog pas nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba gzhal bar bya ba lhag ma gzhan ci yod ce na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig rtog pas nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba gzhal bar bya ba lhag ma gzhan ci yod ce na ;
translated: Therefore, what other object of analogical cognition remains that would be the object of analogical cognition by conceptual cognition, which would be valid cognition?

original: 'dra ba mngon sum nyid kyis yin //
analyzed: 'dra ba mngon sum nyid kyis yin //
translated: The similarity is by direct perception itself.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this.

original: gal te yang 'dra ba yang mngon sum gyis bzung zhing ba lang yang dran pas yul du byas pa de lta na yang 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi ba lang gi gong bu gzhan las te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'dra ba yang mngon sum gyis bzung zhing ba lang yang dran pas yul du byas pa de lta na yang 'dra ba'i khyad par can gyi ba lang gi gong bu gzhan las te /
translated: Even if similarity is apprehended by direct perception and the cow is taken as the object by memory, still, the cowâ€™s body that possesses the feature of similarity is different from the other.ğŸ”½

original: mngon sum dang dran pa las mi 'grub pa'i phyir de rtog pa la nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang dran pa las mi 'grub pa'i phyir de rtog pa la nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even if similarity is apprehended by direct perception and even if a cow is taken as an object by memory, still, the mass of a cow that has the distinction of similarity is not established from another, that is, from direct perception and memory. Therefore, analogical cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di nyid la dper bshad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid la dper bshad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: An example is given for this very point:

original: dper na sa phyogs chos can mngon sum yin zhing dran pas kyang me bzung ba na yang me'i khyad par can gyi sa phyogs la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa ma yin gyi /ğŸ”½'on kyang tshad ma nyid yin pa de bzhin du nye bar 'jal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: dper na sa phyogs chos can mngon sum yin zhing dran pas kyang me bzung ba na yang me'i khyad par can gyi sa phyogs la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang tshad ma nyid yin pa de bzhin du nye bar 'jal ba yang yin no //
translated: For example, when a place is the subject of direct perception and fire is apprehended by memory, still, inference is a valid cognition because it has as its object a place that has the distinction of fire.ğŸ”½But analogical cognition is also a valid cognition in the same way.

original: ci ste yang nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid yin du chug mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid yin du chug mod /
translated: But even if analogical cognition is a valid cognition,

original: de yang ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa las tshad ma logs shig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa las tshad ma logs shig pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how is valid knowledge different from perception and so on?

original: rnam shes de ni zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½re zhig mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam shes de ni zhes bya ba smos te / re zhig mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: He says, â€œThat consciousness . . .â€

original: dbang po dang don 'brel pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don 'brel pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro // rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not reasonable that it is perception because it is not produced from the contact of sense faculty and object.

original: tshul gsum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½'di ltar 'di 'dra ba phyogs chos su rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar 'di 'dra ba phyogs chos su rtogs pa'am /
translated: It is also not inference because it does not have the trimodal logical mark.ğŸ”½In this way, it is either the property of the position that is understood to be like that or it is like the seen cow and so on.

original: mthong bzhin pa'i ba lang la sogs pa yin grang 'dra ba de yang rtags nyid du rtogs pa la ba lang du gtogs pa rtog pa'am /
analyzed: mthong bzhin pa'i ba lang la sogs pa yin grang 'dra ba de yang rtags nyid du rtogs pa la ba lang du gtogs pa rtog pa'am /
translated: That similarity is understood to be the logical mark.

original: ba men du gtogs pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so //ğŸ”½de la re zhig ba lang la sogs pa'i gzhal byar gnas pa'i 'dra ba rtags nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ba men du gtogs pa yin zhes bya ba phyogs rnam pa gnyis so // de la re zhig ba lang la sogs pa'i gzhal byar gnas pa'i 'dra ba rtags nyid ma yin te /
translated: The property of the position is twofold: it is either understood to be a cow or it is understood to be a gayal.

original: de ni ba men mthong ba las sngar ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ba men mthong ba las sngar ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In that regard, first, the similarity that is the object of comprehension of a cow and so on is not the logical mark because it is not apprehended prior to seeing a gayal.

original: ma bzung ba yang rtags nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma bzung ba yang rtags nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it logical that what is not apprehended is a reason,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: 'on ba men la gnas pa'i 'dra ba rtags nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on ba men la gnas pa'i 'dra ba rtags nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Well, then, the similarity that resides in the ox would be a reason,

original: de de las gzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de de las gzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is apprehended from that.

original: ba men bzung ba na yang ba lang rjes su dpag par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba men bzung ba na yang ba lang rjes su dpag par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But when the ox is apprehended, the cow is not inferred,

original: @48b gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir bya rog gi nag po la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @48b gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir bya rog gi nag po la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are different bases, like the blackness of a crow, and so on.

original: 'on ba men mthong ba las phyis ba lang 'dzin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ba men mthong ba las phyis ba lang 'dzin pa'i phyir de la gnas pa rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, because the cow is apprehended later from seeing the ox, that which resides in it would be a reason.

original: dam bca' ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThe meaning of the thesis is . . .â€

original: 'dra ba gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because similarity is the object of knowledge,

original: de nyid rtags su mi rigs so //
analyzed: de nyid rtags su mi rigs so //
translated: it is not logical that it alone is a reason.

original: 'o na ba men rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ba men rtags su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, the ox would be a reason.

original: 'brel pa med phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œBecause there is no relation,â€

original: 'di la yang gang gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir ba men la yang rtags nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang gang gzhi tha dad pa'i phyir ba men la yang rtags nyid ma yin no //
translated: because here also, since they are different bases, the ox is not a reason.

original: 'o na nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma gyur mod ce na /
translated: But suppose someone says, â€œWell then, it is not a valid cognition.â€

original: ma rtogs don gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma rtogs don gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œIt is not a valid cognition with regard to a previously unapprehended object.â€

original: sngar ba lang gi ba men dang 'dra ba'i khyad par ma bzung ba'i phyir 'dra ba'i khyad par mi shes pa'i ba lang gsal bar byed pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: sngar ba lang gi ba men dang 'dra ba'i khyad par ma bzung ba'i phyir 'dra ba'i khyad par mi shes pa'i ba lang gsal bar byed pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du rigs so //
translated: Because the particular cow that is like the gaur has not been apprehended before, it is reasonable that it is a valid cognition that reveals the cow, since the particular cow is not known.

original: gzhal bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He responds to the objection that it is not a valid cognition with, â€œBecause the object is existent.â€

original: gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma drug las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma bzhin du nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma drug las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma bzhin du nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin no //
translated: Just as a valid cognition that is not included among the six valid cognitions does not exist, so too upamÄna is a valid cognition because the object is existent.

original: yan lag phal cher 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dra ba'i gzhal bya yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag phal cher 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'dra ba'i gzhal bya yod pa yin te /
translated: The object that is similar exists because of the nature of having similarity with the majority of its parts.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore the reason is not established.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: spyi brtag par spyi rnams bkag zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi brtag par spyi rnams bkag zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because universals have already been refuted in the Examination of the Elements.

original: phal cher de dag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: phal cher de dag kyang ma yin la /
translated: The majority of those are also not so.

original: de dag dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma pa nyid ma nyam du spyi rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid ma pa nyid ma nyam du spyi rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because they do not exist, the reason is not established.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: de la tshad ma ni 'di yin te spyi dngos po nyid dang / de yang mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dam bca' ba gnyis so //ğŸ”½med pa'i gzhal bya las gzhan phyir //
analyzed: de la tshad ma ni 'di yin te spyi dngos po nyid dang / de yang mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba dam bca' ba gnyis so // med pa'i gzhal bya las gzhan phyir //
translated: The two theses are: â€œThe universal is a real entity, and it is apprehended by perception.â€

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: â€œBecause it is different from the non-existent object of comprehensionâ€ is the reason.

original: dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //ğŸ”½thun mong min pa'i dngos po bzhin //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya las gzhal bya gzhan gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // thun mong min pa'i dngos po bzhin //
translated: The meaning is: â€œBecause it is the nature of that which is different from the non-existent object of comprehension.â€

original: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: â€œLike the uncommon entityâ€ is the example.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The uncommon entity is the particular characteristic.

original: spyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyon 'chad de /
analyzed: spyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skyon 'chad de /
translated: â€œThe universal is not a real entityâ€ and so on explains the fault.

original: spyi'i don zhes bya ba'i don gyi sgra ni gzhal bya'i tshig go //ğŸ”½dam bca' ba gnyis ka la yang spyi rang bzhin med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams la spyi'i dngos po med @49a * //
analyzed: spyi'i don zhes bya ba'i don gyi sgra ni gzhal bya'i tshig go // dam bca' ba gnyis ka la yang spyi rang bzhin med par smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa rnams la spyi'i dngos po med @49a * //
translated: The term â€œobjectâ€ in â€œgeneral objectâ€ is a term for a phenomenon to be evaluated.

original: pa las gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub la /
analyzed: pa las gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub la /
translated: Both theses are unestablished with respect to the Buddhist who advocates that universals are essenceless, because a universal is not established as being different from the nonexistence of an object.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub bya dang po la yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub bya dang po la yang dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin te /
translated: The first thesis, that the definition of an entity is the thesis, is also a part of the meaning of the thesis, because

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa las gzhan dngos po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa las gzhan dngos po yin te /
translated: an entity is an entity that is characterized by the exclusion of nonentities.

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa rnams par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni sgra gzhan gyis gtan tshigs nyid nye bar blangs shing de nyid kyang bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa rnams par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni sgra gzhan gyis gtan tshigs nyid nye bar blangs shing de nyid kyang bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid yin no //
translated: Since that is stated by another term, it is a reason, and since that is also the thesis, it is a part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: gzhan yang dran pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma yin pa'am /
translated: Moreover, because it is the nature of memory, the thesis is not a valid cognition.

original: yang na dran pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang na dran pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Or else, it is another memory.

original: de la dran pa'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dran pa'i rang bzhin nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is the nature of memory, he says:

original: de la 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In that regard, it is thus.

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin na yang ba men gyi yan lag kha cig ba lang du gtogs pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin na yang ba men gyi yan lag kha cig ba lang du gtogs pa'i yan lag dang lhan cig mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu dag yin te /
translated: Even though the entity called â€œsimilarityâ€ exists by way of its intrinsic reality, some parts of a cow are causes for the cognition of similarity with parts that belong to a cow.

original: mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu yan lag dag las ma gtogs pa 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs par rtogs pa'i rgyu yan lag dag las ma gtogs pa 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i don gzhan du gyur pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the parts that are the causes for the cognition of similarity, there is no other entity called â€œsimilarity.â€

original: de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las don gzhan du gyur pa blo la mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because an entity that is different from them does not appear to the mind.

original: de lta bas na ba men mthong ba la ba lang du gtogs pa'i yan lag dag la phal cher mthong ba'i stobs kyis dran pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa de skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na ba men mthong ba la ba lang du gtogs pa'i yan lag dag la phal cher mthong ba'i stobs kyis dran pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa de skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in the case of seeing a cow, the cognition that is the nature of memory arises due to the power of seeing the parts that belong to a cow.

original: 'dra bar brjod pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar brjod pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not apprehend the thing as similar.

original: de lta ma yin na rta la sogs pa la yang yan lag phal cher 'dra ba dang ldan pa yang yod pa'i phyir de la yang ba men mthong ba las ba lang gi blo bzhin ci'i phyir mi 'jug 'di la khyad par 'gal yang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rta la sogs pa la yang yan lag phal cher 'dra ba dang ldan pa yang yod pa'i phyir de la yang ba men mthong ba las ba lang gi blo bzhin ci'i phyir mi 'jug 'di la khyad par 'gal yang yod pa ma yin
translated: Otherwise, since a horse and so on also has a body that is similar in part, why does the cognition of a cow not arise when a horse is seen?

original: te / gnyi ga yang 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / gnyi ga yang 'dra ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference in these two cases, because both have similarity.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te lan cig ma yin par mthong bar 'gyur na dran pa nyid la ni skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te lan cig ma yin par mthong bar 'gyur na dran pa nyid la ni skyon 'di med do //
translated: If one sees them more than once, then this fault does not apply to memory.

original: sngar lan cig ma yin par mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na la dran par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sngar lan cig ma yin par mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na la dran par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Memory arises only in regard to that which was seen more than once in the past.

original: dran pa sad pa'i rgyu rnams ni nus pa so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa sad pa'i rgyu rnams ni nus pa so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the causes of the arousal of memory are restricted to specific capacities.

original: 'di snyam du dran pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dran pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if we grant that memory is a valid cognition,

original: de lta na yang ci'i phyir dran pa nyid tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci'i phyir dran pa nyid tshad ma ma yin zhe na /
translated: why is memory not a valid cognition?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, â€œTherefore, this . . .â€

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dran pa'o //
translated: This refers to memory.

original: 'dra ba dngos po nyid @49b du khas blangs nas gzhan gyi yul nyid kyis nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dra ba dngos po nyid @49b du khas blangs nas gzhan gyi yul nyid kyis nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having accepted that similarity is a thing, it is taught that it is not valid knowledge because it is the object of another:

original: 'dra ba dngos po yin la rag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba dngos po yin la rag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If similarity is a thing,

original: 'dra ba dngos po yin pa dang / ba lang la yang ci spyi bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: 'dra ba dngos po yin pa dang / ba lang la yang ci spyi bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa yin la rag mod /
translated: it is certainly the case that a cow and a cowâ€™s general nature are complete in every way.

original: de lta na yang ba men mthong ba las sngar ba lang mdun na gnas par 'dzin pa na de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir mdun na gnas pa'i 'dra ba de yang bzung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang ba men mthong ba las sngar ba lang mdun na gnas par 'dzin pa na de la tha mi dad pa'i phyir mdun na gnas pa'i 'dra ba de yang bzung ba nyid yin te /
translated: However, when a cow is apprehended as standing in front of one on seeing a cow, that similarity standing in front of one is also apprehended because it is not different from that.

original: ba lang gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the nature of the cow itself.

original: de lta ma yin na tha mi dad par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha mi dad par mi 'grub ste /
translated: If that were not so, it would not be established as being not different.

original: de lta yin dang bzung zin pa 'dzin pas dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bzung zin pa 'dzin pas dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, it would not be a valid cognition because it would be the essence of memory that apprehends what was previously apprehended.

original: ci ste yang dang por 'dra ba yod pa tsam gyis bzung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang dang por 'dra ba yod pa tsam gyis bzung ba nyid yin te /
translated: But if it is the mere existence of similarity that is apprehended first,

original: ba lang 'di ba men dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis bzung ba ni ma yin la nye bar 'jal ba ni rnam pa 'dis nges pa yin te /
analyzed: ba lang 'di ba men dang 'dra ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul 'dis bzung ba ni ma yin la nye bar 'jal ba ni rnam pa 'dis nges pa yin te /
translated: it is not apprehended by the method of â€œThis cow is similar to a gayal,â€ and the ascertainment by that aspect is inference.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is not established that it is the essence of memory.

original: de'i phyir dran pa'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam na gal te dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa'i ngo bo nyid ma grub pa yin no snyam na gal te dang por zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is said that â€œfirst,â€ and so on,

original: gal te ba men dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'dis khyad par can gyi ba lang gi rdzas ba men mthong ba las sngar ma bzung la /
analyzed: gal te ba men dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i ming 'dis khyad par can gyi ba lang gi rdzas ba men mthong ba las sngar ma bzung la /
translated: if by the name â€œsimilar to a gayal,â€ the substance of a cow that has a specific feature is not apprehended before seeing a gayal,

original: rang gi ngo bos ni 'dzin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni 'dzin pa nyid yin te /
translated: it is apprehended by its own nature.

original: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is its nature is synonymous with â€œapprehension.â€

original: rang bzhin de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is that nature,

original: 'di'i bdag gang gzung ba nyid du brjod pa yin zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½ba lang gi gong bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag gang gzung ba nyid du brjod pa yin zhes bya ba smos te / ba lang gi gong bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid brjod do //
translated: The root text says, â€œThe self that is grasped is said to be the nature of the collection and the continuum.â€ğŸ”½The nature of the collection of a cow is said to be the self.

original: rang gi ngo bos te rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid des de bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos te rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid des de bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By its own nature, by its own characteristic, it is grasped. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gal te gzung ba yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is grasped, what follows from that?

original: yongs su shes pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text says, â€œIf it were known, it would be known as that.â€

original: gang gis dngos po bzung yang sngar ming de mi 'dzin pa na mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo la ming yod pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gis dngos po bzung yang sngar ming de mi 'dzin pa na mi 'dzin par 'gyur ba dngos po rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo la ming yod pa ni ma yin la /
translated: If it were grasped, then since the name would not have been grasped previously, it would not be grasped. The name does not exist as the nature of things.

original: khyad par du mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid du smra ba rnams la ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu brjod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: khyad par du mngon sum nges pa'i bdag nyid du smra ba rnams la ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu brjod par mi rigs so //
translated: In particular, it is not right to say that it is not grasped by those who propound that perception is definitive.

original: gzhan yang 'di dang mtshungs so zhes shes pa'i phyir 'di tsam gyi tshad ma gzhan rtogs na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di dang mtshungs so zhes shes pa'i phyir 'di tsam gyi tshad ma gzhan rtogs na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, in order to know that this is similar to that, if one understands a valid cognition of this much, there would be an absurd consequence.ğŸ”½Thus:

original: 'di ltar / mngon sum rjes dpag sgra las byung //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mngon sum rjes dpag sgra las byung //
translated: Perception, inference, verbal testimony,

original: nye par 'jal ba dang lhan cig / don gyis @50a * //
analyzed: nye par 'jal ba dang lhan cig / don gyis @50a * //
translated: Comparison, and presumptionğŸ”½Along with implication, non-existence,

original: go dang dngos med dag /'di dag bsgrub bya sgrub byed yin //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa la mi ltos pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin zhe na /

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
