original: phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ba men du brjod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ba men du brjod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in the external object that is described as a cow with its own characteristics.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de nyid spyi zhes tha snyad du byed kyi gzhan gyi kun du brtags pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de nyid spyi zhes tha snyad du byed kyi gzhan gyi kun du brtags pa ni ma yin te /
translated: That very representation of conception is conventionally called a universal, but not another imagined one,

original: de ni bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsal zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that has already been refuted.

original: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid du rlom zhen /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol rang gi mtshan nyid du rlom zhen /
translated: How then is the external object imagined to have its own characteristics?

original: snang rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snang rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThe appearance, etc.â€

original: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra la sogs pa 'jug pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra la sogs pa 'jug pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: But if there is no contradiction in the application of sound, etc. to intrinsic identity,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna says, â€œIn that case, etc.â€

original: gang gi phyir sgra'i don rtag par rgyas par sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul can yin pa bsal zin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra'i don rtag par rgyas par sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams rang gi mtshan nyid kyi spyod yul can yin pa bsal zin te /
translated: Because it has already been refuted at length that the referents of words are permanent and that words and thoughts have intrinsic identity as their domain,

original: de lta bas na rtog pas sgro btags pa nyid sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rtog pas sgro btags pa nyid sgra'i don yin no //
translated: therefore the referents of words are just superimpositions by thought.

original: yang na sgra dang rtog pa de dag gi spyod yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin du chug mod /
analyzed: yang na sgra dang rtog pa de dag gi spyod yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin du chug mod /
translated: Or, even if it were the case that the domain of those words and thoughts is intrinsic identity,

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma gzhan ma yin no //ğŸ”½ji ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa med par 'di rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'du zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma gzhan ma yin no // ji ltar tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa med par 'di rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'du zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: still, because it is included within inference, it is not a separate valid cognition.ğŸ”½How is it that what is produced by a reason having the three modes is included within inference?

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to respond to this qualm, NÄgÄrjuna says that it is just what is produced by a reason having the three modes.

original: 'di'i tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The three modes of this are as follows.

original: ba lang dang 'dra ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ba lang dang 'dra ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The cow is the reason.

original: ba men sgra'i spyod yul can ni bsgrub bya'i chos so //
analyzed: ba men sgra'i spyod yul can ni bsgrub bya'i chos so //
translated: The ox, the object of the sound, is the predicate.

original: brda 'dzin pa'i dus na rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i blo la gnas pa'i pa men ni dpe'o //
analyzed: brda 'dzin pa'i dus na rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba'i blo la gnas pa'i pa men ni dpe'o //
translated: The ox that appears to the conceptual consciousness at the time of the apprehension of the sign is the example.

original: snang bzhin pa'i ba men ni chos can no //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i ba men ni chos can no //
translated: The appearing ox is the subject.

original: 'di snyam du ba men na ba lang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i brda dus der ba men blo la mi gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ba men na ba lang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i brda dus der ba men blo la mi gnas pa yin te /
translated: If you think that at that time the ox does not appear to the mind, because of the expression â€œThe ox is like a cow,â€

original: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub @52a * //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub @52a * //
translated: then the example would not be established.

original: pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: pa ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that,

original: blo la gnas pa'ang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo la gnas pa'ang zhes bya ba la /
translated: then the phrase â€œthat appears to the mindâ€ is stated.

original: 'ang gi sgra'i don ni mig gi spyod yul ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra'i don ni mig gi spyod yul ma yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ means that it is not only not the object of the eye.

original: gal te blo la ba lang gi 'dra ba nyid rjes su 'jug pa cung zad kyang mi snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'di la ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i brda ci la brten nas byed brda yang byed de de'i phyir blo la gnas pa'i ba langğŸ”½dang 'dra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig brda'i dus na snang ngo zhes khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: gal te blo la ba lang gi 'dra ba nyid rjes su 'jug pa cung zad kyang mi snang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'di la ba lang dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i brda ci la brten nas byed brda yang byed de de'i phyir blo la gnas pa'i ba lang dang 'dra ba'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rnam pa 'ga' zhig brda'i dus na snang ngo zhes khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: One would not make such a sign, and therefore one must accept that some aspect that is like the cow that exists in the mind appears at the time of the sign.

original: de ltar re zhig nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa ma yin par khas blangs nas bzung zin pa 'dzin pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig nye bar 'jal ba'i gzhal bya sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa ma yin par khas blangs nas bzung zin pa 'dzin pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
translated: In this way, having first accepted that the object of comprehension of analogy is not the relation between the word and meaning, and having established that it is not a valid cognition because it is included in the apprehension of what has been apprehended and in inference,

original: da ni 'brel pa can las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa can las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: now, in the second place, it is said: Apart from the related object, there is no other relation.

original: 'brel pa can de dag kyang tshad ma gzhan gyis bzung zin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa can de dag kyang tshad ma gzhan gyis bzung zin te /
translated: And those related objects are already apprehended by another valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar brda'i dus na sgra snang ba'i shes pas bzung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i dus na sgra snang ba'i shes pas bzung la /
translated: Thus, at the time of the sign, the cognition to which the sound appears apprehends it.

original: phyis mdun na gnas pa'i ba men ming gis bzung ste /
analyzed: phyis mdun na gnas pa'i ba men ming gis bzung ste /
translated: Later, the cognition to which the name appears apprehends the cow that is present in front.

original: gang gis nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis nye bar 'jal ba tshad ma nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: By what is it measured? By the valid cognition itself.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the object of knowledge other than those?

original: 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di bstan pa'i phyir 'brel pa can las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, â€œfrom that which is related,â€ and so on.

original: 'dis ni bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: This explains that it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: bsgrub zin to zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig gi don brtags pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub zin to zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshig gi don brtags pa'o //
translated: â€œIt has been establishedâ€ is the examination of the meaning of the verbal root.

original: gal te yang 'di snyam du rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pas so so so sor 'grel pa can bzung la de dag sbyor ba ni nye bar 'jal bas byed de /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di snyam du rna ba la sogs pa'i shes pas so so so sor 'grel pa can bzung la de dag sbyor ba ni nye bar 'jal bas byed de /
translated: If you think that the cognition of each individual sense faculty, such as the ear, apprehends the individual related object, and that their combination is done by the valid cognition of inference,

original: de lta bas na nye bar sbyor ba ni sbyor bas tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta bas na nye bar sbyor ba ni sbyor bas tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then the combination is done by the valid cognition of inference.

original: logs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: logs shig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to that, he says, â€œThe individual,â€ and so on.

original: dri zhim mngar ba la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: dri zhim mngar ba la sogs bzhin //
translated: like a pleasant smell, sweetness, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i don la 'bral ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i don la 'bral ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: ji ltar dngos po nyams su myong bzhin pa gang yin pa de ni mngar ba yin la 'di ni dri zhim pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yul bzung zin pa sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po nyams su myong bzhin pa gang yin pa de ni mngar ba yin la 'di ni dri zhim pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yul bzung zin pa sbyor ba'i bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du
translated: Just as the cognition of an object that is being experienced, e.g., â€œthis is sweet,â€ â€œthis is fragrant,â€ etc., is not a valid cognition because it is the cognition of an object that has been apprehended by a previous application,

original: / 'di yang 'gyur ba'i sa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / 'di yang 'gyur ba'i sa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: so also is the cognition of the connection between a name and an object.

original: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na ming dang sbyor ba rigs pa ni ming dang sbyor ba 'brel pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ni de lta bas na ming dang sbyor ba rigs pa ni ming dang sbyor ba 'brel pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the connection between a name and an object is the cognition of the connection between a name and an object.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul @52b gyis dran pa las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul @52b gyis dran pa las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not a memory in the manner that has been explained.

original: 'di snyam du 'brel pa ni gang du yang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'brel pa ni gang du yang chos mthun pa'i sgo nas byed pa ma yin no //
translated: One might think that a connection is not made by way of a common property anywhere.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: dngos su ming can bstan nas 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes de ltar byed par mthong gi yul lkog tu gyur pa la ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dngos su ming can bstan nas 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes de ltar byed par mthong gi yul lkog tu gyur pa la ni ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that the name is actually taught, and that it is seen to be done in this way, â€œThis is a cow,â€ then it is not in the case of an object that is hidden.

original: mtha' yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtha' yas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show that, he says, â€œInfinite . . . â€ and so on.

original: kun bshad dang ldan rigs pa ni //
analyzed: kun bshad dang ldan rigs pa ni //
translated: The reasoning that is endowed with all explanations

original: zhes bya ba ni ming dang 'brel ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming dang 'brel ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: is the consciousness that is connected with a name.

original: mi yi bdag po sogs la zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po sogs la zhes bya ba ni rgyal po la sogs pa la'o //
translated: â€œThe lord of men, and so onâ€ means the king, and so on.

original: thabs mtha' yas pa bskyed pa de nyid bstan pa'i don du dpe brjod pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: thabs mtha' yas pa bskyed pa de nyid bstan pa'i don du dpe brjod pa bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to show that very generation of infinite methods, he explains the example:

original: de dag nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œAmong them . . . â€ and so on.

original: 'di ltar kha cig gis 'ga' zhig la nu bo bya ba 'di song shig / rta dang glang po la zhon pa'i skyes bu mang po dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i mi'i bdag po la ltos shig ces smras pa dang / des de la de dag gi nang nas mi'i bdag po gang yin zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig gis 'ga' zhig la nu bo bya ba 'di song shig / rta dang glang po la zhon pa'i skyes bu mang po dang lhan cig 'gro ba'i mi'i bdag po la ltos shig ces smras pa dang / des de la de dag gi nang nas mi'i bdag po gang yin zhes smras so //
translated: Thus, someone says to someone else, â€œGo to the lord of men who is going with many men mounted on horses and elephants. Look at him.â€ He says to him, â€œAmong them, which one is the lord of men?â€

original: des gdugs dkar pos nyi ma'i 'od zer skyob pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nang nas mi'i bdag po yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: des gdugs dkar pos nyi ma'i 'od zer skyob pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi nang nas mi'i bdag po yin no zhes smras so //
translated: The one who is protected by the white parasol from the sunâ€™s rays is the lord of men among them.â€

original: des gdams pa de bzung nas song ste mthong nas /ğŸ”½ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rgyal po de la /
analyzed: des gdams pa de bzung nas song ste mthong nas / ji skad du bshad pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rgyal po de la /
translated: Having received this instruction, he went and saw the king.ğŸ”½And he thought, â€œThis one is the lord of men, distinguished by the distinguishing marks as explained.â€

original: 'di'i ming ni mi'i bdag po yin no zhes blo skye ba gang yin pa de yang khyed kyi lugs kyis tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i ming ni mi'i bdag po yin no zhes blo skye ba gang yin pa de yang khyed kyi lugs kyis tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: This cognition is also a different type of valid cognition in your system.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: chos mthun pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa la sogs pa la ltos pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not depend on similarity and so on.

original: 'di ni tshad ma bzhi ni khongs su ma 'dus par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma bzhi ni khongs su ma 'dus par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is not included in the four types of valid cognition.

original: gnas ma bu pas rang gi spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis po kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di gzhig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas ma bu pas rang gi spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis po kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di gzhig pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute the VÄtsÄ«putrÄ«ya assertion that there are only two types of valid cognition because there are no objects of comprehension other than their general characteristics, the root text says:

original: tshad ma byed pa ni mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma byed pa ni mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The means of valid cognition is twofold, since perception is accompanied by a second means of valid cognition, which is different from inference.

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a means of valid cognition, like inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum las ma gtogs par tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum las ma gtogs par tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Inference is accompanied by a second means of valid cognition, which is different from perception.

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: Because it is a means of valid cognition, like perception.

original: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i gzhal bya gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i gzhal bya gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, the particular is accompanied by a second object of comprehension, which is different from the universal.

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid bzhin no //ğŸ”½spyi'i @53a * //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid bzhin no // spyi'i @53a * //
translated: Because it is an object of comprehension, like the universal.

original: mtshan nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i gzhal bya gzhan gnyis po dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang rang gi mtshan nyid las ma gtogs pa'i gzhal bya gzhan gnyis po dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The universal is accompanied by a second object of comprehension, which is different from the particular.

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin no //
translated: Because it is an object of comprehension, like the particular.

original: des ston pa ni gzhan dag rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des ston pa ni gzhan dag rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teacher states: â€œfrom inference for others.â€

original: ldan pa ni 'brel pa ste gnyis pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'brel pa ste gnyis pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Possession is a relation; the meaning is that it is accompanied by a second.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration;

original: gzhal bya gzhan sgrub par byed pa la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan sgrub par byed pa la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is the same for the establishment of other objects of valid knowledge.

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa byed pa la bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa byed pa la bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is a refutation of the discordant side of the probandum,

original: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag gis 'grel pa ma bstan pas ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag gis 'grel pa ma bstan pas ma nges pa yin te /
translated: he says: â€œbecause the commentary does not teach the probandum and the proof.â€

original: gtan tshigs thams cad mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thams cad mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ltos pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is uncertain because all reasons are suspected of depending on the discordant side.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang sgra las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang sgra las byung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the number is clear, as it is said: â€œperception, inference, analogy, and verbal testimony.â€

original: tshad ma bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i grangs nges par gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i grangs nges par gsal ba yin te /
translated: It is like the valid cognitions.

original: rnam pa 'dis tshad ma gzhan srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis tshad ma gzhan srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another type of valid cognition is possible in this way.

original: 'di ltar ji skad du brjod par nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji skad du brjod par nus te /
translated: It is possible to say this:

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / sgra las byung ba brjod pa las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / sgra las byung ba brjod pa las ma gtogs pa tshad ma gzhan gnyis pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Direct perception is not a second valid cognition, apart from inference, comparison, and testimony,

original: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a valid cognition, like inference.ğŸ”½And also, the three kinds of objects of valid cognition that are asserted,

original: gang yang spyi dang khyad par dang // spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa //
analyzed: gang yang spyi dang khyad par dang // spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa //
translated: the universal, the particular, and that which possesses the universal and the particular,

original: zhes bya ba gzhal bya rnam pa gsum 'dod pa de la yang bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gzhal bya rnam pa gsum 'dod pa de la yang bsal ba yin te /
translated: are refuted,

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis gzhal bya gzhan sgrub par byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis gzhal bya gzhan sgrub par byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to establish other objects of valid cognition by these two kinds.

original: 'di la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur pas spros pas chog go //
analyzed: 'di la khyed kyi lan gang yin pa de ni kho bo cag gir yang 'gyur pas spros pas chog go //
translated: Since your response to this would be our response as well, let us drop the matter.

original: nye bar 'jal ba rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The Analysis of Comparison

original: don gyis go ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: don gyis go ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of implication,

original: gong du tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gong du tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says above, â€œA valid cognition,â€ and so on.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa gang du mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / sgra las byung ba dang / don gyis go ba dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma drug po rnams kyis yongs su bcad pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa gang du mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / sgra las byung ba dang / don gyis go ba dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma drug po rnams kyis yongs su bcad pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that the meaning ascertained by the six valid cognitionsâ€”direct perception, inference, analogy, testimony, presumption, and non-existenceâ€”in a specific place, time, and so on, is otherwise.

original: gal te de lta bur gyur pa yang de lta bu yin pas lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis go ba'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta bur gyur pa yang de lta bu yin pas lkog tu gyur pa'i yul rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis go ba'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then any understanding of a hidden object is a valid cognition of presumption.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni ri khrod rjes te /
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni ri khrod rjes te /
translated: â€œSaidâ€ means â€œafter.â€

original: ji skad du mthong ba'am @53b thos pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du mthong ba'am @53b thos pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog pa ste /
translated: Because it is not tenable that the meaning of what is seen or heard is otherwise, non-seeing is presumption.

original: 'di lta ste dper na lha sbyin ma shi la khyim du ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod par rtog pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na lha sbyin ma shi la khyim du ma mthong bas phyi rol na yod par rtog pa lta bu'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the presumption that Devadatta, who is not seen in the house, is outside.

original: mthong ba ni sgra las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma lngas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni sgra las byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma lngas rtogs pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the understanding by means of the five valid cognitions, except for the one arising from sound.

original: thos pa ni sgra las byung ba'i tshad mas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni sgra las byung ba'i tshad mas rtogs pa'o //
translated: Hearing is the understanding by means of the valid cognition arising from sound.

original: de la tshad ma drug sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba go rims bzhin du dper brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la tshad ma drug sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba go rims bzhin du dper brjod pa ni de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The illustration of the understanding of the meaning preceded by the six valid cognitions is stated in order, beginning with â€œtherein.â€

original: de la mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba ni dper na mngon sum gyi sreg par nyams su myong ba'i me'i sreg pa'i nus pa rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba ni dper na mngon sum gyi sreg par nyams su myong ba'i me'i sreg pa'i nus pa rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, the understanding of the meaning preceded by perception is, for example, like the understanding of the capacity of fire to burn, from the experience of being burned by fire through perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba ni dper na yul gzhan du phyin pas rjes su dpag pa'i 'gro ba las nyi ma 'gro ba'i nus pa dang ldan par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba ni dper na yul gzhan du phyin pas rjes su dpag pa'i 'gro ba las nyi ma 'gro ba'i nus pa dang ldan par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The understanding preceded by inference is, for example, like the understanding of the capacity of the sun to move, from the inference of movement due to going to another place.

original: thams cad du dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa rnams kyang 'bras bu las don gyis go bas sgrub par byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang don gyis go ba yin te /ğŸ”½res 'ga' yang gang gi tshe mngon sum gyi 'bras bu dmigs nas rgyu'i nus pa rtogs na ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin la /
analyzed: thams cad du dngos po thams cad kyi nus pa rnams kyang 'bras bu las don gyis go bas sgrub par byed pa can yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang don gyis go ba yin te / res 'ga' yang gang gi tshe mngon sum gyi 'bras bu dmigs nas rgyu'i nus pa rtogs na ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can nyid yin la /
translated: In all cases, the capacity of all things is also established by implication from the effect.ğŸ”½This is also implied by the meaning of the statement, â€œWhen the effect of direct perception is observed, the capacity of the cause is understood.â€

original: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa las 'bras bu rtogs nas rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'bras bu don gyis go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa las 'bras bu rtogs nas rgyu'i nus pa rtogs pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'bras bu don gyis go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the effect is understood through inference, etc., the capacity of the cause is understood. At that time, the effect that precedes inference, etc., is understood by implication.

original: 'bras bu'i gzhan du mi 'thad pa de tshad ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gzhan du mi 'thad pa de tshad ma gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That effect is not tenable as other than the cause.

original: rgyu'i nus pa dang po nyid du bzung zin to zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa dang po nyid du bzung zin to zhes ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that the capacity of the cause is apprehended first.

original: gang gi phyir nus pa de dag thams cad thams cad du snga na med pa rtogs te des na rtogs zin pa'i don rtogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa de dag thams cad thams cad du snga na med pa rtogs te des na rtogs zin pa'i don rtogs pa nyid med pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because all of these potentialities are understood to be unestablished prior to the effect, therefore, since the object that is already understood is not understood again, it is valid knowledge.

original: de la 'di snyam du nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i rtags kyis rjes su dpag par bya ba yin gyi don gyis go ba'i tshad ma'i go bar bya ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i rtags kyis rjes su dpag par bya ba yin gyi don gyis go ba'i tshad ma'i go bar bya ba ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the potentialities are to be inferred by the effect, but are not objects of understanding by valid knowledge in the form of comprehension,

original: 'brel pa gzung ba med par ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzung ba med par ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said, â€œWithout apprehending the connection,â€

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa gzung ba med par go bar byed pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa gzung ba med par go bar byed pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: because the effect is not apprehended without apprehending the connection, therefore it is not to be inferred.

original: 'brel ba 'dzin pa med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel ba 'dzin pa med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very nonapprehension of the connection,

original: gang gis 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang gis 'di la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, â€œBy whom is this . . .â€

original: nus pa 'di dag gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'brel pa @54a * //
analyzed: nus pa 'di dag gi 'bras bu dang lhan cig 'brel pa @54a * //
translated: These potentialities are connected with the effect.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus las sngar tsha ba la sogs par me dang du ba bzhin du bzung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus las sngar tsha ba la sogs par me dang du ba bzhin du bzung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that prior to the time of inference, fire and smoke are apprehended as being hot and so on,

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are beyond the senses.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa brjod do //
translated: This shows that there is no pervasion.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'brel pa 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa'i dus su 'brel pa 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that at the time of inference, the relation is apprehended,

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because it is beyond the senses.

original: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs kyi chos med par bshad do //
translated: This shows that the property of the subject is nonexistent.

original: rgyu la brten pa'i nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i chos su rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la brten pa'i nus pa rnams ni 'bras bu'i chos su rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that the potencies that depend on the cause are the property of the effect.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe snang ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i nus pa phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe rna ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su byas pa la nus pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ji snyed sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs de thams cad gzhi ma grub par 'gyur
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe snang ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i nus pa phyogs su byed pa de'i tshe rna ba la sogs pa'i phyogs su byas pa la nus pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ji snyed sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs de thams cad gzhi ma grub par 'gyur
translated: Moreover, when the potency that is the realization of light and so on is posited as the subject, then because the proof of the potency is posited as the subject, all the reasons that are employed become unestablished bases.

original: te / rten du gyur pa'i nus pa rnams ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / rten du gyur pa'i nus pa rnams ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the potencies that are the supports are not established.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i don gyis go bas grub par byed pa yin gyis nus pa thams cad rjes su dpag par byed pa ni ma yin no //ğŸ”½de la sgra las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba ni dper na bcud kyis len ma 'grub pa'i lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig thos pa las shugs kyis mtshan mo
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i don gyis go bas grub par byed pa yin gyis nus pa thams cad rjes su dpag par byed pa ni ma yin no // de la sgra las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi don gyis go ba ni dper na bcud kyis len ma 'grub pa'i lha sbyin tshon po nyin par zan mi za zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig thos pa las shugs kyis mtshan mo
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the effect is understood and established, but not all the possibilities are inferred.

original: za'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don rtog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: za'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don rtog pa lta bu'o //
translated: In this regard, understanding the meaning through what precedes the verbal expression is like, for example, the understanding of the meaning of the statement, â€œThe fat Devadatta does not eat during the day,â€ which is understood implicitly from hearing the statement, â€œThe fat Devadatta eats at night.â€

original: 'di snyam du tshon po nyin par zan mi za zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di nyid kyi don mtshan mo za'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par rtogs so zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshon po nyin par zan mi za zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di nyid kyi don mtshan mo za'o zhes bya ba 'di yin par rtogs so zhes 'dod na /
translated: If one thinks, â€œI understand the meaning of the statement, â€˜The fat Devadatta does not eat during the day,â€™ to be â€˜He eats at night,â€™â€

original: de'i phyir nyin mo'i ngag la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyin mo'i ngag la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then the response is, â€œThe meaning of the statement â€˜during the dayâ€™ is understood.â€

original: ngag gi don 'di rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngag gi don 'di rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the statement is twofold:

original: 'di lta ste 'dres pa dang tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dres pa dang tha dad pa'o //
translated: it is mixed and it is distinct.

original: de la 'dres pa ni tshig rnams phan tshun 'o ma dang chu bzhin du dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dres pa ni tshig rnams phan tshun 'o ma dang chu bzhin du dbyer med pa'o //
translated: â€œMixingâ€ is the mutual inseparability of the words, like milk and water.

original: tha dad pa ni bcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni bcad par bya ba dang gcod par byed pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'o //
translated: â€œDifferenceâ€ is the state of being separate, like the words â€œto be cutâ€ and â€œthe cutter.â€

original: yang na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa nges pa ni 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i 'brel pa nges pa ni 'dres pa'o //
translated: Or, â€œmixingâ€ is the certainty of the relation between the probandum and the probans.

original: tha dad pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: â€œDifferenceâ€ is the exclusion of dissimilar types.

original: ngag gi don rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ngag gi don rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: Neither of these two kinds of meaning of words is possible.

original: 'di ltar nyin mo la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gang dag yin pa ni nyin mo la sogs pa ste /ğŸ”½mtshan mo za ba'i don dang de dag gis mdzes pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyin mo la sogs pa'i tshig gi don gang dag yin pa ni nyin mo la sogs pa ste / mtshan mo za ba'i don dang de dag gis mdzes pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words â€œdayâ€ and so on is â€œdayâ€ and so on.ğŸ”½The meaning of the words â€œnightâ€ and so on is â€œnightâ€ and so on.

original: shin tu mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the words â€œdayâ€ and so on is not the meaning of the words â€œnightâ€ and so on, because they are very different.

original: tha dad pa ni ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: â€œDifferenceâ€ is not the meaning of the words â€œdayâ€ and so on.

original: nyin mo la sogs pa'i tshig @54b rnams ni mtshan mo la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin mo la sogs pa'i tshig @54b rnams ni mtshan mo la sogs pa rnam par bcad nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words â€œdayâ€ and so on are used by excluding â€œnightâ€ and so on.

original: ci ste mtshan mo zan za'o zhes bya ba 'di nyin mo la sogs pa'i dag gi don gzhan gnyis pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste mtshan mo zan za'o zhes bya ba 'di nyin mo la sogs pa'i dag gi don gzhan gnyis pa yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the meaning of â€œhe eats at nightâ€ is the second, a different meaning of â€œat dayâ€ and so on,

original: nyin mo la sogs pas za ba bkag pa nyid na nye bar zad pa'i phyir gzhan mtshan mo za ba de nyid bstan par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir don gnyis pa rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyin mo la sogs pas za ba bkag pa nyid na nye bar zad pa'i phyir gzhan mtshan mo za ba de nyid bstan par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir don gnyis pa rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then since the negation of eating at day and so on is itself exhausted, it is impossible to indicate that very same eating at night as a second meaning. Therefore, the idea of a second meaning is not tenable.

original: de lta bas na mtshan mo za'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngag gzhan gyi don yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan mo za'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngag gzhan gyi don yin no //
translated: Thus, â€œhe eats at nightâ€ is the meaning of another sentence.

original: blo las gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba nyid ma yin par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: blo las gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba nyid ma yin par ston pa yin no //
translated: â€œIt is not based on the intellectâ€ shows that it is not derived from sound.

original: lung can nyid min yang zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba nyid ma yin yang ste /
analyzed: lung can nyid min yang zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba nyid ma yin yang ste /
translated: â€œEven though it is not scripturalâ€ means that even though it is not derived from sound,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgra las byung ba nyid med par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sgra las byung ba nyid med par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has been established that it does not exist as derived from sound in the manner explained above.

original: gang zhig mngon sum la sogs pa gang yang rung ba tshad mar 'gyur ba'i mtshan mo za ba zhes bya ba'i ngag gang yin pa de'i rtogs par byed pa'i ngag de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum la sogs pa gang yang rung ba tshad mar 'gyur ba'i mtshan mo za ba zhes bya ba'i ngag gang yin pa de'i rtogs par byed pa'i ngag de 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod par bya'o //
translated: Whatever statement is a means of valid knowledge, such as direct perception, with regard to the statement â€œDevadatta eats at night,â€ the means of valid knowledge that apprehends that statement that is to be understood must be stated.

original: 'gyur pa yang ma yin pa de lta bas na 'di tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur pa yang ma yin pa de lta bas na 'di tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: But since it is not a transformation, therefore it is a different means of valid knowledge.

original: 'di mngon sum la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa de nyid sel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di mngon sum la sogs pa gang yang rung ba nyid yin pa de nyid sel bar byed pa ni /
translated: He refutes the idea that it is a means of valid knowledge such as direct perception:

original: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œFirst of all,â€ and so on.

original: de la mtshan mo za ba'i ngag ma brjod pa ni mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la mtshan mo za ba'i ngag ma brjod pa ni mngon sum nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: With regard to that, it is not reasonable that the statement â€œDevadatta eats at nightâ€ is direct perception,

original: ma thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not heard.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not inference,

original: 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because there is no relation.

original: 'di ltar gang gis 'brel par 'gyur ba mtshan mo za ba'i tshig 'di nyid nyin mo'i tshig de dang 'gar yang lhan cig ma mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis 'brel par 'gyur ba mtshan mo za ba'i tshig 'di nyid nyin mo'i tshig de dang 'gar yang lhan cig ma mthong la /
translated: In this way, the word â€œnightâ€ is never seen together with the word â€œday,â€ which would connect it.

original: rtags gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other evidence.

original: ci ste 'brel pa ma dmigs na yang 'di rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste 'brel pa ma dmigs na yang 'di rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if you think that even though the connection is not observed, it is still permanent,

original: gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna says, â€œIf it is permanent,â€

original: gal te 'brel pa ma grub par rtags nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe nyin mo'i tshig brjod pa las ngag thams cad rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa ma grub par rtags nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe nyin mo'i tshig brjod pa las ngag thams cad rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: if it is a sign that is not established as a connection, then at that time all words would be understood from the utterance of the word â€œday.â€

original: mtshan mo za ba'i ngag kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mo za ba'i ngag kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be only the word â€œnight.â€

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa dang bral ba nyid yin na ngag gzhan las mtshan mo za ba'i ngag khyad par med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa dang bral ba nyid yin na ngag gzhan las mtshan mo za ba'i ngag khyad par med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if it is devoid of a connection, then the word â€œnightâ€ would not be different from other words, because it would be without a connection.

original: ngag thams cad khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngag thams cad khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that all words would be undifferentiated.

original: nye bar 'jal ba sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nye bar 'jal ba sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation that proceeds from the analogy is as follows.

original: ba men dang 'dra zhes bya ba la @55a * //
analyzed: ba men dang 'dra zhes bya ba la @55a * //
translated: It is like a cow.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œLike a cowâ€ and so on.

original: ba men dang 'dra ba'i ba lang gi gong bu nye bar 'jal ba'i shes pas ma bzung bar bya ba'i nus pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i stobs kyis byung ba gang yin pa des don gyis 'jal bar byed do //
analyzed: ba men dang 'dra ba'i ba lang gi gong bu nye bar 'jal ba'i shes pas ma bzung bar bya ba'i nus pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar 'jal ba'i stobs kyis byung ba gang yin pa des don gyis 'jal bar byed do //
translated: The power of the cognition that comprehends the cow-entity similar to a cow, which is not apprehended by the cognition that comprehends the cow-entity similar to a cow, comprehends the object by the power of that cognition that comprehends the cow-entity similar to a cow.

original: don gyis go ba sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gyis go ba sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The explanation that is preceded by understanding the meaning is stated by â€œexpressionâ€ and so on.

original: brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa ni rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: Expression is that which expresses.

original: don ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for that which reveals the meaning.

original: sgra'i de bzhin du ste rjod par byed pa'i nus pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir de ltar rjod par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs pa na ste shes na de ni go skabs gzhan med phyir te /
analyzed: sgra'i de bzhin du ste rjod par byed pa'i nus pa med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir de ltar rjod par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs pa na ste shes na de ni go skabs gzhan med phyir te /
translated: Just like the sound, since it is not established without the power of expression, in that way, when the power of expression is understood, that is, when it is known, since there is no other opportunity, the meaning is understood.

original: rjod par byed pa'i nus pa de sgra rtag pa med par go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir yang don gyis go ba gzhan gyi sgra mi rtag par nges so //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa'i nus pa de sgra rtag pa med par go skabs gzhan med pa'i phyir yang don gyis go ba gzhan gyi sgra mi rtag par nges so //
translated: Because there is no other opportunity for the permanence of sound to be understood, the meaning of the other, impermanence, is ascertained by the sound.

original: yang ji ltar mi rtag pa med par brjod par mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar mi rtag pa med par brjod par mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Moreover, how is it that without impermanence, expression is not established?

original: mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says â€œimpermanenceâ€ and so on.

original: 'di ltar gal te brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe brda byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te brda'i dus su mthong ba tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe brda byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if what is seen at the time of the convention does not follow at the time of the convention, then the use of the convention would be pointless,

original: de ni tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the sake of the convention.

original: phyis tha snyad kyi dus su 'jug pa'i sgra ni de dang lhan cig sngar 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis tha snyad kyi dus su 'jug pa'i sgra ni de dang lhan cig sngar 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Later, at the time of the convention, the sound that engages is not established as previously connected with that.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In one way,

original: de ni gzhan du ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du ma rtogs phyir //
translated: because it is not understood otherwise,

original: zhes bya ba ste tha snyad kyi dus su 'byung ba'i sgra de brda'i dus su mthong ba'i sgra las gzhan du ma rtogs te tha mi dad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste tha snyad kyi dus su 'byung ba'i sgra de brda'i dus su mthong ba'i sgra las gzhan du ma rtogs te tha mi dad par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound that occurs at the time of convention is not understood to be different from the sound that is seen at the time of the sign, because it is ascertained to be non-different.

original: ji ltar tha mi dad par nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha mi dad par nges she na /
translated: How is it ascertained to be non-different?

original: mi rtag ces bya ba smos so /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba smos so /
translated: He says â€œimpermanent.â€

original: dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba ni chad ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba ni chad ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning that precedes the non-existence of things is understood as â€œwithout interruption,â€ and so on.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma med par de ldog pas nges pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma med par de ldog pas nges pa ste /
translated: Without valid cognitions such as direct perception, it is ascertained by the negation of that.

original: gtan la phab pa'i nag pa med pa gang yin pa des khyad par du byas pa'i khyim yod pa'i phyir khyim 'di na nag pa med pas des na nag pa ma shi ba ni phyi rol na yod par grub pa ste /
analyzed: gtan la phab pa'i nag pa med pa gang yin pa des khyad par du byas pa'i khyim yod pa'i phyir khyim 'di na nag pa med pas des na nag pa ma shi ba ni phyi rol na yod par grub pa ste /
translated: Since the house is qualified by the absence of the cow that was determined, the house exists. Therefore, since there is no cow in this house, it is established that the living cow exists outside.

original: phyi rol na nag pa yod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i nges pa bshad pa 'dir ri khrod rjes brjod de /
analyzed: phyi rol na nag pa yod pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i nges pa bshad pa 'dir ri khrod rjes brjod de /
translated: The statement â€œthe cow exists outsideâ€ is a restatement of that kind of ascertainment.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don gyis go ba rnams mtshon pa'i don du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don gyis go ba rnams mtshon pa'i don du brjod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the other words is understood by implication.ğŸ”½For example, when Devadatta is alive, one infers that he is outside the house because he is not in the house.

original: dper na lha sbyin gson la khyim na ma ma thong bas phyi rol na yod par rtog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba'o @55b dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gson la khyim na ma ma thong bas phyi rol na yod par rtog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med pa sngon du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba'o @55b dper brjod pa'o //
translated: This is an example of understanding by implication of non-existence.

original: rtog ge pa phal cher 'di rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir de bsal ba'i don du 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtog ge pa phal cher 'di rjes su dpag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir de bsal ba'i don du 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Most logicians assert this to be inference itself, so in order to refute that, it is said:

original: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa 'di ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs kyi chos la sogs pa 'di ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the property of the subject and so on are not dependent,

original: rgyu ma yin pa des na 'di rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa des na 'di rjes su dpag pa las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: it is different from inference,

original: mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: like direct perception.ğŸ”½Thus, the object characterized by external distinctions such as black and so on,

original: 'di ltar phyi'i yul gyi khyad par du byas pa'i don nag pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi'i yul gyi khyad par du byas pa'i don nag pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: Thus, the object that is specified by the particularity of external objects is black and so on.

original: nag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyi rol gyi yul phyogs yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: nag pa la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyi rol gyi yul phyogs yin par 'gyur /
translated: and the external place qualified by the black and so on.

original: gzhal bya rnam pa de gnyis yin pa na khyim na nag pa la sogs pa'i don med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhi tha dad pa yin na phyogs chos su 'gyur te mi 'gyur pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya rnam pa de gnyis yin pa na khyim na nag pa la sogs pa'i don med pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gzhi tha dad pa yin na phyogs chos su 'gyur te mi 'gyur pa kho na'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If the object of knowledge is both of those aspects, then how can the absence of the object, the black and so on, in the house be the property of the subject when it is a different basis? It cannot be!

original: gzhan yang khyim na med pa phyogs kyi chos nyid du rtogs pa na res 'ga' lha sbyin gson po khyim na med pa gang yin pa de rjod par byed dam spyir yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyim na med pa phyogs kyi chos nyid du rtogs pa na res 'ga' lha sbyin gson po khyim na med pa gang yin pa de rjod par byed dam spyir yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, when the absence in the house is realized as the property of the subject, is it sometimes the case that the living Devadatta who is absent in the house is stated, or is it in general? There are two positions.

original: de yang phyogs dang po la skyon bshad pa ni gson po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang phyogs dang po la skyon bshad pa ni gson po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the error in the first position is explained by â€œlivingâ€ and so on.

original: de rig ces bya ba la ni lha sbyin gson po de rig pa nges pa de ni lha sbyin phyi rol na yod pa ma rtogs par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de rig ces bya ba la ni lha sbyin gson po de rig pa nges pa de ni lha sbyin phyi rol na yod pa ma rtogs par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The ascertainment that â€œhe is knownâ€ is not produced without realizing that Devadatta is outside.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: This is an unestablished reason.

original: grub na yang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: grub na yang grub pa la sgrub pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: If it is established, then it is explained that the establishment is itself the proof.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: In the second position, the reason is indeterminate.ğŸ”½Because even with respect to Devadatta and so on who are not dead, one sees that they are not at home.

original: lha sbyin la sogs pa ma shi ba rnams la yang de dag khyim na med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lha sbyin la sogs pa ma shi ba rnams la yang de dag khyim na med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bstan pa'i phyir yod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, â€œExistence and so on,â€ and so forth.

original: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni ma shi ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni ma shi ba'o //
translated: â€œExistenceâ€ means not dead.

original: de ltar don gyis go ba rnam pa drug las bzhis ni gzhal bya nges par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar don gyis go ba rnam pa drug las bzhis ni gzhal bya nges par nus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, from among the six types of implication, the first four are able to ascertain the object of comprehension.

original: gcig ni sgra mi rtag pa yin zhing gzhan gyis ni phyi rol na gnas pa'i rdzas so //
analyzed: gcig ni sgra mi rtag pa yin zhing gzhan gyis ni phyi rol na gnas pa'i rdzas so //
translated: One is the impermanence of sound, and the other is the substance that exists externally.

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pas sun 'byin pa 'chad de /
translated: With respect to that, he explains the refutation beginning with â€œIn that case, and so on.â€

original: 'di re zhig mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di re zhig mtshan nyid rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a correct reason for the following reason.

original: 'di ltar ma mthong ba de med par mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma mthong ba de med par mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ma mthong ba rtog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since it is not tenable that the object of seeing, hearing, etc. is different from that which is not seen, the nonseeing is a conception.

original: de la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed:

original: ci ma mthong ba de dang lhan cig mthong ba dang thos pa'i don 'brel par mthong ngam /
analyzed: ci ma mthong ba de dang lhan cig mthong ba dang thos pa'i don 'brel par mthong ngam /
translated: Is the object of seeing and hearing that is not seen seen in connection with that which is seen?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or is it not?

original: gal te mthong na rjes su dpag pa thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mthong na rjes su dpag pa thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is seen, then it follows that it is inference,

original: 'brel pa mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir @56a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir @56a * //
translated: because it is a means of perceiving a connection.

original: ro ; ; ci ste ma grub na 'o na de lta na mes sreg par byed pa bzhin du sreg par byed pa ma yin par yang brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: ro ; ; ci ste ma grub na 'o na de lta na mes sreg par byed pa bzhin du sreg par byed pa ma yin par yang brtag par bya ste /
translated: But if it is not established, then in that case, it should be considered that it is not a burner, just as fire is a burner.

original: 'brel pa ma mthong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ma mthong bar khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in not seeing a connection.

original: ci ste mes sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste mes sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir sreg par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du brtag par mi bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that it should not be considered that it is not a burner because it is seen that fire is a burner,

original: de lta na 'o na sreg par byed pa yang brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sreg par byed pa yang brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: If that is so, then the burner should not be investigated,

original: 'ga' yang de dang lhan cig ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang de dang lhan cig ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because no one has seen it together with the fuel.

original: de lta bas na 'brel pa grub pa na med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba mthong nas 'brel pa gnyis pa brtags par rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel pa grub pa na med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel ba mthong nas 'brel pa gnyis pa brtags par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, when the relation is established, it is proper to investigate the second relation after seeing the relation of invariable concomitance.

original: de ltar brtags na 'brel ba mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar brtags na 'brel ba mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is investigated in that way, it is included within inference itself, because it is a means of seeing the relation.

original: dper na brjod pa rnams kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na brjod pa rnams kyang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, the statements are not correct.

original: de la re zhig mngon sum la sogs pa grub pa'i don gyi nus pa don gyis go ba bzhis rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni thun mong du sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig mngon sum la sogs pa grub pa'i don gyi nus pa don gyis go ba bzhis rtogs par byed do zhes bya ba 'dis ni thun mong du sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: Here, first, the explanation of the general refutation is: â€œIt is understood by the four meanings of the power of the object that is established by perception and so on.â€

original: de la nus pa can spangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la nus pa can spangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the explanation of the specific refutation is: â€œThe power is abandoned, and so on.â€

original: gang gi phyir nus pa ni dngos po las gzhan ma yin la dngos po'i nus pa de yang mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir bzung zin pa 'dzin pas 'chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nus pa ni dngos po las gzhan ma yin la dngos po'i nus pa de yang mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir bzung zin pa 'dzin pas 'chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because potency is not different from the thing, and because the potency of the thing is itself perceived, the thing is not explained as apprehending what has already been apprehended.

original: mngon sum gyis bzung ba nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bzung ba nyid ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: What is perceived is itself indicated.

original: gang zhig sreg pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba khyad par du sun 'byin pa bshad do //
analyzed: gang zhig sreg pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum du 'gro ba'i don gyis go ba khyad par du sun 'byin pa bshad do //
translated: He explains the refutation of the distinction of the going of that which is being burned, etc., by the word â€œetc.â€

original: ma nor the tshom med byas nas //
analyzed: ma nor the tshom med byas nas //
translated: Having made it nonerroneous and free from doubt,

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba'i khyad par can yin no //ğŸ”½ci ste nus pa tha dad par khas len par byed na de'i tshe nus pa kho na 'bras bu dag la nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni bya ba'i khyad par can yin no // ci ste nus pa tha dad par khas len par byed na de'i tshe nus pa kho na 'bras bu dag la nye bar sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: this is the distinction of the action.

original: dngos po rgyu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that potency is different, then it follows that the thing is not the cause of the effect, because potency alone is applied to the effect.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the thing is not a thing.

original: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of an entity is that it performs a function.

original: ci ste dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas /
analyzed: ci ste dngos po ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas /
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that it is a non-entity,

original: nye bar sbyor ba khas len par byed pa de'i tshe nye bar sbyor ba khas len par byed pa na nus pa tha dad de logs shig ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba khas len par byed pa de'i tshe nye bar sbyor ba khas len par byed pa na nus pa tha dad de logs shig ma yin no //
translated: then when you accept that it is connected, it is not that the connection is different from the capacity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir don byed par nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'i nus pa nyid ni gzhan nus pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed par nus pa'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo gang yin pa'i nus pa nyid ni gzhan nus pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the capacity itself, which is the nature that is able to perform a function, is not a different characteristic of capacity.

original: gang yang dngos po'i @56b nus pa zhes tha dad du bstan pa de ni khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa las dngos po nyid de skad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang dngos po'i @56b nus pa zhes tha dad du bstan pa de ni khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam zhig shes par 'dod pa las dngos po nyid de skad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is taught as a different capacity of an entity is an entity that is described in that way because it is the mere wish to know another attribute that is excluded.

original: 'di snyam du nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'di snyam du nus pa'i mtshan nyid ni don bya ba byed pa ma yin na //
translated: If you think that the characteristic of capacity is not the performance of a function,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: gzhan kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it is only other,

original: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œThe characteristic of another, etc.â€

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan bsgrub pa la tshad ma gang zhig nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa las nus pa 'di khyad par du byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan bsgrub pa la tshad ma gang zhig nus pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa las nus pa 'di khyad par du byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: In establishing the characteristic of potentiality, what is the valid cognition that distinguishes potentiality from the characteristic of nonexistence, which is devoid of all potentiality? There is not the slightest valid cognition that does this.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa de dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa de dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: A cognition of that kind is not the slightest bit useful,

original: ngo bo dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid las don bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo dang ldan pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyid las don bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the very nature of a thing that has an essence is the establishment of the objectâ€™s function.

original: ji skad du /ğŸ”½don byed nus pa ma yin la //
analyzed: ji skad du / don byed nus pa ma yin la //
translated: As it was said :ğŸ”½What use is it for those who seek

original: de don gnyer bas brtags ci phan //ğŸ”½ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //
analyzed: de don gnyer bas brtags ci phan // ma ning gzugs bzang mi bzang zhes //

analyzed: gzhan dag gis ji ltar g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i dpe 'di bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Others say that this example of â€œmotionâ€ is incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: mngon sum rdzas las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum rdzas las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, â€œDirect perception of substance . . . â€

original: dper na ngo shes pas yi ge rnams kho bo cag rtag par 'dod pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa'i las kyang yin pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub bya mi rtag pas stong pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na ngo shes pas yi ge rnams kho bo cag rtag par 'dod pa de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa'i las kyang yin pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub bya mi rtag pas stong pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as recognition asserts that the letters are permanent, so too the activity of the hand and so on is permanent. Therefore, since the example is empty of the impermanent probandum, it is mistaken.

original: gal te rtag par yin pa de lta na lag pa la sogs pa'i las rnams ci'i phyir rtag tu dmigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag par yin pa de lta na lag pa la sogs pa'i las rnams ci'i phyir rtag tu dmigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is permanent, why donâ€™t the activities of the hand and so on always occur?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says,

original: 'di dag gsal byed med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag gsal byed med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThey are not manifest . . . â€ and so on.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni bya ba rnams te /
translated: â€œTheyâ€ refers to the activities.

original: rtag tu mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag tu mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: They are not always observed.

original: ji ltar khyed la skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar khyed la skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as for you, because there is no producer,

original: rtag tu dmigs par mi @60a * //
analyzed: rtag tu dmigs par mi @60a * //
translated: they are not always observed.

original: 'gyur ba de bzhin du kho bo cag la 'gal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba de bzhin du kho bo cag la 'gal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'o //
translated: The response is that just as the opponent is not contradicting us, we are not contradicting him.

original: de ltar ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is, â€œIt is not like that.â€

original: 'dir rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Here there are two thoughts.

original: bya ba gang dang gsal bar bya bar 'dod pa de dag rang bzhin gyis shes pa skyed par nus pa zhig gam /
analyzed: bya ba gang dang gsal bar bya bar 'dod pa de dag rang bzhin gyis shes pa skyed par nus pa zhig gam /

analyzed: thams cad du de las byung ba'i shes par 'gyur te /

original: de dag ni nus pa'i rang bzhin rtag pa nyid kyis sus kyang gegs ma byas pa'i phyir te /

translated: Because their nature of being able to do so is permanent, no one can stop it.

analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa ni khyad par du ma byas pas gegs bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci ste mi nus pa yin na de'i tshe de dang bral na ste nus pa dang bral na de las byung ba'i shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gsal byed kyi nus pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: ci ste mi nus pa yin na de'i tshe de dang bral na ste nus pa dang bral na de las byung ba'i shes pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gsal byed kyi nus pas ci zhig bya /
translated: But if it is not able to do so, then what use is the expressive potential, since when it is devoid of that, i.e., when it is devoid of the potential, it does not become a consciousness that arises from that?

original: de lta bas na rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i bya bas de dag gis gsal byed nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rgyu dag ji ltar yang 'brel pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i bya bas de dag gis gsal byed nyid du yongs su brtags pa'i rgyu dag ji ltar yang 'brel pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the cause that is imputed to be expressive by the activity that is asserted to be permanent is in no way related to it.

original: mi rtag pa rnams ni gsal bar byed pa las snga na med pa skye ba yin pa'i phyir de la gsal bar byed par rigs so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams ni gsal bar byed pa las snga na med pa skye ba yin pa'i phyir de la gsal bar byed par rigs so //
translated: But since impermanent things arise prior to being expressive, it is reasonable that they are expressive.

original: gang yang / de dag ngo bo shes pa yis //
analyzed: gang yang / de dag ngo bo shes pa yis //
translated: Also, the statement, â€œThey assert that the nature of those is consciousness,

original: yi ge bzhin du rtag par 'dod //
analyzed: yi ge bzhin du rtag par 'dod //
translated: like letters, it is permanent,â€

original: ces smras pa 'di la rtag pa'i don la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces smras pa 'di la rtag pa'i don la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is addressed here with the words â€œwith respect to the meaning of permanence.â€

original: rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs nyid du bkod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par bsal zin to //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs nyid du bkod pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par bsal zin to //
translated: The consciousness that is posited as the reason in order to prove that it is permanent has already been refuted in the analysis of things above.

original: tshad ma med par nges pa yi //
analyzed: tshad ma med par nges pa yi //
translated: Without valid knowledge, there is no certainty.

original: nag pa med pa'i khyad par can //
analyzed: nag pa med pa'i khyad par can //
translated: â€œThe absence of a black cow in the house is a particular that is ascertained without a valid cognition.ğŸ”½â€

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: In response to such statements,

original: nag pa'i khyim na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nag pa'i khyim na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text states, â€œThe absence of a black cow in the house . . .â€

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nag pa khyim na med pa phyi rol na yod pa med par yang 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nag pa khyim na med pa phyi rol na yod pa med par yang 'gyur ba ste /
translated: â€œIn another wayâ€ means that the absence of a black cow in the house would also be the absence of a black cow outside the house.

original: 'dis ni ma nges par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma nges par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason is indefinite.

original: ci ste lha sbyin gson po khyim na med pa gang yin pa de don gyis go ba'i dper brjod pa 'dir gtan tshigs nyid du brjod kyi /ğŸ”½med pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste lha sbyin gson po khyim na med pa gang yin pa de don gyis go ba'i dper brjod pa 'dir gtan tshigs nyid du brjod kyi / med pa tsam ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the absence of Devadatta in the house, while he is alive, is stated in this example as the reason, not mere absence,

original: de ltar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ltar mi rigs te /
translated: then that is not correct.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha sbyin gson po de la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin gson po de la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir gtan tshigs the tshom za ba ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is doubt about whether Devadatta is alive or not, the reason is not established as free from doubt.

original: nges pa med pa'i rgyu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i rgyu bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reason that is not ascertained:

original: nag pa khyim na zhes bya ba ni de'i ste @60b nag pa'i gson pa la nges par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir tshu rol mthong ba the tshom za ba kho na'o //
analyzed: nag pa khyim na zhes bya ba ni de'i ste @60b nag pa'i gson pa la nges par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir tshu rol mthong ba the tshom za ba kho na'o //
translated: â€œBlack is in the houseâ€ is only a doubt for one who sees only a part, because there is no valid knowledge that ascertains Blackâ€™s being alive.

original: yang ci ste gal te tshu rol mthong ba la nag pa gson par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad med mod kyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste gal te tshu rol mthong ba la nag pa gson par byed pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad med mod kyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ni yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: Now, if one thinks, â€œEven though there is no direct valid knowledge that sees only a part that ascertains Blackâ€™s being alive, there is inference and so on,â€
