original: skad la sogs pa yis zhes pa ni des brjod pa'i sgra thos pa'am de'i dus na yid ches pas rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa de mthong nas lha sbyin gson no zhes smras pa'o //
analyzed: skad la sogs pa yis zhes pa ni des brjod pa'i sgra thos pa'am de'i dus na yid ches pas rtsig pa la sogs pas chod pa de mthong nas lha sbyin gson no zhes smras pa'o //
translated: By the sound and so on means that having heard the sound of the words expressed by that or having seen that at that time through the medium of a wall and so on, one says, â€˜Devadatta is alive.â€™

original: mngon sum la sogs pa log pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad ma las /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa log pa'i ngo bo dngos po med pa'i tshad ma las /
translated: The nature of direct perception and so on is reversed. There is no valid knowledge of a nonexistent thing.

original: khyim na ste khang pa na nag pa med par nges pa na gson pa'i khyad par can gyi nag pa med par grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pas kun nas bslang ba don gyis go ba 'di tshad ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim na ste khang pa na nag pa med par nges pa na gson pa'i khyad par can gyi nag pa med par grub pa'i phyir dngos po med pas kun nas bslang ba don gyis go ba 'di tshad ma nyid du grub pa yin no //
translated: When it is ascertained that there is no black cow in the house, the absence of a living black cow is established. Therefore, the non-existence of a thing is established as valid cognition by implication.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: In response to this, he says in that case, etc.

original: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as included within inference.

original: 'di ltar nag pa ni chos can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nag pa ni chos can no //
translated: Thus, the black cow is the subject.

original: de phyi rol na yod pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: de phyi rol na yod pa ni bsgrub bya'o //

analyzed: gson pa'i khyim na med pa ni gtan tshigs so //

analyzed: yang na khyim na med pa na gson pa ni gtan tshigs su bya'o //

analyzed: khyim gyi dang ra ba na gnas pa'i skyes bu ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The person dwelling in the house and the courtyard is the concordant example.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: Dwelling in the house is the discordant example.

original: khyi ma ni khang pa'o //
analyzed: khyi ma ni khang pa'o //
translated: The house is the abode.

original: khyab pa ni dpe dag las nges so //
analyzed: khyab pa ni dpe dag las nges so //
translated: The pervasion is ascertained from the examples.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar re zhig khyim na med pa nyid ni snang ba mi dmigs pas nges la /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig khyim na med pa nyid ni snang ba mi dmigs pas nges la /
translated: For, first of all, the nonexistence in the house is ascertained by the nonapprehension of the appearance.

original: gson pa ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa las grub po //
analyzed: gson pa ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa las grub po //
translated: And the living is established from the assertion of the other.

original: don dam par ni gtan tshigs the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni gtan tshigs the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, the reason is doubtful,

original: gson pa nyid du nges par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gson pa nyid du nges par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no valid cognition whatsoever that ascertains the living.

original: sgra la sogs pa yod pa nyid do zhes pa bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa yod pa nyid do zhes pa bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isnâ€™t it taught that sound and so on exist?

original: 'on te de lta na sgra la sogs pa gang kho na las gson par nges pa nyid las phyir rol na yod pa grub pa'i phyir don gyis go bas ci zhi bya /
analyzed: 'on te de lta na sgra la sogs pa gang kho na las gson par nges pa nyid las phyir rol na yod pa grub pa'i phyir don gyis go bas ci zhi bya /
translated: Or, if that is so, then since sound and so on are established as existing outside, from just what is ascertained as living, what is understood by implication?

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa las gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus par bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa las gtan tshigs grub par khas blangs nas rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su 'dus par bstan to //
translated: Therefore, having accepted that the reason is established from the assertion of the other, it is taught that it is included in inference.

original: don gyis go ba rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: don gyis go ba rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis of what is understood by implication.

original: dngos po med pa'i @61a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i @61a * //
translated: The nonexistence of nonthings

original: dbang du byas nas /ğŸ”½dngos po'i ngo bo gang zhig la //
analyzed: dbang du byas nas / dngos po'i ngo bo gang zhig la //
translated: From the point of view of power,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œWhatever is the nature of an entity . . . â€

original: de la spyod pa rnams kyis yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po dang de dngos po med pa dag ni dngos po nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la spyod pa rnams kyis yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos po dang de dngos po med pa dag ni dngos po nyid yin te /
translated: Therein, those who engage in conduct accept that entities and nonentities, which are characterized by existence and nonexistence, are entities.

analyzed: dngos po thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bos gnyis kyi bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba khas blangs so //
translated: All entities are the nature of both existence and nonexistence.

original: de la yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po rnam par gnas pa na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo de la ste dngos po'i cha med pa'i ngo bo la tshad ma lnga po ste don gyis go ba'i mthar thug pa mi
analyzed: de la yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis dngos po rnam par gnas pa na dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo de la ste dngos po'i cha med pa'i ngo bo la tshad ma lnga po ste don gyis go ba'i mthar thug pa mi
translated: When entities are established by way of the nature of both existence and nonexistence, then with regard to the nature of those entities, that is, with regard to the nature of entities that is not a part of entities, the five valid means of knowledge, which culminate in presumption,ğŸ”½do not arise.

original: skye'o // ci'i don du zhe na /ğŸ”½dngos yod rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye'o // ci'i don du zhe na / dngos yod rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: For what purpose?ğŸ”½For the sake of understanding existence.

original: dngos po'i yod pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i yod pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of understanding the aspect of the existence of entities.

original: de la dngos po med pa'i cha'i gzhal bya la /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i cha'i gzhal bya la /
translated: With regard to the object of comprehension that is the aspect of nonexistence,

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: It is a valid cognition of non-existence.

original: 'dis ni 'di'i yul 'ba' zhig bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i yul 'ba' zhig bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: This [verse] teaches only its object, not its own nature.

original: 'o na 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is its own nature like?

original: mngon sum la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, direct perception, etc.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa don gyis go ba'i mthar thug pa ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mar 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa don gyis go ba'i mthar thug pa ma skyes pa ni dngos po med pa'i tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: The non-arising of direct perception, etc., which are understood implicitly, is accepted as a valid cognition of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba ni drug pa de'i skyes bu'am las 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba ni drug pa de'i skyes bu'am las 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The term valid cognition of non-existence is the sixth case, the genitive, indicating its agent or instrument.

original: kha cig tu tshad ma las dngos med ces 'dod pa der ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'i bdun pa rigs gcig gi tshig yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu tshad ma las dngos med ces 'dod pa der ni dmigs kyis dgar ba'i bdun pa rigs gcig gi tshig yin te /
translated: In some [texts], it is asserted as non-existence from valid cognition. There, the seventh case, the ablative, is specified.

analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyi nang nas dngos po med pa'i tshad ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that among the valid cognitions, there is one called the valid cognition of non-existence.

original: ji skad du ri khrod rjes dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod rjes dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ste /
translated: As it is said, The non-existence of a forest is also a valid cognition of non-existence.

analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba 'di'i don gyis nyes pa ma yin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The meaning of the term â€œnon-existentâ€ is not a fault.

original: yang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba 'di'i ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: yang ma skyes pa zhes bya ba 'di'i ci zhig ce na /
translated: Again, what is the meaning of the term â€œunproducedâ€?

original: de dag yongs su ma gyur ba'am //
analyzed: de dag yongs su ma gyur ba'am //
translated: They are not transformed

original: dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /ğŸ”½mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pa de dgag par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po shes pa'i ngo bos yongs su ma gyur pa dngos po gnas pa'i bdag nyid brjod pa'am bum pa la sogs pa dben pa'i sa phyogs kyis
analyzed: dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin // zhes bya ba smos te / mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pa de dgag par bya ba mngon par 'dod pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po shes pa'i ngo bos yongs su ma gyur pa dngos po gnas pa'i bdag nyid brjod pa'am bum pa la sogs pa dben pa'i sa phyogs kyis
translated: into a different entity, consciousness.ğŸ”½The meaning of the term â€œunproducedâ€ is not transformed into the nature of the cognition of an object that is to be refuted, such as a pot, by means of direct perception, etc.

original: phyogs kyi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi shes pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the place devoid of a pot, etc., is the cognition of the place that is the nature of the enduring reality of the object.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dngos po dang bral ba la brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dngos po dang bral ba la brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Or, is the term â€œnon-existentâ€ not used to mean the absence of an entity?

original: des na 'di ji ltar @61b dngos po nyid yin /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar @61b dngos po nyid yin /
translated: In that case, how can it be an entity?

original: dngos po dang bral ba ni dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: dngos po dang bral ba ni dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: An absence cannot be an entity.

original: dngos po med pa dngos po nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po nyid du grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a nonthing is established as a thing.

original: dngos med tshad mas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos med tshad mas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, â€œA nonthing is a valid cognition,â€

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dngos por ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dngos por ma gyur na /
translated: because if a nonthing were not a valid cognition,

original: de lta na ni 'di nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas des na dngos po med pa zhig rtogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / snga na med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dngos po med pa rnam pa bzhir yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'di nus pa thams cad kyis stong pas des na dngos po med pa zhig rtogs par mi 'gyur ba dang / snga na med pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dngos po med pa rnam pa bzhir yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then since it would be empty of all capacity, it would not realize a nonthing, and it would not be the four types of nonthings, such as the nonexistence of something previously existent.

original: de ltar yang ma yin na /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin na /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa rtog pa rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa dang rnam pa bzhir dbye ba'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas dngos po med pa ni dngos po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa rtog pa rnam pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa dang rnam pa bzhir dbye ba'i 'jig rten gyi tha snyad gzhan du mi 'thad pas dngos po med pa ni dngos po nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that a nonthing is a conceptual cognition in any other way and it is untenable that the worldly convention of dividing it into four types is in any other way, a nonthing is a thing.

original: kha cig ni 'di gnyis ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'di gnyis ni dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say, â€œThese two are valid cognitions of nonthings.â€

original: gzhan dag ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes smras par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rnam pa bzhir dbye ba zhes bya ba 'di ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes smras par byed do //
translated: Others say that this is an inference called â€œthe fourfold division.â€

original: tshad ma yang 'di ltar byed do //
analyzed: tshad ma yang 'di ltar byed do //
translated: And they make a valid syllogism:

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid yin te /
translated: â€œThe non-existent is non-existent,

original: dbye bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is divisible, like a pot, etc.â€

original: ji ltar 'di rnam pa bzhir dbye ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rnam pa bzhir dbye ba de ltar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how this is divided into four parts, he says:

original: zho sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zho sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œcurds, etc.â€

original: 'jig rten 'o ma dang sa la sogs pa'i rgyu la zho dang bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba de lta bu rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'o ma dang sa la sogs pa'i rgyu la zho dang bum pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba de lta bu rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni snga na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The understanding that in the world, the effect, such as curds and pots, etc., does not exist in the cause, such as milk and clay, etc., is called â€œnon-existence prior to the operation.â€

original: gal te snga na med pa med par gyur na 'o ma la sogs pa la 'bras bu zho la sogs pa yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te snga na med pa med par gyur na 'o ma la sogs pa la 'bras bu zho la sogs pa yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the non-existent prior to the operation did not exist, then the effect, such as curds, etc., would exist in milk, etc.

original: de bzhin du zho la 'o mar brjod pa med pa nyid gang yin pa 'di ni zhig nas med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zho la 'o mar brjod pa med pa nyid gang yin pa 'di ni zhig nas med pa yin te /
translated: Likewise, the non-existence of milk in curd is its destruction and non-existence.

original: de lta ma yin na zho 'o ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zho 'o ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, curd would be milk.

original: ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa med pa ni gcig la gcig med par brjod do //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa med pa ni gcig la gcig med par brjod do //
translated: The non-existence of horse, etc. in cow, etc. is called the mutual absence.

original: gang gi phyir de la ba lang la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la ba lang la sogs pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo rta la sogs pa'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: Because in cow, etc. there is no nature of other, i.e. the nature of horse, etc.

original: de lta bas na de gnyis ni gcig la gcig med par brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyis ni gcig la gcig med par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, those two are called the mutual absence.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te gcig la gcig med par ma gur na ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½ri bong gi mgo bo'i yan lag spom pa 'phel ba dang sra ba dag dang bral ba'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i ngo @62a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te gcig la gcig med par ma gur na ba lang la sogs pa la rta la sogs pa yod par 'gyur ro // ri bong gi mgo bo'i yan lag spom pa 'phel ba dang sra ba dag dang bral ba'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa'i ngo @62a * //
translated: If it were not so, i.e. if the mutual absence were not so, then horse, etc. would exist in cow, etc.

original: bos shin tu med pa ni gtan nas med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bos shin tu med pa ni gtan nas med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The complete non-existence of the nature of rabbit horns, etc. in the head, etc. of a rabbit, which is devoid of the increase and hardness of the limbs of the head of a rabbit, is called the absolute non-existence.

original: 'dir gal te yang dngos po la brten nas gcig la gcig med pa yin pa de ltar na yang 'jig rten gyi grags pas gtan nas med pa zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir gal te yang dngos po la brten nas gcig la gcig med pa yin pa de ltar na yang 'jig rten gyi grags pas gtan nas med pa zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Here, if something is absent from something else in dependence on an entity, then it is said to be utterly nonexistent by the conventions of the world.

original: phal cher 'jig rten na gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad kyis gcig la gcig med pa'i tha snyad du byed de /
analyzed: phal cher 'jig rten na gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad kyis gcig la gcig med pa'i tha snyad du byed de /
translated: For the most part, in the world, the convention of mutual absence is made by the convention of common locus.

original: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin gyi rta ni ma yin no zhes bya'i /
analyzed: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin gyi rta ni ma yin no zhes bya'i /
translated: For example, it is said, â€œThis is a cow, not a horse,â€

original: 'di ri bong yin gyi rva ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ri bong yin gyi rva ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not said, â€œThis is a rabbit, not horns.â€

original: gal te gcig la gcig med pa med par 'gyur na ri bong la rva yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig la gcig med pa med par 'gyur na ri bong la rva yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If mutual absence did not exist, then horns would exist on a rabbit.

original: de skad du yang gzhon du ma len gyis /
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhon du ma len gyis /
translated: Thus, Kumarila says,

original: gal te 'di ni tshad ma len //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni tshad ma len //
translated: If this is accepted as valid cognition,

original: 'o ma zho nyid du 'gyur te //ğŸ”½zho ni 'o mar bum snam bur //
analyzed: 'o ma zho nyid du 'gyur te // zho ni 'o mar bum snam bur //
translated: then milk would be curd,ğŸ”½and a pot would be cloth.

original: ri bong la rva pa sogs la //
analyzed: ri bong la rva pa sogs la //
translated: And horns would exist on a rabbit,ğŸ”½and sentient beings would have bodies,

original: sems can dag ni lus can dang // chu la dri dang me la ro //
analyzed: sems can dag ni lus can dang // chu la dri dang me la ro //
translated: and water would have smell and fire taste.

original: rlung la de dag dang bcas gzugs //
analyzed: rlung la de dag dang bcas gzugs //
translated: and in the wind, these and form.

original: mkha' la de dag dang bcas reg / ces smras te /
analyzed: mkha' la de dag dang bcas reg / ces smras te /
translated: and in space, these and contact.

original: de la sems pa can ni bdag go //
analyzed: de la sems pa can ni bdag go //
translated: Here, the sentient being is the self.

original: lus can ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: lus can ni sra ba'o //
translated: The embodied being is the solid.

original: de dag dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro de dag gzugs dang bcas pa rlung la yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang gzugs zhes bya ba ni dri dang ro de dag gzugs dang bcas pa rlung la yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These and form means that smell and taste, together with form, exist in the wind.

original: de dag dang bcas reg ces bya ba ni gzugs dang ro dang dri de dag reg pa dang bcas pa ni mkha' la ste nam mkha' la yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dang bcas reg ces bya ba ni gzugs dang ro dang dri de dag reg pa dang bcas pa ni mkha' la ste nam mkha' la yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: These and contact means that form, smell, and taste, together with contact, exist in space.

original: gal te dngos po med pa snga nas med pa la sogs pa bye brag gis tha dad par ma gyur na 'jig rten na rgyu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa snga nas med pa la sogs pa bye brag gis tha dad par ma gyur na 'jig rten na rgyu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-existent things such as the prior non-existence of a pot were not different, then in the world, they would not be designated as different causes.

original: dper na gang zhig zho don du gnyer ba 'o ma len par mi byed kyi 'o ma don du gnyer ba zho len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na gang zhig zho don du gnyer ba 'o ma len par mi byed kyi 'o ma don du gnyer ba zho len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, one who seeks curd does not take milk, but one who seeks milk does not take curd.

original: de bzhin du ba lang don du gnyer ba rta mi len zhing rta don du gnyer ba ba lang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rgyu la sogs pa'i bye brag tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang don du gnyer ba rta mi len zhing rta don du gnyer ba ba lang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rgyu la sogs pa'i bye brag tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Likewise, one who seeks a cow does not take a horse, and one who seeks a horse does not take a cow.

original: ci ste yang gal te 'di rnam pa bzhir gyur pa de lta na yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te 'di rnam pa bzhir gyur pa de lta na yang dngos po nyid du 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba ga las yin zhe na /
translated: But if these are the four alternatives, then they must be real entities.

original: dbye ba 'di dngos med la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbye ba 'di dngos med la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is: â€œThis classification is not for non-entities.â€

original: dngos po med pa la ni tha dad par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni tha dad par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to distinguish non-entities.

original: de ni dngos po la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on entities.

original: de lta bas na dngos po med pa ni dngos po yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po med pa ni dngos po yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-entities are entities.

original: 'di'i dngos po nyid ci 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i dngos po nyid ci 'dra ba yin no zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of their entity?

original: 'bras bu la sogs zhes bya ba @62b smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs zhes bya ba @62b smos te /
translated: The response is: â€œEffects and so on.â€

original: 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid zho la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
translated: Whatever is the entity of the cause, such as milk, that itself is not the entity of the effect, such as yogurt.

original: zho la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dngos po gang yin pa de nyid 'o ma la sogs pa rgyu'i dngos po med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po med pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Whatever is the entity of the effect, such as yogurt, that itself is not the entity of the cause, such as milk. This is the entity of non-entity.

original: yang 'di'i dngos po nyid rjes su dpag pas grub par bya ba'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang 'di'i dngos po nyid rjes su dpag pas grub par bya ba'i phyir yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, in order to establish that very entity by inference, he says â€œorâ€ and so on.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: â€œNon-entity is entityâ€ is the proposition.

original: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i blo'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gnyis so //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i blo'i gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gtan tshigs gnyis so //
translated: â€œBecause it is the object of the mind that engages and disengagesâ€ and â€œbecause it is an object of comprehensionâ€ are the two reasons.

original: ba lang sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: ba lang sogs bzhin zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: â€œLike a cow, etc.â€ is the example.

original: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i blo ni bzhi char la med pa zhes bya ba'i gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'jug pa'i blo ni bzhi char la med pa zhes bya ba'i gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'o //
translated: The subsequent cognition is a cognition that has the form of a single entity, called â€œnon-existence,â€ in all four cases.

original: ldog pa'i blo ni 'di snga na med pa yin gyi zhig nas med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o ;
analyzed: ldog pa'i blo ni 'di snga na med pa yin gyi zhig nas med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa'o ;
translated: The cognition of cessation is a cognition that has the form of a difference, such as â€œThis is a non-existence prior to the existence, but not a non-existence after the existence.â€

original: ; de la gzhon nu ma len gyis dngos po med pa rnam pa gsum brjod de bdag yongs su ma gyur pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: ; de la gzhon nu ma len gyis dngos po med pa rnam pa gsum brjod de bdag yongs su ma gyur pa ni gcig go //
translated: Regarding this, Kumarila has described three types of non-existence: The first is the non-transformation of the self.

original: dngos po'i khyad par gzhan shes pa ni gnyis pa ste /ğŸ”½de bdag yongs su ma gyur pa'am //ğŸ”½dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gzhan shes pa ni gnyis pa ste / de bdag yongs su ma gyur pa'am // dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //
translated: The second is the cognition of another specific thing.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he explains:ğŸ”½The non-transformation of the selfğŸ”½or the cognition of another thing.

original: chad ma log pa tsam gyi bdag nyid ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: chad ma log pa tsam gyi bdag nyid ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The third is the mere absence of cessation.ğŸ”½Because he explains:

original: mtshan nyid gsum gyis bskyed bya gang //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum gyis bskyed bya gang //
translated: That which is produced by the three characteristics

original: blo de rjes su dpag par 'dod //
analyzed: blo de rjes su dpag par 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be an inference.

original: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of non-production

original: 'gar yang rgyu la rag las min //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gar yang rgyu la rag las min //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is never dependent on a cause.

original: de la dngos po med pa gsum pa 'di la klan ka 'dogs phal lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa gsum pa 'di la klan ka 'dogs phal lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to respond to the many objections to this third type of non-thing, he says:

original: dngos med ji ltar tshad ma yin //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dngos med ji ltar tshad ma yin // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: How can a non-thing be a valid cognition?

original: ci ste ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pa dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod ce na /ğŸ”½'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: ci ste ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa ma skyes pa dngos po med pa'i tshad mar brjod ce na / 'di la brjod pa /
translated: If one asks, â€œHow can direct perception and so on, which are unarisen, be described as non-thing valid cognitions?â€

original: 'di la gzhal bya'ang ci 'dra zhig / ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di la gzhal bya'ang ci 'dra zhig / ces bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Here, one must say, â€œWhat is the object of comprehension in this case?â€

original: 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya //ğŸ”½dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhal bya yin no zhe na /ğŸ”½'o na de lta na gzhal bya ji lta bur gyur pa tshad ma yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod par gyis shig / de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig brjod par bya // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhal bya yin no zhe na / 'o na de lta na gzhal bya ji lta bur gyur pa tshad ma yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid yin no zhes 'dod par gyis shig / de'i phyir /
translated: What is there to say here?ğŸ”½If you say that the nature of a non-thing is the object of comprehension, then in that case, you must accept that the valid cognition is just like the object of comprehension.

original: dngos med ji ltar tshad ma yin //
analyzed: dngos med ji ltar tshad ma yin //
translated: Therefore, how can a non-thing be a valid cognition?

original: zhes ci ste rjod par byed de /ğŸ”½tshad ma dang mi @63a * //ğŸ”½'dra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes ci ste rjod par byed de / tshad ma dang mi @63a * // 'dra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Why do you say this?ğŸ”½It is not logical for a valid cognition to be unlike its object of comprehension.

original: dngos po med pa tshad ma yin la rag mod /
analyzed: dngos po med pa tshad ma yin la rag mod /
translated: It is certainly the case that a non-thing is a valid cognition.

original: 'di ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa las tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mngon sum la sogs pa las tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this different from perception and so on?

original: tshad ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /ğŸ”½mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum la sogs pa las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i dngos po med pa'i tshad ma ni mngon sum la sogs pa las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: He says, â€œThe entity of a valid cognition that is a nonentity of perception and so on,â€ and so forth.

original: dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya dngos po med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gzhal bya dngos po med pa bzhin no //
translated: The entity of a valid cognition that is a nonentity of perception and so on is different from perception and so on because it is an object of expression by the term â€œnonentity,â€ like the object of comprehension â€œnonentity.â€

original: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po med par brjod pa'i gzhal bya ni chos can no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na dngos po med par brjod pa'i gzhal bya ni chos can no //
translated: Or, in another way, the object of comprehension that is expressed as a nonentity is the subject.

original: de'i rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma'i gzhal bya nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma'i gzhal bya nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The object of comprehension of a valid cognition that is compatible with it is the probandum.

original: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: â€œBecause it is an object of comprehensionâ€ is the reason.

original: dngos por brjod pa'i gzhal bya ni dpe'o //
analyzed: dngos por brjod pa'i gzhal bya ni dpe'o //
translated: The object of comprehension that is expressed as an entity is the example.

original: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de las byung ba'i mngon sum la sogs pa las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshad ma gang yin pa de las byung ba'i mngon sum la sogs pa las gzhan yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: It is established that it is different from the direct perception and so on that arises from the valid knowledge that is in accordance with itself.

original: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: des 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: He answers this with â€œIt is not so here,â€ and so on.

original: 'di ni bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa'am zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang po mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag nyid yongs su ma gyur pa'am zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang po mi srid par ston to //
translated: This shows that the first characteristic of non-existence, â€œnot having transformed itself,â€ is impossible.

original: 'di ltar ma yin par 'jug pa las yongs su 'gyur ba las bzlog pa yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa res 'ga' ba mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma yin par 'jug pa las yongs su 'gyur ba las bzlog pa yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa res 'ga' ba mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
translated: In this way, the opposite of transformation, non-transformation, is asserted as the characteristic of the occasional.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te ma yin par 'jug pas res 'ga' bar 'dod pa ma yin na de'i tshe thams cad du dngos po med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te ma yin par 'jug pas res 'ga' bar 'dod pa ma yin na de'i tshe thams cad du dngos po med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, if non-transformation were not asserted as occasional by the occurrence of non-existence, then at all times the absence of existence would be understood.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag la mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa de yang ji skad du bshad pa'i bdag la mi srid pa'o //
translated: And that non-transformation is impossible for the self as explained.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa'i sems can gyi yongs su 'gyur ba bsal zin pa de'i phyir ma yin par 'jug pas de las ldog pa'i yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa la brten pa ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa'i sems can gyi yongs su 'gyur ba bsal zin pa de'i phyir ma yin par 'jug pas de las ldog pa'i yongs su gyur pa ma yin pa la brten pa ga la 'gyur /
translated: Because the transformation of a permanent sentient being has already been refuted, therefore, since it does not engage in that, how could it be based on a transformation that is the opposite of that?

original: de la yod pa ni bdag go //
analyzed: de la yod pa ni bdag go //
translated: The self exists in that.

original: 'di ni rtag pa yang yin la sems can yang yin pas rtag pa'i sems can no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtag pa yang yin la sems can yang yin pas rtag pa'i sems can no //
translated: It is permanent and it is a sentient being, thus it is a permanent sentient being.

original: yang na rtag pa'i sems can de yod pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa'i sems can de yod pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Or, that which exists in the existence of that permanent sentient being is called that.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, it is permanent.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: The opposite of that is

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba de'i bzlog pa yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i res 'ga' bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'gyur ba de'i bzlog pa yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i res 'ga' bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The opposite of that transformation is non-transformation. It is not logical that it is sometimes.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: thams cad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gyur te /
translated: It is always.

original: bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig du'i @63b ngo bo yin phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa dang gcig du'i @63b ngo bo yin phyir ro //
translated: Because the self is the entity of the permanent and the one.

original: ci ste yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa yongs su 'gyur ba las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin pa yongs su 'gyur ba las bzlog pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not a transformation, then it is not the nature of a transformation, the opposite of a transformation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /

original: yongs su 'gyur ba bkag pa tsam gyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba bkag pa tsam gyi bdag nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of the mere negation of transformation.

analyzed: des na mtshan nyid mi srid par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, the characteristic is not impossible.

original: 'di smras pa /
analyzed: 'di smras pa /
translated: To this, the following is said:

translated: This is said of that which is the nature of the mere negation of transformation.ğŸ”½This is said of that

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag go //

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /

analyzed: dngos gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis pa 'khrul pa nyid du bshad do //

analyzed: ma mthong ba yang zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'o //
translated: â€œNot seenâ€ means separated by place, time, and nature.

analyzed: dngos med gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni / dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //
translated: â€œThe second nonexistenceâ€

original: zhes bya ba de las so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de las so //
translated: is from the passage â€œThe other entity is consciousness.â€

original: yang na ci ste ma mthong ba thams cad kyi bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ci ste ma mthong ba thams cad kyi bsgrub par bya ba med pa yin par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: what is it?
â€œThatâ€ğŸ”½refers to the second nonexistence.

translated: It is the nature of what is suitable to be seen, and it is the very nature of what is suitable to be seen in a place that is occupied by a pot, etc.

analyzed: rung ba nyid gang la yod pa de skad ces bya ste /

analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the characteristic of being an object of perceptionâ€”this is the meaning.

original: de yis dben pa shes pa na //
analyzed: de yis dben pa shes pa na //
translated: When one knows the absence of that,

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa phyogs shes pa na'o //

translated: If that were so, etc.ğŸ”½The entity that appears as the characteristic of being an object of perception is capable of being seen. That which has that aspect is like that.

analyzed: 'di ni blta bar nus pa'i dngos po snang ba yang yin la /
translated: This is the entity that appears as the characteristic of being an object of perception that is capable of being seen.

original: mngon sum yang yin no zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum yang yin no zhes bya ba ni las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is also direct perceptionâ€”this is the function of direct perception.

original: gzhan dag gis min zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis min zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: It is not by othersâ€”not by inference, etc.

analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi yul lkog tu gyur pa'i don nyid yin no //
translated: because their objects are hidden phenomena.

analyzed: de la ldog pa na yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i lkog tu gyur pa ldog pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ldog pa ni 'khrul pa can yin no // de lta yin dang / mngon sum la sogs ma skyes pa //
translated: Therefore, their overturning is mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la sogs pa smos pa don med par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang gal te de las gzhan pa'i dngos po shes par nges par gyur na de ltar na cig shos med pa sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya dgos te /

translated: If that is so, then it would be pointless to state such passages as, â€œDirect perception and so on do not arise.ğŸ”½â€ğŸ”½Moreover, if it were certain that consciousnesses of other things were known, then one would have to accept that the nonexistence of the other is established.

original: gzhan du na yod pa tsam gyis de las dngos po med pa grub na skyes bu gcig las skyes pa'i shes pa de las kyang skyes bu thams cad kyis dngos po med pa grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yod pa tsam gyis de las dngos po med pa grub na skyes bu gcig las skyes pa'i shes pa de las kyang skyes bu thams cad kyis dngos po med pa grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the mere existence of something established the nonexistence of something else, then the consciousness that arises from one person would establish the nonexistence of all other persons.

original: de la dpyod pa pa gang gis blo mngon sum ma yin par khas len pa des dngos po gzhan la shes pa 'di skye bar ji ltar shes par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la dpyod pa pa gang gis blo mngon sum ma yin par khas len pa des dngos po gzhan la shes pa 'di skye bar ji ltar shes par 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: How could the NaiyÄyikas, who accept that the mind is not a direct perceiver, know that this consciousness arises in regard to another object? They could not!

original: gal te don gyis go ba las //
analyzed: gal te don gyis go ba las //
translated: If you say that it is understood from the object,

analyzed: ji skad du don ma shes pa na blo mi 'grub pa'i phyir don shes pa'i rtags las blo rjes su dpog par byed do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, â€œBecause the mind is not established when the object is not known, the mind is inferred from the evidence of knowing the object.â€

analyzed: rjes su dpag par byed de 'jal bar byed @64b do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: 'o na gal te don gyis go ba de yang shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de yang gang las rtogs zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If you say that it is understood from the object, then since that also has the nature of consciousness, from what is it understood?

original: don gyis go ba gzhan las so zhe na /
analyzed: don gyis go ba gzhan las so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning is understood from another,

original: de lta yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½gzhan yang gal te dngos po med pa dngos po nyid du khas len na de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dngos po yin pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya yang yin pas de'i phyir dngos po med pa dngos po nyid yin
analyzed: de lta yin na thug pa med par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang gal te dngos po med pa dngos po nyid du khas len na de'i tshe ji ltar dngos po med pa'i tshad ma dngos po yin pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya yang yin pas de'i phyir dngos po med pa dngos po nyid yin
translated: then there would be an infinite regress.

original: pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du ci'i phyir khas len par mi bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid du ci'i phyir khas len par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, if you accept that a non-thing is a thing, then just as the valid knowledge of a non-thing is a thing, so too the object of comprehension of a non-thing would be a thing. Therefore, because a non-thing is a thing, why do you not accept that it is direct perception?

original: gang gis de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan du rtogs par byed /
analyzed: gang gis de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan du rtogs par byed /
translated: For what purpose do you understand a separate valid knowledge called â€œnon-thingâ€ in order to understand that?

analyzed: ji skad du 'bras bu la sogs pa dngos po med pa rgyu la sogs pa'i dngos po yin zhe bshad pa la / 'bras bu la sogs dngos med pa //
translated: In response to the explanation that a non-thing such as an effect is a thing such as a cause,

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon sum gyi khongs su 'dus pa de nyid sgrub par byed do //
translated: he proves that it is included in direct perception with such statements as:ğŸ”½â€œThe non-thing such as the effect . . .â€

original: gzhan gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu la sogs pa'i dngos po de yang 'bras bu la sogs pas dben pa'i rang bzhin mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dben pa'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu la sogs pa'i dngos po de yang 'bras bu la sogs pas dben pa'i rang bzhin mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cause, etc., of that thing, which is by nature devoid of effect, etc., is also directly perceived to be devoid of effect, etc.

original: gang gi tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no other object of comprehension that is a non-thing, which would be a different valid cognition.

original: tshad ma bdun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad ma bdun pa bzhin no //
translated: like the seventh valid cognition.

analyzed: dngos po med pa la yang mngon sum gyi gzhal bya las tha dad pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: The observation of the pervasion is: There is no object of comprehension that is different from the object of comprehension of direct perception in the case of a non-thing.

analyzed: 'di la gzhan gyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
