original: rang ngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang ngos zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond to this, ÅšÄntaraká¹£ita says â€œIf it were the nature of one thing,â€ and so on.

original: gal te dngos po gcig gi bdag nyid kho nar gyur na med pa gzhal byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gcig gi bdag nyid kho nar gyur na med pa gzhal byar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the nature of one thing, nonexistence would be the object of comprehension.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis go rims bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis go rims bzhin du yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po gnyis ka'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Because the two natures of existence and nonexistence are respectively the nature of own nature and the nature of other nature.

original: dngos po gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gnas pa de la ngo bo ste rang bzhin cung zad cig tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis shes par byed kyi thams cad thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gnas pa de la ngo bo ste rang bzhin cung zad cig tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis shes par byed kyi thams cad thams cad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: In that which abides as the nature of both entities, some nature, some essence, is known by some valid cognition, but not all by all.

original: de nyid ston pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To demonstrate just that, it says:

original: gang gi tshe dngos po'i cha 'dzin pa de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pa lnga'i bya ba @65a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po'i cha 'dzin pa de'i tshe mngon sum la sogs pa lnga'i bya ba @65a * //
translated: When it apprehends the aspect of an entity, it is the activity of the five such as direct perception.

original: yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the activity of nonentity.

original: dngos po med pa'i cha 'dzin par 'dod pa na de ma skyes pa'i bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i cha 'dzin par 'dod pa na de ma skyes pa'i bya ba yin te /
translated: When it is asserted to apprehend the aspect of nonentity, it is the activity of nonarising.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa de dag ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa de dag ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Those such as direct perception are nonarising.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, they are nonentities.

original: gal te gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du gyur na gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were both natures, the reason would not be established.

original: gang gi phyir gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin na ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin na ni 'gal ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that if it were both natures, it would be contradictory,

original: dngos po rnams gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œThings are not different from other things, etc.â€

original: gzhan gyi ngo bos dngos po gzhan las ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bos dngos po gzhan las ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Things are not different from other things by way of their own nature.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If you ask, â€œWell then, what?â€

original: rang gi ngo bos te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos te /
translated: [The answer is:] by way of their own nature.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin nyid dngos po gzhan las ldog par dmigs te rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin nyid dngos po gzhan las ldog par dmigs te rang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were the case, things would be observed to be different from other things by way of their own nature, their own essence, because they would abide in their own nature.

original: bdag nyid gang gis ldog pa des dngos po de yod pa nyid yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis ldog pa des dngos po de yod pa nyid yin gyi med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: By whatever nature they are different, by that nature those things exist, not that they do not exist.

original: dngos po de yang ldog pa'i bdag nyid des mngon sum yin pa'i phyir gnyis pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po de yang ldog pa'i bdag nyid des mngon sum yin pa'i phyir gnyis pa'i ngo bo dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And those things are not observed to have the nature of a second, because they are directly perceived by that nature of being different.

original: de ltar re zhig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du dam bca' ba la mngon sum dang 'gal bar bstan nas da ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir don byed nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du dam bca' ba la mngon sum dang 'gal bar bstan nas da ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir don byed nus pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, having shown that the thesis that the two are of the same nature is contradicted by perception, now, in order to show that it is contradicted by inference, he says, â€œThat which is able to perform a function.

original: gang zhig don gyi bya ba byed pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig don gyi bya ba byed pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: â€ That which performs the function of an object exists,

original: yod par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: yod par mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po bzhin no //
translated: like an entity that is accepted as existing.

original: yod par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang don gyi bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yod par 'dod pa'i dngos po yang don gyi bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: An entity that is accepted as existing performs the function of an object. This is a natural inference.

original: gang yang phan tshun 'gal ba de dag ni dngos po gcig la 'du ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang phan tshun 'gal ba de dag ni dngos po gcig la 'du ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, those that are mutually exclusive are not combined in a single entity.

original: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag gam /
analyzed: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag gam /
translated: For example, like shade and sunlight,

original: grang ba dang dro ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba dag bzhin no //
translated: or like cold and heat.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag kyang phan tshun 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The natures of existence and nonexistence are also mutually exclusive. This is the observation of the contradiction with the pervader.

original: gal te rang bsgrub bya la nus zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag gang na tshigs ma grub par ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang bsgrub bya la nus zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag gang na tshigs ma grub par ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, because of the statement â€œIf it is able to perform its own function,â€ and so on, then you are teaching that the reason is not established for others.

original: 'di ltar yang na dngos po gcig rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba la nus pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang na dngos po gcig rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba la nus pa la /
translated: In this way, if one thing is able to perform the function of its own object of affirmation,

original: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la ni mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la ni mi nus te /
translated: it is not able to perform the function of another object of affirmation.

original: de lta bas na don gyi bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don gyi bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs ni ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the reason, which has the characteristic of not performing the function of its object, is not established.

original: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba la ltos nas dngos po'i don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid @65b ma grub la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don gyi bya ba la ltos nas dngos po'i don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid @65b ma grub la /
translated: In dependence on the function of the object of anotherâ€™s affirmation, the function of the object of oneâ€™s own affirmation is not established.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yang ma yin te ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yang ma yin te ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: And the nature of existence and nonexistence are not mutually contradictory because they are not dependent.

original: 'di ltar rang gi sgrub par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba la ltos nas yod par brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi sgrub par byed pa'i don gyi bya ba la ltos nas yod par brjod la /
translated: In this way, in dependence on the function of oneâ€™s own object of affirmation, it is said to exist.

original: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas ni med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas ni med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In dependence on the function of anotherâ€™s object of affirmation, it is said to be nonexistent.

original: gal te rang gi bsgrub bya nyid la ltos nas kyang med pa nyid du brjod par gyur na ni phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi bsgrub bya nyid la ltos nas kyang med pa nyid du brjod par gyur na ni phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that it is nonexistent in reliance on its own probandum, then it would be mutually contradictory.

original: 'dir lan smras pa ni de nyid las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa ni de nyid las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here the response is â€œfrom that very thing.â€

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la mi nus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la nus pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba la mi nus pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That very nature of an entity that is able with regard to its own probandum is not able with regard to anotherâ€™s probandum, but it is not different.

original: ltos pa'i bye brag gis sgra tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa'i bye brag gis sgra tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that different things are different due to the difference in the words that depend on them.

original: de ni cha med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni cha med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is partless.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir gyi don te /
translated: â€œFrom that very thingâ€ means â€œfor that reason.â€

original: gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid kyi ngo bo gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A single nature does not have duality.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par mi nus pa ni gzhan nyid yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par mi nus pa ni gzhan nyid yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said, â€œThat which is not able to perform the function of anotherâ€™s probandum is different, but it is not that very thing,â€ğŸ”½then NÄgÄrjuna says,

original: gal te nus pa med gzhan las //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa med gzhan las //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it is powerless with regard to another,

original: de lta na 'o na don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po gcig go //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na don byed par nus pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po gcig go //
translated: If that is so, then whatever is able to perform a function is one entity,

original: gang yang don byed mi nus pa de ni gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba khyed cag gis dngos po gnyis nyid bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang don byed mi nus pa de ni gnyis pa yin no zhes bya ba khyed cag gis dngos po gnyis nyid bstan pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi gcig gnyi ga'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: and whatever is not able to perform a function is the second. You have taught only two entities, but one is not the nature of both.

original: tshad ma log pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid gsum la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma log pa tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid gsum la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the three characteristics of nonentity that are the mere cessation of valid knowledge is explained:

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: â€œNonentityâ€ and so on.

original: sngar khas blangs zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: sngar khas blangs zhes bya ba ni //
translated: â€œPreviously assertedâ€ refers to:

original: de bdag yongs su 'gyur ba'am //
analyzed: de bdag yongs su 'gyur ba'am //
translated: The transformation of that self

original: dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //
analyzed: dngos gzhan rnam par shes pa yin //
translated: Or the consciousness of another entity.

original: zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it was said.

original: slar yang de ni dngos med par //
analyzed: slar yang de ni dngos med par //
translated: â€œAgain, that is not a nonentityâ€

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'ang de ltar 'dod par gyis zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad ma'ang de ltar 'dod par gyis zhes smras pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it was said that valid knowledge should also be asserted in that way.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni yul rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni yul rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa ni tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the definition of valid cognition is the realization of an object, and it is not reasonable that a non-entity is valid cognition.

original: bsam pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsam pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that idea, he says,

original: ngo bo med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo bo med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œWithout an entity, etc.â€

original: de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tshad ma nyid do //
translated: â€œThatâ€ refers to valid cognition.

original: gang zhig gzhal bya rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhal bya rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: That which is not the entity of the realization of an object is not valid cognition,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //ğŸ”½dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya rtogs pas @66a * //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no // dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya rtogs pas @66a * //
translated: like a pot, etc.ğŸ”½And a non-entity is empty of the realization of an object.

original: stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa gzhal bya rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin yang gzhal bya rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du brjod pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems
analyzed: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa gzhal bya rtogs pa'i ngo bo ma yin yang gzhal bya rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du brjod pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin no snyam du sems
translated: You may think, â€œEven though the eyes and so on are not the nature of the realization of the object, they are the cause of the realization of the object. Therefore, because they are the cause of valid knowledge, the reason is not established.â€

original: na / gal te de yi rgyu yin phyir //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: na / gal te de yi rgyu yin phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: If you think that because it is the cause,

original: tshad ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar brtags nas tshad mar rtogs pa ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar brtags nas tshad mar rtogs pa ni rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to impute valid knowledge because it is the cause of valid knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir med pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du nus pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu nyid srid par rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du nus pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir rgyu nyid srid par rigs pa yin la /
translated: Because the definition of nonexistence is always devoid of capacity, it is logical that it is impossible for it to be a cause.

original: srid na yang med pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de khyad par med pa'i phyir de las byung ba'i shes pa ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid na yang med pa nyid nyams par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de khyad par med pa'i phyir de las byung ba'i shes pa ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it were possible, it follows that nonexistence would be undermined, and because it would be devoid of distinction, it follows that the arising of consciousness from it would be impossible.

original: gzhan yang ma grub pa ni log par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma grub pa ni log par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not logical that the nonestablished is the agent of refutation.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to /
translated: It has been demonstrated that this would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: // / dngos po med pa de yang ji ltar grub pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: // / dngos po med pa de yang ji ltar grub pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Moreover, it must be stated how that nonentity is established.

original: re zhig de rang nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de rang nyid kyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not established by itself,

original: gzhal bya med pa rang nyid kyis grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya med pa rang nyid kyis grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that the nonexistence of the object of cognition is established by itself.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma rtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma rtag pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then the permanent valid cognition of nonentity would be pointless,

original: de ni gzhal bya dngos po med pa grub par bya ba'i don du yin la gzhal bya dngos po med pa de yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma bzhin du rang nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhal bya dngos po med pa grub par bya ba'i don du yin la gzhal bya dngos po med pa de yang dngos po med pa'i tshad ma bzhin du rang nyid la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is for the purpose of establishing the nonentity that is the object of cognition, and that nonentity that is the object of cognition is established by itself, just like the valid cognition of nonentity.

original: de rang rig pas grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang rig pas grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not established by reflexive awareness,

original: shes pa'i dngos po dben pa 'di ji ltar rang rig pas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa'i dngos po dben pa 'di ji ltar rang rig pas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: because how could this isolation of the entity of consciousness be realized by reflexive awareness?

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid des rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid des rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is the nature of consciousness is realized by that.

original: ci ste de'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa gzhan la de grub pas de'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa de yang ji ltar grub /
analyzed: ci ste de'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa gzhan la de grub pas de'i yul can gyi tshad ma med pa de yang ji ltar grub /
translated: But if that is established by another valid knowledge whose object is that, then how is that valid knowledge whose object is that established?

original: de yang gzhan las grub na thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan las grub na thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: And if that is established by another, then there is an infinite regress.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gzhan du mi dmigs pa las ni //
analyzed: gzhan du mi dmigs pa las ni //
translated: If nonobservation of something else

original: don gyis med pa nyid rtogs na //
analyzed: don gyis med pa nyid rtogs na //
translated: realizes the nonexistence of the object,

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid kyang ni //
translated: then the nonexistence of observation

original: gzhan gyis yin pas thug pa med //ğŸ”½ces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis yin pas thug pa med // ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: would be by another, and so on to infinity.

original: ci ste thug pa med par 'gyur du 'ong bas gzhal bya med pas de grub par khas blang bar byed na de lta yin na phan tshun brten pa @66b nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste thug pa med par 'gyur du 'ong bas gzhal bya med pas de grub par khas blang bar byed na de lta yin na phan tshun brten pa @66b nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that it is established by the nonexistence of the object, because otherwise there would be an infinite regress, then in that case there would be mutual dependence,

original: 'di ltar gzhal bya dngos po med pa las tshad ma dngos po med pa grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhal bya dngos po med pa las tshad ma dngos po med pa grub la /
translated: because the nonexistence of the valid knowledge is established from the nonexistence of the object.

original: de grub pa na yang gzhal bya dngos po med pa grub po zhes bya ba 'di yang phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa 'jug pa gsal rab pa nyid do //
analyzed: de grub pa na yang gzhal bya dngos po med pa grub po zhes bya ba 'di yang phan tshun brten pa'i nyes pa 'jug pa gsal rab pa nyid do //
translated: And when that is established, then the non-existence of the object of cognition is established. This is the clear manifestation of the error of mutual dependence.

original: des na 'di ni 'byung bar 'dod pa'i rdzi ma mig tu zhugs pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na 'di ni 'byung bar 'dod pa'i rdzi ma mig tu zhugs pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, this is like the eyelashes that are desired to grow, but enter the eye.

original: ; de lta bas na gcig dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum las logs shig pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //ğŸ”½'di snyam du gcig dmigs pa de yang ji ltar grub /
analyzed: ; de lta bas na gcig dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba mngon sum las logs shig pa'i tshad ma ma yin no // 'di snyam du gcig dmigs pa de yang ji ltar grub /
translated: Thus, since the mere perception of one thing is the non-perception of another, non-existence is not a separate valid cognition from perception.

original: de yang dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de yang dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, â€œHow is the perception of one thing established? And since that is also non-existence, the absurd consequence is the same,â€

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NÄgÄrjuna explains:

original: gcig mthong ba de yang rang nyid kyis te rang dbang can du grub kyi gzhan las ma yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig mthong ba de yang rang nyid kyis te rang dbang can du grub kyi gzhan las ma yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the perception of one thing is established by itself, that is, by its own power, and not from another, the absurd consequence of an infinite regress and so on does not follow.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang gi ngo bos te rang bzhin gyi bems po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos te rang bzhin gyi bems po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not matter, that is, it is not an entity that is essentially or naturally inanimate.

original: ci ste blo gzhan gyis grub pa la ci zhig sdang zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste blo gzhan gyis grub pa la ci zhig sdang zhe na /
translated: But if it is established by another cognition, what is the problem?

original: rtags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, â€œThe reason, etc.â€

original: kha cig gi blo rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig gi blo rtags kyis rtogs par bya ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that cognition is to be understood through a reason.

original: rtags de yang don shes pa'i bya ba'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: rtags de yang don shes pa'i bya ba'i ngo bo'am /
translated: That reason is the nature of the activity of the cognition of an object,

original: dbang po dang don nam /
analyzed: dbang po dang don nam /
translated: or it is the sense faculty and the object,

original: yul gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //ğŸ”½kha cig ni blo gzhan gyi mngon sum ma yin par 'dod kyi rang rig pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // kha cig ni blo gzhan gyi mngon sum ma yin par 'dod kyi rang rig pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin te /
translated: or it is the manifestation of the object, and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some assert that cognition is not the direct perception of another cognition but is the nature of reflexive awareness, because it is contradictory for it to act upon itself.

original: kha cig na re shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re shes pa gzhan du mi 'thad pa ste /
translated: Some say that another cognition is untenable,

original: gal te blo med par gyur na shes pa'i don gyis 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te blo med par gyur na shes pa'i don gyis 'grub ste /
translated: because if there were no cognition, it would be established by the object of cognition,

original: de ni rang bzhin bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin bems po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the nature of an essentially inanimate object.

original: de'i phyir phyogs gsum pa bshad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gsum pa bshad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, the third position is explained as follows:

original: rtags la sogs pa gsum po 'di ni rtags la sogs pa de yang ga las grub ces re re la yang brgal zhing brtag pa gang yin pa de yod pa na thug pa med par mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtags la sogs pa gsum po 'di ni rtags la sogs pa de yang ga las grub ces re re la yang brgal zhing brtag pa gang yin pa de yod pa na thug pa med par mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one analyzes each of the threeâ€”the reason, etc.â€”asking, â€œHow are these established?â€ then there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar blo ma grub pa na rtags la sogs pa gsum po de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo ma grub pa na rtags la sogs pa gsum po de yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because when the cognition is not established, those threeâ€”the reason, etc.â€”are not established.

original: yang gzhan las grub par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: yang gzhan las grub par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: And it would be necessary to accept that they are established from something else.

original: de la yang rtags la sogs pa gzhan la brten pa thams cad du brgal zhing brtags pa na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang rtags la sogs pa gzhan la brten pa thams cad du brgal zhing brtags pa na yang thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one analyzes each of those other things, such as the reason, etc., in terms of the threeâ€”the reason, etc.â€”then again there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta bas @67a * //
analyzed: de lta bas @67a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na gcig dmigs pas gzhan med par rtogs te /
analyzed: na gcig dmigs pas gzhan med par rtogs te /
translated: one realizes that another is absent when one observes one.

original: yul dang dus der dgag par bya ba la rung ba'i bdag nyid du mtshungs pa nyid dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus der dgag par bya ba la rung ba'i bdag nyid du mtshungs pa nyid dgag par bya ste /
translated: One should negate the mere equivalence of the object of negation in terms of being suitable in that place and time.

original: gzhan dag der dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag der dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to negate others in that place and time.

original: de'i bdag nyid dgag pa las ni thams cad kyis dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dgag pa las ni thams cad kyis dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: And by the negation of its identity, it is negated by all,

original: thams cad ni mthong ba las gzhan nyid du mthong bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad ni mthong ba las gzhan nyid du mthong bar gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: because all are seen as different from what is seen,

original: de dag gzhan gyi bdag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gzhan gyi bdag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the identity of something else.

original: 'on te gang gi tshe nam mkha' la zla ba med par nges pa de'i tshe gang gi gcig dmigs pa las gzhan med par grub pa zhes bya bar brjod pa de la gcig dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe nam mkha' la zla ba med par nges pa de'i tshe gang gi gcig dmigs pa las gzhan med par grub pa zhes bya bar brjod pa de la gcig dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But when the moon is ascertained to be absent in the sky, then at that time, when it is said that the nonexistence of the other is established from the observation of one, there is no observation of one.

original: gang zhig zla bas dben par mthong ba nam mkha' zhes bya bar don dam par cung zad yod pa pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig zla bas dben par mthong ba nam mkha' zhes bya bar don dam par cung zad yod pa pa ni ma yin la /
translated: That which is seen as empty of the moon is not in the least existent in reality as the so-called sky.

original: gang yang gzhan gyi dngos po yod par brtag pa de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzhan gyi dngos po yod par brtag pa de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
translated: And that which is imagined to be the existence of another thing is also beyond the senses.

original: gang yang phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sgra med par nges pa de gang zhig dmigs pa las yin /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sgra med par nges pa de gang zhig dmigs pa las yin /
translated: And when sound is ascertained to be absent in some place, from what is that established?

original: re zhig phyogs dmigs pa las so zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dmigs pa las so zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: First, it should not be said that it is from the observation of the place.

original: de ni sgra dang rung ba'i rang bzhin du mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sgra dang rung ba'i rang bzhin du mi mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the sound and the suitability are not the same.

original: de ltar sa phyogs ni mngon sum gyi yin la sgra ni nyan pas yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sa phyogs ni mngon sum gyi yin la sgra ni nyan pas yin no //
translated: Thus, the place is perceived by the visual consciousness, and the sound is perceived by the auditory consciousness.

original: rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yang phan tshun ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'dod de /
analyzed: rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin yang phan tshun ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'dod de /
translated: The nature of the suitability is also accepted as being different from each other, in dependence on each other.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i gzhan nyid ni shes pa gcig la 'dres pa'i zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i gzhan nyid ni shes pa gcig la 'dres pa'i zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in dependence on each other is explained as being mixed in one cognition.

original: dus dmigs pa las so zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dus dmigs pa las so zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that time is perceived from the object,

original: gang zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i dus yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dmigs par 'gyur ba'i dngos po las tha dad pa'i dus yod pa ma yin la gzhan gyi 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin no //
translated: because time does not exist separately from the object that is perceived, and what is accepted by the other is beyond the senses.

original: snang ba dang ni mun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: snang ba dang ni mun pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The reply to the statement, â€œLight and darkness, etc.,â€ is as follows.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni rigs pa zhes bya ba de dang 'brel to //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni rigs pa zhes bya ba de dang 'brel to //
translated: The word â€œaggregateâ€ is connected with the word â€œreason.â€

original: gang gi phyir snang ba dang mun pa'i phung po de nyid nam mkha'o snyam du rtog pa pos rtogs kyis gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba dang mun pa'i phung po de nyid nam mkha'o snyam du rtog pa pos rtogs kyis gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the one who conceives of the mass of light and darkness as space conceives of it as something other than that.

original: 'di ltar nyin mo'am mtshan mo yang rung nam mkha' 'di ni mthon ka chen po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyin mo'am mtshan mo yang rung nam mkha' 'di ni mthon ka chen po dang 'dra'o //
translated: Thus, whether it is day or night, one conceives of space as like the great heights.

original: yang na 'di sprin dang 'dra'o snyam du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: yang na 'di sprin dang 'dra'o snyam du rtogs kyi /
translated: Or, one conceives of it as like a cloud.

original: nam mkha' la gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the color, shape, etc., imagined by others as space do not exist in space.

original: de'i @67b phyir gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang mun pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i nam mkha' med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i @67b phyir gzhan zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang mun pa'i phung po las ma gtogs pa'i gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i nam mkha' med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Therefore, because there is no space imagined by something other than that which is not excluded from the mass of light and darkness,

original: yod na yang dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na yang dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is beyond the senses, even if it exists.

original: sgra thams cad kyis dben pa yang 'bras bu nyan pa'i shes pa ma dmigs pas rtogs te /
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyis dben pa yang 'bras bu nyan pa'i shes pa ma dmigs pas rtogs te /
translated: One also understands the absence of all sound by the non-apprehension of the consciousness that hears the sound.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gzhan yang dag par rig pa las grub pa'i phyir 'di la yang shes pa gzhan rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gcig dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa gzhan yang dag par rig pa las grub pa'i phyir 'di la yang shes pa gzhan rigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gcig dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: And since that non-apprehension is established from the correct knowledge of other cognitions such as the visual, etc., in this case also there is the existence of the apprehension of one by another cognition, by the characteristic of reasoning.

original: gang gi 'bras bu yod pa de ldog pa na de yang ldog par byed pa 'bras bu yod pas sgra yod pa la khyab pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu yod pa de ldog pa na de yang ldog par byed pa 'bras bu yod pas sgra yod pa la khyab pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And the existence of the effect is not pervaded by the existence of the sound, because when the latter ceases, the former also ceases, since it has an effect.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu rnams ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: For it is not the case that causes necessarily have that.

original: rgyu yod pa thams cad la 'bras bu yod pas khyab bo zhes bya ba ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa thams cad la 'bras bu yod pas khyab bo zhes bya ba ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that the existence of all causes is pervaded by the existence of the effect.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what do we say?

original: nus pa de thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par can kho na yin la /
analyzed: nus pa de thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par can kho na yin la /
translated: That potency is only characterized by the absence of obstruction.

original: de nyid 'dir 'gegs par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir 'gegs par byed kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: And that alone is refuted here, not all.

original: phyogs 'ba' zhig dmigs pa las bum pa med par grub pa gang yin pa de la yang bum pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: phyogs 'ba' zhig dmigs pa las bum pa med par grub pa gang yin pa de la yang bum pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is established as the nonexistence of a pot from the observation of a part is also the nonobservation of the effect, called the nonobservation of a pot.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir bum pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i phyir bum pa med pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is characterized by observation, the nonexistence of a pot is what is to be established, not everything.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is characterized by observation?

original: nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa thogs pa med pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the unobstructed capacity.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba zhes bya bas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi khyad par brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gang yod na mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ba zhes bya bas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi khyad par brjod do //
translated: Because it is said that when a nature exists, it is just manifest, the nature is described as characterized by observation.

original: gzhan du na 'di la yang bum pa dmigs pas bum pa yod pa la ma khyab par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di la yang bum pa dmigs pas bum pa yod pa la ma khyab par 'gyur la /
translated: Otherwise, since a pot is observed here, the existence of a pot would not be pervaded by it.

original: de lta yin dang khyab byed ma yin pa log pa na khyab bya ma yin pa mi ldog pas de bas na bum pa med par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyab byed ma yin pa log pa na khyab bya ma yin pa mi ldog pas de bas na bum pa med par grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then when the nonpervasive is refuted, the nonpervaded would not be refuted, and therefore the nonexistence of the pot would not be established.

original: de lta bas na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: Therefore, all nonapprehension of intrinsic nature is a reason for the designation of nonexistence.

original: don dam par ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, the nonapprehension of effect should be seen as the best.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po med pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos po med pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du 'chad do //
translated: As for the argument that the term â€œnonexistentâ€ is used to express the absence of intrinsic nature, he explains that it is indeterminate.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: â€œ As for thatâ€ means

original: @68a * // de'i phyir gcig mthong gang yin pa //
analyzed: @68a * // de'i phyir gcig mthong gang yin pa //
translated: â€œTherefore, that which is seen in one

original: de nyid gzhan ma mthong bar brjod //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan ma mthong bar brjod //
translated: is said to be seen in the other.â€

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: And so on.

original: khongs su 'dus kyang gnod pa med //
analyzed: khongs su 'dus kyang gnod pa med //
translated: Even though it is included, there is no fault.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa mngon sum gyi khongs su ma gtogs na yang dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa mngon sum gyi khongs su ma gtogs na yang dngos po med pa'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin pa mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that even though non-existence is not included among the direct perceptions, it is not contradictory that it is the object expressed by the word non-existence.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason is not absent in the discordant side.ğŸ”½The similar is so for the other.

original: rjes mthun de 'dra yin la rag / ces bya ba ni gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rjes mthun de 'dra yin la rag / ces bya ba ni gzhan dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The other non-apprehension characterized by the apprehension of something else is non-existence.

original: gang yang kha cig dngos po med pa tsam dmigs pa'i shes pa mngon sum 'gal ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis khongs su 'dus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang kha cig dngos po med pa tsam dmigs pa'i shes pa mngon sum 'gal ba la sogs pa 'ga' zhig gis khongs su 'dus pa ma yin te /
translated: Some say that the cognition that merely apprehends non-existence is not included among the direct perceptions, etc., because of being in contradiction with them.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa ni dngos po dang bral ba tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum la sogs pa yang dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa ni dngos po dang bral ba tsam yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum la sogs pa yang dngos po'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its object is merely the absence of an entity, and because the direct perceptions, etc., have entities as their objects.

original: 'di tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di tshad ma nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin te mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that it is not a valid cognition, because it is non-deceptive.

original: dngos po rnams rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par 'dod pa khyed cag gi dngos po dang bral ba'i mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes rtsod par byed pa de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig par 'dod pa khyed cag gi dngos po dang bral ba'i mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes rtsod par byed pa de yang 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: This response also refutes that.

original: rnam par rtog pa des yul dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i dngos po med pa tsam dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa des yul dang dus la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba'i dngos po med pa tsam dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That conception does not apprehend the mere absence of things that are devoid of the distinctions of place, time, and so on.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /ğŸ”½yul la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu bum pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i yang tshul gyis khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin no //ğŸ”½de yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi yul la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur bas 'di logs shig tu tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / yul la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu bum pa la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i yang tshul gyis khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin no // de yang 'ba' zhig pa nyid kyi yul la sogs pa 'dzin par nus pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur bas 'di logs shig tu tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: What does it apprehend?ğŸ”½It is a conception that apprehends the absence of a pot, for example, in a particular place, and so on.ğŸ”½Since it is able to apprehend only a place that is devoid of a pot, and so on, it is not a separate valid knowledge.

original: yul la sogs pa 'ba' zhig de ltar bzung ba ni 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa 'ba' zhig de ltar bzung ba ni 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it apprehends a place that is devoid of a pot, and so on, in that way through conception.

original: khyad par med pa 'dzin pa yin na yang de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa 'dzin pa yin na yang de la 'dzin pa'i shes pa tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the apprehension of something that is not different, it is not reasonable that the apprehending cognition is valid knowledge.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / don byed pa don du gnyer ba tshad ma sems pa yang dngos po la brten pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir dang / don byed pa don du gnyer ba tshad ma sems pa yang dngos po la brten pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it has a nonexistent object, and because those who seek to accomplish a purpose think that valid knowledge depends on a real thing, this [apprehension of something that is not different] is nothing at all.

original: dngos po med pa rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: This concludes the analysis of nonthings.

original: rigs pa gzhan de yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas /ğŸ”½de yod pa na 'di 'byung zhing //
analyzed: rigs pa gzhan de yod na yod pa dang mi dmigs pa'i dbang du byas nas / de yod pa na 'di 'byung zhing //
translated: If there is another reason, then in terms of existence and non-observation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the opponent] says, â€œWhen that exists, this arises,â€ and so on.

original: de @68b yod na yod pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de @68b yod na yod pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: This is reasonable, because when that exists, it is understood to be its effect.

original: 'di yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di yang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: But this is not perception, because it involves thought.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it inference,

original: dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no example.

analyzed: 'di ltar dpe la yang de yod na yod pa nyid las 'bras bu nyid du rtogs te /
translated: Thus, if it exists in the example, it is understood to be the effect of existence.

original: de la yang dpe btsal bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de la yang dpe btsal bar bya ba yin la /
translated: And in that case, an example would have to be sought for that,

original: de la yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and in that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no zhes sman dpyad pa ste sman pa la zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no zhes sman dpyad pa ste sman pa la zer ro //
translated: Therefore, this is another valid cognition, as the physician said.

original: de bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pas med pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni ma dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs pa la sogs pas med pa nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni ma dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, non-existence is understood through observation, etc., and this is non-observation.

original: 'di yang tshad ma gzhan nyid yin pa la snga ma bzhin du rigs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang tshad ma gzhan nyid yin pa la snga ma bzhin du rigs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: And this is another valid cognition, as the reasoning stated earlier should be applied.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /

original: rgyu 'bras dang dngos po med pa yin pas rgyu 'bras nyid dang dngos po med pa dag ste /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras dang dngos po med pa yin pas rgyu 'bras nyid dang dngos po med pa dag ste /
translated: Since cause and effect are non-existent, they are cause and effect and non-existent.

original: de dag gis rtogs pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rtogs pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te bsdu'o //
translated: By those, understanding is connected and summarized.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ni rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu rtogs pa ni rigs pa yin la /
translated: There, understanding cause and effect is reasonable.

original: dngos po med pa rtogs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes go rims bzhin du 'brel to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa rtogs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes go rims bzhin du 'brel to //
translated: The realization of the nonexistence of an entity is nonapprehension.

original: rigs pa dang mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni tshad ma gnyis la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bye brag med do //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni tshad ma gnyis la yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bye brag med do //
translated: In these two valid cognitions, reason and nonapprehension, the probandum and the proof are not different.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang phyir de yod na yod pa //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir de yod na yod pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because when it exists, it exists.

original: re zhig rigs pa la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bye brag med de //
analyzed: re zhig rigs pa la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag bye brag med de //
translated: In reason, the probandum and the proof are not different.

original: 'di ltar de yod pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: For example, when it exists, it is the reason.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is the probandum.

original: de dag tha dad du dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag tha dad du dmigs pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: rnam grangs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are synonyms.

original: shing dang rtsva bas 'thung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing dang rtsva bas 'thung ba bzhin no //

original: mi dmigs pa la yang bye brag med de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la yang bye brag med de /
translated: In nonapprehension, they are not different.

analyzed: 'di ltar gal te dmigs pa log pa tsam brjod par 'dod pa de'i tshe de yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, if the mere negation of apprehension is intended, then that is not established.

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du thug pa med pa la sogs pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: As before, the error of infinite regress, etc., should be stated.

original: ci ste gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin la /
translated: But if the non-apprehension of something else is itself the non-apprehension of light, then it is included in the non-apprehension of light.

original: 'dis kyang dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: And this does not prove the non-existence of an entity,

original: de ni mngon sum nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is established by perception itself.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /ğŸ”½snang ba mi dmigs @69a * //ğŸ”½ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / snang ba mi dmigs @69a * // ma gtogs pa //
translated: For that very reason,ğŸ”½he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: â€œExcept for the non-apprehension of light,â€ etc.

original: ci ste 'di dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang med pa bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag las rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang med pa bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not the case that causality and non-existence are established from these,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is?

original: de yang yod pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de la /
analyzed: de yang yod pa'i tha snyad yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de la /
translated: If it is maintained that â€œthat is also the convention of existence,â€ğŸ”½then he says,

original: de yang ngo bo'i tha snyad du //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo'i tha snyad du //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œThat is also the convention of essence,â€ etc.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de dag gi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo yin la de la tha snyad gang yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo'i tha snyad de shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de dag gi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo yin la de la tha snyad gang yin pa de ni de'i ngo bo'i tha snyad de shes pa dang brjod pa 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The nature of those things that are causes and effects is their nature, and the convention that is in regard to that is the convention in regard to their nature.

original: rmongs pa la der rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rmongs pa la der rung ba nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: The suitability of that is to be established in regard to the confused.

original: dper na gang dag gang gi mjug thogs su nges par dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de dag ni de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na gang dag gang gi mjug thogs su nges par dmigs pa'i rang bzhin de dag ni de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad du rung ba yin te /
translated: For example, those things that are definitely perceived immediately after something are suitable for the convention of being its effect.

original: dper na brda'i dus su nyams su myong ba'i rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i bya ba'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na brda'i dus su nyams su myong ba'i rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i bya ba'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin bzhin no //
translated: For example, the nature of a pot, etc. that is perceived immediately after the activity of a potter, etc. that was experienced at the time of a convention.

original: de bzhin du sgra rnams kyang rkan la sogs pa'i bya ba'i mjug thogs su nges par dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra rnams kyang rkan la sogs pa'i bya ba'i mjug thogs su nges par dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: In the same way, sounds are definitely perceived immediately after the activity of the palate, etc. This is an inference based on nature.

original: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa la yang tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba sbyor ba ni gang gi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar mngon par 'dod pa gang dag nam dmigs pa de dag ni de med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dmigs pa la yang tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba sbyor ba ni gang gi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur bar mngon par 'dod pa gang dag nam dmigs pa de dag ni de med pa'i tha snyad du byar rung ba yin te /
translated: Likewise, in the case of non-apprehension, the syllogism to prove the term is this: Whatever is apprehended as having the characteristic of that is suitable to be termed â€œthe absence of that.â€

original: dper na rva med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i ri bong gi mgo bo la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rva med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'i ri bong gi mgo bo la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the head of a rabbit, etc., is suitable to be termed â€œthe absence of horns.â€

original: de'i rten du 'dod pa'i khra bo la sogs pa la yang gzhan gyis mngon par 'dod pa'i spyi la sogs pa'i dngos po dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur par mngon par 'dod pa ma dmigs so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'o //

translated: And in the case of a multicolored object, etc., which is accepted as the basis of that, the other party does not apprehend the object, such as the universal, etc., which is accepted as having the characteristic of being apprehended. This is the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: des dben pa'i khra bo la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des dben pa'i khra bo la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the multicolored object, etc., which is devoid of that is apprehended,

original: ma grub pa ma yin la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa ma yin la gtan tshigs ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: it is not unestablished, nor is the reason uncertain.

original: mngon par gsal ba 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dngos po'i tha snyad la 'di de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dngos po'i tha snyad la 'di de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would block the manifestation of the effect, and because this is the reason for the convention of entity.

analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the similar instance.

analyzed: de la srid pa'i mtshan nyid tshogs pa yod par rtogs pa na tshogs pa can rtogs pa gang yin pa ste /
