analyzed: dper na stong yod par shes pa na brgya la sogs pa yod par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the existence of a thousand is understood, the existence of a hundred, etc., is understood.

original: 'di yang dpe med pa'i @69b phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang dpe med pa'i @69b phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: But this is not an inference, because there is no example.

original: 'di la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la sun 'byin pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The refutation of this is stated:ğŸ”½The cause of the establishment of the collection

original: tshogs pa rnam par gzhog pa yi //ğŸ”½zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa rnam par gzhog pa yi // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: is the members of the collection.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa can las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa can las gzhan pa'i tshogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no collection apart from the members of the collection,

original: tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni tshogs pa can yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ni tshogs pa can yin no //
translated: the cause of the establishment of the collection is the members of the collection.

original: de lta bas na stong las brgya la sogs pa srid par rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na stong las brgya la sogs pa srid par rtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the existence of a hundred from a thousand is born from the evidence of the effect.

original: gzhan dag gis ni zhes grags pa la sogs pa yang tshad ma gzhan du 'dod de /ğŸ”½de la smra ba pos bstan pa'i grags pa rgyud pa ni zhes grags pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni zhes grags pa la sogs pa yang tshad ma gzhan du 'dod de / de la smra ba pos bstan pa'i grags pa rgyud pa ni zhes grags pa ste /
translated: Others assert that the other means of knowledge are reputation and so on.

original: dper na shing ljon pa 'di la gnod sbyin gnas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing ljon pa 'di la gnod sbyin gnas so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Reputation is the transmission of what is known by others, such as the statement, â€œThis tree is the abode of a yaká¹£a.â€

original: yul dang dus nges pa med par glo bur du yod pa dang med pa ston par byed pa'i shes pa ni snyam du shes pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus nges pa med par glo bur du yod pa dang med pa ston par byed pa'i shes pa ni snyam du shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of what is known is the knowledge that something exists or does not exist suddenly without a definite place or time.

original: dper na gzhon nu ma dag 'di snyam du deng bdag gi ming po 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
analyzed: dper na gzhon nu ma dag 'di snyam du deng bdag gi ming po 'ong ngo snyam pa la /
translated: For example, young women may think, â€œToday my brother will come,â€

original: de yang de kho na ltar 'ong bar grags pa lta bu ste de ltar na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de kho na ltar 'ong bar grags pa lta bu ste de ltar na tshad ma yin no //
translated: and he comes just as they thought. That is known as reputation, and it is a means of knowledge.

original: 'di sun dbyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di sun dbyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To refute that, he says, â€œThe knowledge of what is known is not a means of knowledge.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngo shes pa la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ngo shes pa la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: The words â€œand so onâ€ include recognition and so on.

original: de dag gzhan 'ga' zhig gis tshad ma nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gzhan 'ga' zhig gis tshad ma nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some others accept these as valid cognitions.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mthar yang ras 'ga' bden pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi mthar yang ras 'ga' bden pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir tshad ma gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the absurd consequence that there would be other valid cognitions, because even at the end of a dream, some cloth is seen to be real.

original: de ltar rgyas par tshad ma gzhan dgag par byas nas mdor bsdus nas bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par tshad ma gzhan dgag par byas nas mdor bsdus nas bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus refuted other valid cognitions in detail, in order to summarize, he says:

original: rnam pa gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: â€œIn one wayâ€ and so on.

original: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o //ğŸ”½'on te mngon sum yang yin la /
analyzed: don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'o // 'on te mngon sum yang yin la /
translated: The object is twofold: manifest and hidden.ğŸ”½But isnâ€™t there also another kind, which is both manifest and not manifest,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa yang yin pa dang / mngon sum yang ma yin la mngon sum ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa yang yin pa dang / mngon sum yang ma yin la mngon sum ma yin pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: and which is neither manifest nor not manifest?

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this he says â€œBothâ€ and so on.

original: gcig la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i chos su ma 'dres par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i chos su ma 'dres par rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a single thing is not mixed with unmixed natures that are mutually incompatible.

original: bdag nyid nyams par thal bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid nyams par thal bar gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be destroyed.

original: 'di ltar dngos su rtag pa la sogs pas chod pa med par ji lta bar gzung ba'i don nges pa'i rgyu khyad par can gyi shes pa skye bar byed pa'i don ni mngon sum zhes bya'o //ğŸ”½de ltar byas na sgra skad @70a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos su rtag pa la sogs pas chod pa med par ji lta bar gzung ba'i don nges pa'i rgyu khyad par can gyi shes pa skye bar byed pa'i don ni mngon sum zhes bya'o // de ltar byas na sgra skad @70a * //
translated: Thus, that which is the cause of the arising of a cognition that ascertains the object as it is apprehended without interruption by such things as permanence is called perception.

original: cig ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: cig ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: If that is so, then such things as the statement â€œsound is momentaryâ€ are not meaningful because they are not perception.

original: gang gis rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa dag gis mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la gcig byed pa dang mi byed par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa dang skyed par mi byed pa dag gis mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba dngos po gcig la gcig byed pa dang mi byed par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a single thing has the nature of both perception and non-perception, because it is that which generates consciousness and that which does not generate consciousness.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not reasonable that it has the nature of neither,ğŸ”½because it is not reasonable that a single thing is both that which performs an action and that which does not perform an action.

original: dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa ni rang bzhin gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi rang bzhin dgag pa ni rang bzhin gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the negation of the intrinsic reality of one thing does not occur without the establishment of another intrinsic reality.

original: du ma ni gcig la byed pa po mi byed par 'gal te /
analyzed: du ma ni gcig la byed pa po mi byed par 'gal te /
translated: And, many are contradictory as the agent of one.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
translated: For example, form and taste in respect to the visual consciousness.

original: gcig dang du ma la'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma la'ang de bzhin te /
translated: And, one and many are contradictory as the object of one.

original: dper na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag la gzugs bzhin no //ğŸ”½de'i phyir / gcig nyid shes pa gcig la ni //
analyzed: dper na mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dag la gzugs bzhin no // de'i phyir / gcig nyid shes pa gcig la ni //
translated: For example, form in respect to the auditory and visual consciousnesses.ğŸ”½Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: One intrinsic reality is not the object of one cognition.

original: de lta bas na don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na don ni rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
translated: Thus, the object is of two kinds.

original: de la sgra las byung ba la sogs pa tshad ma yin na mngon sum pa'i don la yin nam lkog tu gyur ba la yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: de la sgra las byung ba la sogs pa tshad ma yin na mngon sum pa'i don la yin nam lkog tu gyur ba la yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: In this regard, if the means of valid cognition such as verbal testimony are valid, are they valid in respect to the evident or the obscure? This is the twofold division.

original: de la re zhig dang po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po la ni ma yin no //
translated: In this regard, first, they are not valid in respect to the evident.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mngon sum gyi khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi khongs su 'dus par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are included in direct perception.

original: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa'i yul don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba la sogs pa'i yul don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object, the meaning, is not different from the sound.

original: ci ste mngon sum gyis rtogs na yang dus phyis yang de dag gis rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum gyis rtogs na yang dus phyis yang de dag gis rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if it is understood through perception, then later on, it would be understood by those two.

original: de'i phyir yang dran pa bzhin don med de zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dran pa bzhin don med de zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is pointless, like memory.

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa bzhin du tshad ma nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is not a valid cognition, like memory, because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang don lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa na dngos su yin pa'am gzhan la yang brten nas te bar du chod pa yin /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang don lkog tu gyur pa'i don gyi yul can yin pa na dngos su yin pa'am gzhan la yang brten nas te bar du chod pa yin /
translated: In the second case, if it has an object that is a hidden object, then it is either direct or based on another, that is, it is obstructed.

original: de la re zhig dngos su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos su ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not direct,

original: de mngon sum pa'i don bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum pa'i don bzhin du lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would follow that it is not a hidden object, like the object of perception.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir dngos su shes pa skyed par mi byed pa de nyid kyi phyir 'di lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir dngos su shes pa skyed par mi byed pa de nyid kyi phyir 'di lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it does not generate knowledge directly, it is called hidden.

original: gal te dngos su shes pa skyed na ji ltar 'di lkog tu gyur pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o //ğŸ”½gzhan la brten nas yar lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa 'brel ba las sam //
analyzed: gal te dngos su shes pa skyed na ji ltar 'di lkog tu gyur pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya'o // gzhan la brten nas yar lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa 'brel ba las sam //
translated: If it does produce cognition directly, then how can it be said to be imperceptible?

original: ma 'brel pa las yin /ğŸ”½khyad par snang ba las @70b sam ;
analyzed: ma 'brel pa las yin / khyad par snang ba las @70b sam ;
translated: The answer is that the object is imperceptible in relation to another, i.e., in relation to a cognition that is not related to it or is related to it.ğŸ”½Is it related to it or not?ğŸ”½Is it related to it in virtue of appearing as a particular or not?

original: khyad par mi snang ba las yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par mi snang ba las yin zhes bya ba phyogs bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: khyad par snang ba zhes bya ba ni dper na du ba'i phyir las rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa ming gis khyad par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par snang ba zhes bya ba ni dper na du ba'i phyir las rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa ming gis khyad par rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: â€œRelated to it in virtue of appearing as a particularâ€ is like, for example, the cognition of a particular by name, such as grass or leaves, from smoke.

original: khyad par mi snang ba ni dper na du ba las rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i me tsam rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyad par mi snang ba ni dper na du ba las rigs mi mthun pa las log pa'i me tsam rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: â€œRelated to it in virtue of not appearing as a particularâ€ is like, for example, the cognition of mere fire, which is the opposite of what is not of the same kind as smoke.

original: de la 'brel pa med pa las rtogs na nges pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'brel pa med pa las rtogs na nges pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is cognized from that which is not related to it, then it would be uncertain,

original: gang ci rung ba las dngos po thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ci rung ba las dngos po thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: because anything at all could be cognized from anything at all.

original: ci ste tha dad par snang ba de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi khyad par mi 'thad par 'gyur te khyad par gyis rjes 'gro mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad par snang ba de'i tshe bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi khyad par mi 'thad par 'gyur te khyad par gyis rjes 'gro mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they appear to be different, then the distinction between the probandum and the logical argument is not tenable, because the distinction is not suitable to be a universal.

original: de lta yin dang ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang ma nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the case, then it would be indeterminate.

original: ci ste khyad par med pa snang ba de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste khyad par med pa snang ba de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If the distinction does not appear, then it is included within inference itself.

original: gang yang lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang lkog tu gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, â€œThat which is hidden . . .â€

original: de yi khyad par ma nges pa //
analyzed: de yi khyad par ma nges pa //
translated: â€œIts distinction is indeterminateâ€

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par snang bas stong pa rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni don tsam ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par snang bas stong pa rigs mi mthun pa las log pa ni don tsam ma nges pa ste /
translated: means that the appearance of the distinction, which is the opposite of what is dissimilar, is not ascertained as just the object.

original: dper na du ba las me tsam rtogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba las me tsam rtogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the realization of just fire from smoke.

original: de lta bur gyur pa yang gsal rab tu rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa yang gsal rab tu rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: That which is like that is also a clear inference,

original: 'brel ba mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir du bas me rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba mthong ba'i thabs can yin pa'i phyir du bas me rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a means of seeing the connection, like the realization of fire from smoke.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las tshad ma gzhan pa rtag pa ste nyi shu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i dka' 'grel las tshad ma gzhan pa rtag pa ste nyi shu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-fourth chapter in the commentary on the Compendium of Reality.

original: // / gzhan gyi bdag nyid cha shas ni //
analyzed: // / gzhan gyi bdag nyid cha shas ni //
translated: The parts of the other nature

original: phra rab kyis kyang ma 'dres pa //
analyzed: phra rab kyis kyang ma 'dres pa //
translated: are not mixed even by the subtle.

original: zhes bya de bsgrub par bya ba'i don du rgol ba dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya de bsgrub par bya ba'i don du rgol ba dgod pa sngon du 'gro ba can bshad pa ni /
translated: In order to prove that, the opponentâ€™s position is stated first and then explained:

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: â€œWhen . . .â€ and so on.

original: don byed nus pa gang yin yod //
analyzed: don byed nus pa gang yin yod //
translated: Whatever is able to perform a function exists.

original: gzhan ni yod pa min par brjod //ğŸ”½de dag gcig la 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa min par brjod // de dag gcig la 'jug pa ni //
translated: The other is said not to exist.

original: rigs pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: It is not logical for them to engage one thingğŸ”½because that would be contradictory.

original: zhes gang smras pa la ngo tsha med pa bdag rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa la ngo tsha med pa bdag rtsod par byed de /
translated: The shameless one argues:

analyzed: dngos po thams cad spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyis du ma'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: All things are of the nature of many universals and instances,

original: dper na khra bor snang ba'i nor bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khra bor snang ba'i nor bu lta bu'o //
translated: like a multicolored gem.

original: gang gis gcig la 'jug pa ni rigs pa ma yin zhes brjod pa de'i yod pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'gal /
analyzed: gang gis gcig la 'jug pa ni rigs pa ma yin zhes brjod pa de'i yod pa la sogs pa ji ltar 'gal /
translated: When it is said that it is not logical for them to engage one thing, how is that contradictory to their existence and so on?

analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byed pa dang mi byed pa dang gcig dang du ma nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo // gal te rtsod pa 'di gal te rang bsgrub bya la nus zhes @71a * //
translated: The words â€œetc.â€ include the arguments of activity, non-activity, unity, and plurality, etc.

original: bya ba la sogs pas lan btab zin pa de lta na yang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas lan btab zin pa de lta na yang rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: If this dispute is answered by saying, â€œIf it is able to prove itself, etc.,â€ then, in order to teach in detail,

original: rtsod pa gzhan bstan par bya ba'i don du yang brjod do //
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan bstan par bya ba'i don du yang brjod do //
translated: or in order to teach other disputes, it is also stated.

original: de la spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du kha yar ba'i sbyor ba gnyis bshad pa ni ;
analyzed: de la spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du kha yar ba'i sbyor ba gnyis bshad pa ni ;
translated: Therein, in order to prove the nature of the universal and the particular, respectively, two syllogisms are stated:

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first is â€œThe entity, etc.â€

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni cung zad brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni cung zad brjod par 'dod pa'i dngos po bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The entity is the entity that is slightly desired to be expressed, such as a pot, etc.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dang mi mtshungs par 'gyur na ste /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de snam bu la sogs pa dngos po gzhan dang mi mtshungs par 'gyur na ste /
translated: If that entity, such as a pot, etc., were not similar to other entities, such as a cloth, etc.,

original: gal te de las ldog par gyur na de'i tshe de nam mkha'i me tog las khyad par med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de las ldog par gyur na de'i tshe de nam mkha'i me tog las khyad par med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, then it would be no different from a sky flower.

original: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po gzhan las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po gzhan las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be completely devoid of any other entity.

original: dngos po gzhan las ldog pa ni nam mkha'i me tog spangs nas go skabs srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan las ldog pa ni nam mkha'i me tog spangs nas go skabs srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for anything to exist that is devoid of any other entity, except for a sky flower.

original: de lta bas na dngos po de nam mkha'i me tog dang mi mtshungs pa nyid 'dod pa na /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po de nam mkha'i me tog dang mi mtshungs pa nyid 'dod pa na /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that that entity is not the same as a sky flower,

original: dngos po gzhan dang mtshungs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba nyid spyir khas blangs bar bya dgos pa'i phyir spyi yin par grub po //

original: 'o na ji ltar khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But how can it be the nature of a particular?

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: mi 'dra ba dang bral zhe na //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dang bral zhe na //
translated: If it is devoid of the dissimilar,

original: de las tha dad mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de las tha dad mi 'grub po //
translated: it is not established as different from that.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang mi 'dra ba nyid de dang bral bar gyur na ste /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid snam bu la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang mi 'dra ba nyid de dang bral bar gyur na ste /
translated: If that entity, such as a pot, were devoid of the dissimilar, that is, if it were devoid of the nature of cloth, etc.,

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa de dang mi 'dra bar gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa de dang mi 'dra bar gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If that were not so, that is, if it were not like that, then

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bum pa'o //
translated: this is a pot,

original: 'di ni snam bu'o zhes bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad du grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni snam bu'o zhes bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad du grub par mi 'gyur te /

original: rang rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: like their own individual natures.

original: tha dad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang yin te /
translated: And they are different,

analyzed: de lta bas na khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yang grub po //
translated: therefore, they are established as having the nature of being different.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: The thing that is desired,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gnyis po 'di nyid kyi don rgyas par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba gnyis po 'di nyid kyi don rgyas par sgrub par byed do //
translated: etc. establishes the meaning of this very two-fold application extensively.

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i 'thad pa gzhan bshad do //
translated: The other aspect, etc. explains another logical possibility for establishing the universal.

analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te dngos po dngos po gzhan dang mi mtshungs par gyur na /
translated: The other aspect means if a thing were not similar to another thing,ğŸ”½then.

analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha mi dad pa'i blo bum pa la sogs pa kho na la 'gyur gyi bya rog gi @71b se la sogs pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba de la rgyu brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: At that time, why is it that the cognition of a thing that is not different from a thing is only in regard to a pot, etc., and not in regard to a crowâ€™s beak, etc.? You must state the cause of that.

analyzed: 'dra ba nyid rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that similarity is the cause,

analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid spyi yin pa'i phyir spyi grub ste /

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa kho na la rjes su 'gro ba can gyi nus pa yod kyi /

analyzed: bya rog gis so la sogs pa la ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'i nus pa'i rang bzhin de rgyu yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de yang 'di nyid kyis te / 'dra bas brjod pa yin te zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: That is also explained by this:ğŸ”½â€œSimilarity is the cause of the expression of a universal.â€

analyzed: 'di la yang 'dra ba bzhin du lan mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

analyzed: 'di nyid spyi'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de lta bas na bum pa la sogs pa thams cad dngos po'i ngo bos phan tshun du tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya bar grub po //

translated: [The opponent:] In order to prove difference,

analyzed: gal te ldog mtshams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [he] says, â€œIf the boundaries, etc.â€

analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa mi 'dra ba dang bral bar gyur na de'i tshe tha mi dad pa'i phyir de dag las te /
translated: If pots, etc. were free from dissimilarity, then because of non-difference, from those,

analyzed: snam bu la sogs pa las bum pa la sogs pa tha dad du mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: bdag gi ngo bo bzhin du tha mi dad pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

original: 'di don dam par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di don dam par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

analyzed: rnam pa de dag kyang kha cig ni rjes su 'jug pa'i glos gzung bar bya ba yin la /

analyzed: @72a * // de gang dag rjes su 'jug pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba de dag ni rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis spyi zhes bsgrags la /
translated: Those that are to be grasped by the mind as a universal are proclaimed to be a universal because they are a universal.

analyzed: de las gzhan bzlog pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni ldog pa'i phyir khyad par zhes brtag go //
translated: Those that are to be grasped by the mind as a particular, which are different from that, are to be grasped as a particular because they are a particular.

analyzed: de ba rjes su 'jug pa'i blo ni dngos po dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can dag go //

analyzed: ldog pa'i blo ni 'di ni bum pa yin gyi snam bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa can dag go //
translated: The mind that grasps a particular has the aspect of difference, as in â€œThis is a pot, not a woolen cloth.â€ğŸ”½Therefore, in response to this,

original: de'i phyir 'di la lan 'debs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la lan 'debs par byed pa ni /

analyzed: spyi dang khyad par phan tshun du //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir spyi gang yin pa de nyid khyad par yin nam 'on te spyi yang gzhan yin la khyad par yang gzhan yin la zhes bya ba'i phyogs gnyis so //

translated: With regard to the first position, if a universal and a particular have the same nature, there would be a jumble.ğŸ”½If that were the case, there would be no difference in the way things are apprehended, and there would be no difference in the way things are expressed, because the expression â€œThis is a universalâ€ and the expression â€œThis is a particularâ€ would not exist.ğŸ”½Because of that, the distinction â€œThis is a universal,â€ â€œThis is a particularâ€ would not exist.

original: ci ste 'chol bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas phyogs gnyis pa la rten par byed pa de'i tshe gcig gi rang bzhin gcig ma yin par khas len par byed na du ma nyid du ste /

translated: If a universal and a particular have different natures, then a universal would not be a universal, and a particular would not be a particular.ğŸ”½If a universal and a particular have different natures, then a universal would not be a universal, and a particular would not be a particular.

analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dag rang bzhin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur gyi de lta na ni 'di dag ma 'chol ba nyid du ni 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gal te 'di dag du ma nyid du ni 'gyur na /

original: yang ci ste /

analyzed: gcig las tha mi dad pa na dngos po gcig gi @72b rang bzhin du de dag kyang tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: dngos po gcig po de rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa de ni chos tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig po de rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa de las ldog pa de ni chos tha dad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: That one entity is the reason for positing the difference of properties as homogeneous and heterogeneous.

original: de lta bas na gang gi phyir brtags pa'i du ma srid pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig la yang dag pa'i gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi phyir brtags pa'i du ma srid pa de'i phyir dngos po gcig la yang dag pa'i gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because many imagined entities are possible, a real entity cannot be established as having a dual nature.

original: yang gi sgra ni spyir chos tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni spyir chos tha dad pa sngon du 'gro ba tsam sgrub na grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word â€œalsoâ€ indicates that if the mere prior existence of different properties is established, then establishment itself is also indicated.

original: 'di snyam du mi'i seng gi la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa yin to /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mi'i seng gi la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa yin to /
translated: If you think that the example of the lionâ€™s milk and so on is not established,

original: 'di ltar mi'i seng ge la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig yin yang yang dag pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid mi 'gal bar dmigs pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi'i seng ge la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig yin yang yang dag pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid mi 'gal bar dmigs pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /

original: gang yang mi'i seng ge la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang yang mi'i seng ge la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the verse says, â€œThe lion of men, etc.â€

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu gzi la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni nor bu gzi la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase â€œetc.â€ includes the lion of jewels, etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mi'i seng ge'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mi'i seng ge'o //
translated: â€œ Thatâ€ refers to the lion of men.

original: 'dus pa ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: â€œ Assemblyâ€ means collection.

original: 'di la gzugs yod pas na gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs yod pas na gzugs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: â€œ Having formâ€ means having form.

original: gcig gi gzugs dang ldan zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gcig gi gzugs dang ldan zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: â€œ Having the form of oneâ€ is the analysis of the sentence.

original: 'dis ni phyir rgol ba la dpe ma grub par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyir rgol ba la dpe ma grub par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the example is not established for the opponent.

analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la mi'i seng ge yan lag can gcig bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: The Buddhist does not prove that the lion of men is one whole,

analyzed: rdul phra rab du ma tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an assembly of many atoms.

original: de la gcig nyid dgag pa la tshad ma bshad pa /
analyzed: de la gcig nyid dgag pa la tshad ma bshad pa /

original: gang sna tshogs pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sna tshogs pa de ni gcig ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is various is not one.

original: rin po che'i rigs du ma'i tshogs pa bzhin no //ğŸ”½mi'i seng ge yang sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs du ma'i tshogs pa bzhin no // mi'i seng ge yang sna tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa'am /
translated: like a collection of many kinds of jewels.ğŸ”½The lion among men is also various.

original: khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction in nature, or the observation of a contradiction in the cause of a distinction.

original: gcig yin na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ste /
analyzed: gcig yin na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan sna tshogs su snang ba mi 'thad pa ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ste /
translated: If it were one, it would not be tenable for the cause of the various appearances of two natures to exist. This is the valid cognition that refutes.

original: tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni snang ba tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni snang ba tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for positing difference is the difference in appearance.

original: phyogs gcig bsgrib pa na thams cad bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ba yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig bsgrib pa na thams cad bsgribs par thal bar 'gyur ba yang gnod pa can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: Also, the consequence that if one part is obscured, all would be obscured is a valid cognition that refutes.

original: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa dag gcig la cig car rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa dag gcig la cig car rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for something that possesses the contradictory properties of being obscured and unobscured to exist simultaneously in one thing.

original: gal te rdul phra rab du ma 'dus pa tsam mi'i seng ge yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab du ma 'dus pa tsam mi'i seng ge yin na /
translated: If the mere collection of many subtle particles is the lion among men,

original: 'o na ji ltar gnyis kyis ngo bo dang ldan pa'i gcig gi dngos por nges pa'i shes pa yin zhe na /ğŸ”½rdul @74a * //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gnyis kyis ngo bo dang ldan pa'i gcig gi dngos por nges pa'i shes pa yin zhe na / rdul @74a * //
translated: Well then, how is it that a cognition is ascertained as a single entity that possesses a dual nature?

original: phran de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phran de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is â€œThose minute particles . . . â€ and so on.

original: mi dang seng ge dag gi cha gang yin pa de dag dang ldan pa ste snang bar byas pa'i ngo shes pa gang yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi dang seng ge dag gi cha gang yin pa de dag dang ldan pa ste snang bar byas pa'i ngo shes pa gang yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The cognition that perceives the presence of those parts of a human and a lion is called â€œa cognition that perceives a single entity that possesses a dual nature.â€

original: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab de nyid rang bzhin gyis de lta bur gyur pa'i ngo bo shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa de'i tshe yan lag can gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdul phra rab de nyid rang bzhin gyis de lta bur gyur pa'i ngo bo shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa de'i tshe yan lag can gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: When those minute particles are the cause of a cognition that perceives an entity that has that kind of nature, then what purpose is served by postulating another entity that possesses parts?

original: de dag gi de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin de yang gang las byung zhe na bshad pa /ğŸ”½khyad par can gyi rkyen 'byung phyir //
analyzed: de dag gi de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin de yang gang las byung zhe na bshad pa / khyad par can gyi rkyen 'byung phyir //
translated: If you ask, â€œWhat is the source of that kind of nature in those entities?â€ the response is:ğŸ”½Because a distinctive condition arises.

original: rgyu khyad par can las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par can las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is, because it arises from a distinctive cause.

original: de la khyad par can ni sbyor ba dang 'gro ba'i khyad par 'grub par byed pa'i las dang rigs mthun pa'i las byung ba'i nur nur po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyad par can ni sbyor ba dang 'gro ba'i khyad par 'grub par byed pa'i las dang rigs mthun pa'i las byung ba'i nur nur po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special is the kalala, etc., which are the action that produces the special of the union and the going, and the action that arises in conformity with the type.

original: mi'i seng ge rnam par dpyod pa 'di nyid kyis nor bu gzi la sogs pa yang bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi'i seng ge rnam par dpyod pa 'di nyid kyis nor bu gzi la sogs pa yang bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: The lion among men has analyzed this very thing, and he has explained the gem, the sun, etc.

original: de dag gi sun 'byin pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //ğŸ”½thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo yis //
analyzed: de dag gi sun 'byin pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o // thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo yis //
translated: Therefore, one should not state a separate refutation of them.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa ma yin //
translated: As for what was said, â€œAll are not different from the nature of entities,â€

original: zhes gang smras pa 'di la don byed par mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa 'di la don byed par mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, â€œThe inability to perform a function,â€ and so on.

analyzed: don byed nus pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid dngos po zhes bya ba'i gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is able to perform a function is the nature of an entity. There is no other.

analyzed: gal te de thams cad rjes su 'gro ba yin na yang thams cad thams cad kyi bya ba byed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de yang thams cad la khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since there is no difference between them,

analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin /

analyzed: gal te de nyid yin na de'i tshe de rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is itself, then since it is a universal,

analyzed: dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa yang sngon pos bsgrub par bya ba'i gos kha bsgyur ba la sogs pa'i don gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin gnyis pa med pa'i phyir gcig nyid yod pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad dngos po gcig tu 'gyur bas gcig du ma'i rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba dam bca' ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since there is no second nature, since one exists, all of the world would be one thing. Therefore, the thesis that one has the aspect of many is undermined.

analyzed: ci ste dngos po nyid sngon po la sogs pa las gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: But if a thing is something else that is different from blue, etc.,

analyzed: gzigs zan gyis 'dod pa'i yod pa yin no //
translated: The VaiÅ›eá¹£ikas say that existence is what is desired by the eye.

analyzed: dper na gzegs zan te gzegs ma za bar 'dod pa'i ji ltar yod pa zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i dngos po nyid ces bya @74b ba yin na /

analyzed: de lta na yang gcig la du ma nyid mi rigs pas gsal rab pa yin te /

analyzed: gcig tu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa de dag ni tha dad pa yin te /

original: grang ba dang tsha ba dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba dag lta bu'o //

analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dag la yang 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: Universals and instances also possess contradictory properties.

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir de dag tha dad par gsal lo //
translated: Because they are the nature of the opposite of the pervader, it is clear that they are different.

analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan gyi ngo bo dang rjes su 'gro ba 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa yin na yang tha dad du mi 'dod pa de'i tshe gang yang 'di sngon po dang ser po dag gi ci zhig ltar khyad par gyi ngo bos tha dad pa
translated: If you do not assert that things are different from each other even though they possess the nature of other aspects and are concomitant with contradictory attributes, then how could you assert that blue and yellow are different from each other by way of their specific natures?ğŸ”½Because it would follow that they are one.

original: 'dod pa der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa der mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained in the following lines:

original: blo tha dad phyir gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: blo tha dad phyir gzugs la sogs //
translated: Because cognition is different, form and so on

original: gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'ang min //ğŸ”½zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig tu thal bar 'gyur ba'ang min // zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Do not become one.

analyzed: ku m'a ra ri las sngon po la sogs pa tha dad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: KumÄrila says that because blue and so on are described as different,ğŸ”½the example is not established.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ri ri la'i lug skyis yang ma nges pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ku m'a ri ri la'i lug skyis yang ma nges pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: The phrase â€œfor exampleâ€ and so on indicates that KumÄrilaâ€™s response is inconclusive.

original: kha dog lnga po ni kha dog sna tshogs pa'o //ğŸ”½de ji ltar sngon po zhes bya ba'am /ğŸ”½ser po zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: kha dog lnga po ni kha dog sna tshogs pa'o // de ji ltar sngon po zhes bya ba'am / ser po zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The five colors are the various colors.ğŸ”½How is it that they are apprehended as the desired form by being called blue,ğŸ”½or yellow,

analyzed: dmar po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar 'dod pa'i gzugs 'dzin te /
translated: or red, and so on?

original: gzugs nges pa de bzhin du ngo bo du ma'i dngos po sna tshogs pa rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis sam /
analyzed: gzugs nges pa de bzhin du ngo bo du ma'i dngos po sna tshogs pa rang dang gzhan gyi ngo bo dag gis sam /
translated: Just as form is ascertained, so too the various things that are of multiple natures are ascertained by their own and othersâ€™ natures.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i dbang gis tha dad du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo dag gis yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid gnyis kyi bdag nyid du 'dod pa'i dbang gis tha dad du nges pa yin no //
translated: Just as form is ascertained, so too, due to the power of asserting that a thing that is a manifold nature exists by way of its own and other natures, or by way of the natures of universals and particulars, or by way of the nature of both existence and nonexistence, it is ascertained as different.

original: gang gi tshe tha dad du nges par gzung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha dad du nges par gzung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When one wishes to apprehend it as ascertained as different,

original: de nges par 'dzin par byed la /
analyzed: de nges par 'dzin par byed la /
translated: then one apprehends it as ascertained.

original: gang gi tshe tha mi dad pa ste spyi nges par gzung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha mi dad pa ste spyi nges par gzung bar 'dod pa de'i tshe nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: When one wishes to apprehend it as ascertained as undifferentiated, that is, as a universal, then one apprehends it as ascertained.

original: gang gi tshe spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid dngos po gcig par skad cig gis rtogs pa de'i tshe gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rtsod pa 'jig ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid dngos po gcig par skad cig gis rtogs pa de'i tshe gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa'i tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rtsod pa 'jig ste /
translated: When one realizes that a thing that is a universal and a particular is a single entity in an instant, then the dispute about whether it is different or not different and so on is destroyed.

original: nges par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: nges par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of â€œone does not apprehend it as ascertainedâ€ is this.

original: khra bo'i dngos po mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khra bo'i dngos po mngon sum nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a multicolored thing is perceived directly.

original: de las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa rtsod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa la sogs pa rtsod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The dispute over whether or not the universal is different from the particulars is as follows:

original: tha dad pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not different from the different,

original: spyi yang gong bu bzhin du rang gi ngo bo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /ğŸ”½spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi yang gong bu bzhin du rang gi ngo bo tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'am / spyi las tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: the universal would be as different as the individual things themselves.

original: tha dad pa @75a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa @75a * //
translated: Or, because it is not different from the universal,

original: rnams kyang spyi bzhin du tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½de bzhin du tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i spyi dang khyad par dag ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras gcig dang phan tshun 'gal ba dag dang de bzhin du de bzhin nyid spyi'o //
analyzed: rnams kyang spyi bzhin du tha mi dad par thal bar 'gyur ro // de bzhin du tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i spyi dang khyad par dag ji ltar 'gal bar 'gyur ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras gcig dang phan tshun 'gal ba dag dang de bzhin du de bzhin nyid spyi'o //
translated: the different would be as undifferentiated as the universal.ğŸ”½In the same way, how could the universal and the particular be mutually contradictory, and so on?ğŸ”½The words â€œand so onâ€ are meant to include the contradictions of identity and mutual contradiction.

original: de nyid khyad par ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid khyad par ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, such statements as â€œsuchness is the universal, and it is the particularâ€ are to be understood as contradictory.

original: de lta na thams cad du khra bo rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na thams cad du khra bo rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, a multicolored thing would be perceived as a whole.

original: rim dang cig car dag gis ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas /ğŸ”½ngo bo du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag gis ma yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu nas / ngo bo du ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: by the power of desire, whether gradually or suddenly.

original: rim ma ma cig car gyis 'di'i spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: rim ma ma cig car gyis 'di'i spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ni brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: The nature of the many is posited as the nature of the one, whether gradually or suddenly, by the power of desire.

original: gang gi tshe cig car spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo'am yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bor brjod par 'dod na de 'di'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe cig car spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bo'am yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bor brjod par 'dod na de 'di'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When one desires to express the nature of the one as the nature of the many, or as the nature of existence and nonexistence, then it is posited as its nature.

original: ci ste rim gyis yod pa'i ngo bo dang med pa'i ngo bo'am spyi dang khyad par gyi brjod par 'dod na de'i tshe 'di de'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag go //

translated: Therefore, it should be said that it arises from its own cause.

original: de yang ga las she na ni rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de yang ga las she na ni rgyu'i brgyud pa thog ma med pa can yin no //
translated: And what is that? The continuum of causes is beginningless.

original: dbang po ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dbang po'o //
translated: The sense faculty is the sense faculty.

original: bdud rtsi ni sle tres so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ni sle tres so //
translated: The nectar is the citron.

original: sogs pa'i sgras re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word â€œetc.â€ is to be applied to each.

original: dper na sle tres la sogs pas rims la sogs pa zhi ba dang yul dang dbang po dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang khyad par can gyi shes pa skyed pa la nus kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du
analyzed: dper na sle tres la sogs pas rims la sogs pa zhi ba dang yul dang dbang po dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang khyad par can gyi shes pa skyed pa la nus kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin pa de bzhin du
translated: For example, the citron, etc. are capable of producing a special cognition in the case of pacifying fever, etc., but not in the case of others.

original: gcig tu rtogs pa la yang 'ga' zhig kho na nus pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa la yang 'ga' zhig kho na nus pa nges pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, in the case of a single cognition, the capacity is determined in some cases.

original: yang na dbang po'i sgras ba ru ra brjod la sogs pa'i sgra tshogs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang po'i sgras ba ru ra brjod la sogs pa'i sgra tshogs pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the term â€œsense facultyâ€ refers to the sense faculty of taste, and so on.

original: gal te sngon po sogs las zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ma grub par dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te sngon po sogs las zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe ma grub par dogs pa yin te /
translated: The example is not established, since it is said, â€œIf it is said that it is from blue, and so on,â€ and so on.

original: gal te mig sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo bstan par 'dod kyi rjes su 'jug pa bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung bas bstan to //
analyzed: gal te mig sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo bstan par 'dod kyi rjes su 'jug pa bstan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung bas bstan to //
translated: If it is asserted that the nature of the eye is the opposite of blue, and so on, and it is not asserted that it is the opposite of that which is subsequent, this is taught by the term â€œif.â€

original: de'i tshe mig sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would not generate the consciousness of blue, and so on.

original: de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be the opposite of the nature that generates it.

original: gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is the opposite of the nature that generates something does not generate it.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i @77a * //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i @77a * //
translated: For example, the nature that generates the consciousness of blue, and so on, does not generate the consciousness of yellow, and so on.

original: sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i rnam pa ni sngon po log pa'i shes pa de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa'i rnam pa ni sngon po log pa'i shes pa de skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The aspect that is the opposite of blue, etc., is not the producer of the cognition that is the opposite of blue.ğŸ”½The eye is the producer of the cognition of blue, etc., from the opposite of blue.

original: mig kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i sngon po ldog pa las skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mig kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i sngon po ldog pa las skyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab byed 'gal ba dmigs pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the reductio argument that the observation of something incompatible with the pervader is the reductio of the opponent.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa yin no zhes /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa yin no zhes /
translated: Therefore, it is the opposite.

original: gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa de ni skyed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang skyed par byed pa de ni skyed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is the producer of something is not the opposite of the nature of the producer.

original: dper na sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i sngon po'i rang gi rang bzhin las mi ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i sngon po'i rang gi rang bzhin las mi ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the blue that is the producer of the cognition of blue is not the opposite of the nature of blue.ğŸ”½The eye is the producer of the cognition of blue.

original: mig kyang sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de ltar sngon po la sogs pa yang phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mig kyang sngon po'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs de ltar sngon po la sogs pa yang phyogs su byas nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is an argument from nature.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir thal ba las bzlog pa'i sgo nas dpe ma bzung ba nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa'i phyir thal ba las bzlog pa'i sgo nas dpe ma bzung ba nyid du bshad do //
translated: Thus, because the reverse of the reductio is not accepted, it is explained that the example is not established.

original: ci ste yang de las ldog par yang gyur la de skyed par byed pa yin mod /
analyzed: ci ste yang de las ldog par yang gyur la de skyed par byed pa yin mod /
translated: But if you think that although the reverse of the reductio is the case, it is still the case that the eye sense faculty generates consciousness,

original: de'i phyir thal ba sgrub pa ma nges pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir thal ba sgrub pa ma nges pa yin no snyam na /
translated: then the establishment of the reductio is uncertain.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: rna ba la sogs pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de nyid du thal ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa yang sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa de nyid du thal ba ni bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma ste /
translated: The absurd consequence that the ear sense faculty and so on would also generate the consciousness of blue and so on is a valid refutation of the reverse of the above premise.

original: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no difference in the way that they are distinct from blue and so on.

original: mig sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa'i tha dad pa des rna ba la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig sngon po la sogs pa las tha dad pa gang yin pa'i tha dad pa des rna ba la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The difference that the eye sense faculty has from blue and so on is the same difference that the ear sense faculty and so on have from blue and so on.

original: ci ltar mig gi sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa de bzhin du rna ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci ltar mig gi sngon po la sogs pa las ldog pa de bzhin du rna ba yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that just as the eye is distinguished from blue, etc., so also is the ear.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies:

original: gal te khyad par med par de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa tsam gtan tshig nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te khyad par med par de skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin las ldog pa tsam gtan tshig nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin te /
translated: If you state the mere reversal of the nature of that which produces it, without distinction, as the reason, then the reason is unestablished.

original: mig la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med par ldog par ma grub po //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rang bzhin las khyad par med par ldog par ma grub po //
translated: The eye, etc., are not established as reversed without distinction from the nature of producing the consciousness of blue, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa der yang skyed par byed par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa de dag gi rang bzhin gang yin pa der yang skyed par byed par 'dod de /
translated: Because that which is the nature of those eyes, etc., is also asserted to be the producer.

original: de kho nas 'bras bu de bya ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de kho nas 'bras bu de bya ba yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la nges pa ci zhig yod de /
translated: What certainty is there in this: â€œJust that produces that effect, not anotherâ€?

original: gzhan yang byed la de yang byed pa la 'gal ba ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang byed la de yang byed pa la 'gal ba ma mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, it is seen that it produces another, and that also produces another.

original: gal te yang khyad par @77b med par ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe rang gi rang bzhin las kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang khyad par @77b med par ldog par 'gyur na de'i tshe rang gi rang bzhin las kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were to cease without distinction, then it would cease even from its own intrinsic reality.

original: de lta yin dang rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that it would be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las ldog par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams rang gi ngo bo las ldog par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical for things to cease from their own intrinsic reality.

original: ji ste rang gi rang bzhin spangs nas mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa las ldog pa de gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ji ste rang gi rang bzhin spangs nas mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis skyed par byed pa las ldog pa de gtan tshigs nyid du 'dod na de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you assert that it is a reason that it ceases from generating another eye faculty, etc., having abandoned its own intrinsic reality, then in that case the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gzhan las ldog pa de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gzhan las ldog pa de'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because in that case, it would not be its intrinsic reality that ceases from another intrinsic reality.

original: de skyed par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de skyed par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it does not generate that.

original: thams cad rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi ngo bos skyed par byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: Everything generates its own intrinsic reality, but not the intrinsic reality of another.

original: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang gis 'di skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'dod pa de las ldog pas ji ltar skyed par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang gis 'di skyed par byed pa'i zhes 'dod pa de las ldog pas ji ltar skyed par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: But since it is the opposite of that nature by which it is asserted that it generates itself, how could it be a generator? Therefore the reason is indefinite.

original: ci ste ma yin par 'jug pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du bsgrubs na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ma yin par 'jug pas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid du bsgrubs na de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if it is established that it is not that nature because it engages in nonbeing, then it is the establishment of what has already been established.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni phan tshun dben pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni phan tshun dben pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of things is asserted to be the state of being mutually exclusive.

original: de skyed ngo bos min zhes bya ba 'di ni de yang yin la skyed pa yang yin pas de skyed pas te /
analyzed: de skyed ngo bos min zhes bya ba 'di ni de yang yin la skyed pa yang yin pas de skyed pas te /
translated: This is called â€œnot generating by natureâ€ because it is that and also it generates.
